reviews.text: I&#39;ve been to this location multiple times. It&#39;s a great location-- very accessible by walking/public transport and you can shop in the Pru before/after eating!<br><br>The pasta campagna is arguably the best pasta dish they serve. To be fair, I haven&#39;t tried every single pasta dish they offer, but ever since I discovered this one I haven&#39;t felt the need to try any of the others. I get it every time I come here now.<br><br>I also got the filet mignon one day because #TreatYoSelf. For around $30, you get a very generous portion of beef, as well as mashed potatoes and green beans. I split the steak with a friend, and even the half-portion was comparable in size to what you might get at a $$$$ upscale restaurant. I&#39;m sure the quality is better at those fancy places, but honestly the steak was so tender, flavorful, and cooked just right so I wasn&#39;t mad about it. I didn&#39;t get a steak knife so I cut the steak with a dull butter knife and it worked perfectly fine. This was tender enough for me. Not top notch, but definitely still impressive in my opinion.<br><br>I recommend the Georgia Peach if you&#39;re into &#34;girly&#34; fruity/sweet drinks, which is right up my alley. Maybe I&#39;m biased because I love peach flavored things. <br><br>I took one star off because the service can be suuuuper slow. Almost every time I dine in, I wait so long to order and then I wait even longer to get the check. Also the last time I went, they forgot to give us water which I thought was standard but maybe we were supposed to ask for them in addition to our alcoholic drinks. Regardless, the food is good so I&#39;ll keep coming back. I&#39;m craving that pasta and steak again...

It was late night and we wanted something to order and go. Our hotel was a few minutes from here and I was really craving a good cheesecake. We conveniently ordered online for pick up. We ended up getting chicken fettuccine Alfredo which was good but not very hot. The pineapple upside down cheesecake was a bit too sweet and more cake then cheesecake for my liking. The server at the bakery was sweet but she was very busy. We waited an extra 5 minutes just to get 2 cups of water. Not much to expect from a franchised food chain but convenience is worth it.

Good as usual. Enjoyed the life y&#39;all with my mom over coffee and seltzer. She remarked how fresh the coffee was. My seltzer was refreshing with the added lime wedges. <br><br>My mom has the fresh and chips and I had my favorite Riesling chicken and a side Caesar salad (no croutons) not cause I&#39;m gluten sensitive but because I ate the while roll of wheat bread with butter! <br><br>We passed on the craving for cheesecake- but I would have chosen the original! <br><br>Hey

Tonight&#39;s dinner was trying the Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta for the first time. It had so much flavor and a slow kick at the end soooo good if you like spicy food!<br><br>My only con was that the pasta was a bit too al debate for me, but like I said earlier, the overall taste of the dish was a wonderful mix of chipotle and other different flavors and textures. <br><br>The Margherita Flatbread Pizza tasted great, but didn&#39;t have a crunchy crust which was what I really wanted. It was more doughy, which I&#39;m not really into. <br><br>Fries were great!

I think that the food is normally pretty consistent, but when I went the burger I had ordered was super burnt and it was so tough to eat because of the tar on the burger patty. <br><br>Additionally, the booth I was in was in was a little dirty, but I guess it&#39;s hard to clean a booth. <br><br>Our waitress was lovely! That day we went was pretty crowded, which is probably why the service was super slow. Though i think she tried her best. <br><br>This place is great for both small and larger parties! Even though my review isn&#39;t great today, I&#39;ll still visit it again and hope for a more enjoyable experience!
Disgusting salad totally undress fresh with rotten vegetables.  Completely not worth the $$$ we spent.

I was excited to be back,but the experience overall wasnt that great. The mac and cheese balls came out cold, we had to have them return it and wait for a fresh one to come out. Then the dinner itselt was also not hot even though we waited an hour for it. I didnt even bother returning it to wait an hour for them to remake it again. Overall I wont be back.....
We came with a large (50 people) group. So we put them under quite a bit of pressure. Waiter was pleasant. Had the skinny chop salad. It was ok and kept the calories down.

Always a favorite. The first chain restaurant I ate in while on vacation on the east coast. <br>Lemon raspberry cheesecake is a must! <br>I had a salad and as always. Amazing. <br>Service was good. Very friendly waitress. Restaurant was clean

Came here for National Cheesecake Day (and half off cheesecake hehe) and was not disappointed!<br><br>Usually I write off large chains from my go-to list of restaurants, but honestly The Cheesecake Factory hit the spot for all my cravings today, especially my sweet tooth and better yet - there was a special deal for National Cheesecake Day!<br><br>Food (4/5): I got the Skinnylicious Chinese Chicken Salad and wow was the portion huge. I was only able to eat half of the dish (mostly because I was saving room for the cheesecake), but wasn&#39;t disappointed with the taste. The crispy wontons were probably my favorite part. The only setback was that there was a bit too much sauce and the chicken didn&#39;t have much flavor. Onto the cheesecakes!! My friend and I split the Chocolate Chip cookie dough cheesecake and Lemon Raspberry Cream cheesecake and wow were they good. I wish they were a bit more chilled, but either way - I liked the cookie dough within the first cheesecake, it&#39;s definitely a bit heavy with everything in it, but the crust was great. The lemon raspberry cream cheesecake was a bit tart, but in a refreshing way. The crust was a bit more cake like on this and it wasn&#39;t too sweet thanks to the mix of sour from the lemon. <br><br>Service (5/5): even though it was a busy time, with everyone coming in to get the cheesecake deal and enjoy dinner, our server was so sweet!! She checked in on us multiple times and would chit chat with us and I truly enjoyed having her as a server :))
Came here for a piece of cheesecake, it tasted like chalk, ate the whole thing anyway.

My friend and I came here about a week and a half ago and I&#39;ve never been more disappointed. The server was so-so, not bad not great. But the food was what ruined our experience. My friend ordered a burger with cheese inside, and it came out with the inside COMPLETELY uncooked. Literally it was raw ground beef on the inside, it made us sick. And I ordered the chicken sandwich, which came out with two hairs sticking out from inside the bread. We were surprised to say the least. The manager apologized and that was appreciated but I can confidently say I won&#39;t be coming back here again.
The food portion is large and Delicious!!!<br>The cake is very good and sweet.<br>A great place for dining in and having fun with friends.

As a Canadian, Cheesecake Factory is really popular and hyped because there&#39;s only 1 location so I&#39;m happy I got to try it without waiting in line. The restaurant is really big and the staff is really nice. Our waiter provided us with some suggestions and I chose the shrimp with angel hair pasta. The pasta had a basil flavour to it which I really enjoyed. It was filling (couldn&#39;t finish) but it was a little dry. It could have used more sauce and the shrimp was a little over cooked but otherwise the dish was good. The cheesecake is (obviously) what you come for. The strawberry original cheesecake was amazing and it was definitely the best part of the meal.

This was the second time I was even in cheese cake factory and the experience was just alright. When we walked it it looked busy and waited for 10 minutes and as we were inside, I saw other half of the restaurant was empty. We were greeted by a nice hostess. Then we were served water in a cloudy mug. I am not sure if I should take a sip. Then I ordered korean cauliflower and shrimp tempura. I asked the waitress how big were the servings and she said its not huge. Apparently they were huge. The food was good and tasty but i could not finish it. When my food was being served the waiter tried serving from far end of my table where he almost tipped over my food. I was not happy about that. Other than that its was alright.

Great place for large parties. We were a group of 12 and we didn&#39;t have to wait too long for a table. The staff is sweet and tries to accommodate your requests. We ordered a lot of stuff. Food is delicious. Cocktails are good.

Came for my friends birthday and honestly the service has been terrible. When we arrived they wouldn&#39;t let us sit till the whole party arrived despite reservations being made in advance, and it being explained that it was a surprise for my friends birthday. After they finally let us sit we waited for my friend to arrive, when he arrived they made him sit in a chair outside of the booth and split the group up. Then at the end of the meal the manager comes up to my friend sitting in the chair and says he can&#39;t sit in it due to a fire code violation. It was their idea because having 1 extra person in a booth was a covid hazard and how it&#39;s a fire hazard to have him in the seat they suggested. Nothing but rudeness from the staff. Also being told that because 3 people are late our table was given away despite the majority of our party being on time or early.

I don&#39;t come here often but it&#39;s pretty good in this place. A little bit pricey but it&#39;s worth it if you like what you are getting. I got the lemon garlic herb chicken to share with my boyfriend. We got some cocktail drinks too and he got a glass of beer for himself as well. I came with other two friends from work so they also ordered entrees for themselves. <br><br>We got apps to start our meal while waiting for our other friend who was late. The pork sliders was good and I chose the avocado egg rolls which was surprisingly good. Never thought avocado would be good in a spring rolls and the sauce that came with it was really good as well. Our food came all at once not too long after we ordered and I loved the sauce on my chicken. It was lemony but not too over powering. It came with the mashed potato which was a perfect match for that dish. <br>We we&#39;re so stuffed that we couldn&#39;t finish the meal but ofcourse you always have the option to take it home and that&#39;s what we did.

I love coming here! The atmosphere, service and of course the food is always fantastic. Oh and you can&#39;t forget about the CHEESECAKE!! <br><br>On this visit we decided to order from the lunch sized options which are supposed to be smaller but truly you get an amazing portion. I had the spaghetti and meatballs that was very delicious and Judy got the pepperoni and sausage pizza with a salad. She had honey mustard for her dressing and it was the best honey mustard I&#39;ve had, definitely homemade. The pizza was amazing, so much flavor.<br><br>For dessert you guessed it cheesecake!! Judy had the celebration cheesecake which was spectacular and I had the caramel pecan turtle cheesecake, decadent!!<br><br>Great as always!!

The service here was phenomenal! Out waiter  checked on us often, made suggestions and was very friendly!<br>The food was also great. I had the orange chicken with white rice. The chicken was crispy and sweet. I would say that it was better than some the orange chicken I&#39;ve ordered in Chinese restaurants. The portions are large so you can share a plate between two people. My sister ordered their tacos and loved It. She said that the meat was juicy and cooked perfectly. This is the plate that was suggested by the waiter and she absolutely loved it!<br><br>Overall great experience!
A little slow service but understandable given the size. Lovely ambience. Mindblowing godiva chocolate cheesecake. Veg burger could do with some more flavor. Good value for money.

It was good but if you ask for a to go box, at least put in plastic silverware so that people who stay in hotels (which is where this location was in!) can eat later. Fortunately I had a set from the previous night but geez. The orange and cocoanut cream soda was divine though.

We waited around 20 minutes for a seat, which isn&#39;t bad. The place was full around 5 pm, which is pretty early for a Saturday night.<br><br>When we got to our seats, the silverware was dirty so we asked for a new set. Our waiter didn&#39;t come to our table often, and we had to wait a while to get our drinks, bread, and for him to take our order. Definitely could&#39;ve had better service.<br><br>Other than that, this is your usual Cheesecake Factory. The menu is huge and has so many options! We shared a small plate of greek salad, spinach dip, and loaded tater tots. They were all delicious and the portions are huge even for appetizers.<br><br>For the main dishes, we got a bacon-bacon burger and eggplant parm. We had a lot to take home as well!<br><br>For dessert we shared a carrot cake cheesecake which was so yummy!!! Definitely recommend if you&#39;re shopping in the Prudential Center and looking for a place that hits the spot!!

I have visited Cheesecake Factory in Pittsburgh. That one is better.<br>This one has more salty dishes. Even the ovenbroccoli is too salty. I even didn&#39;t wrap it.<br>The steak and shrimp is nice. But also a little salty for me. <br>I had the pasta on the top of the pasta menu. That is salty too, but the cheese tastes good.<br>Finally, we take a tiramisu. Really Love that! After all this is Cheesecake Factory.

We went here after my friend came here to visit. We were lucky enough to make a reservation in advance because the place was packed. However, we had to wait until the exact time in our reservation to check in which to me made things difficult because we were there early. Other than that, the waitress was very kind and thoughtful and the food was satisfactory. Good amount of space for seating and dining.

Stopped by for a quick Bite on July 14th. Our server keiantey was amazing! We ordered a bunch of appetizers and she was on top of her game. She was such a great server and even noticed when my glasses were half empty. Thank you once again will definitely come back soon!

I haven&#39;t been so disappointed in a review as I am now. This was once one of my go to spots and it ruined an important day for me. See today I was celebrating my graduation after receiving my doctorate. Wanted to eat brunch so why not TCF. I swear if it wasn&#39;t for the decor, I would swear I was at a Denny&#39;s. How do you bring Luke warm food on a hot plate. Literally the plate was hotter than the food. How do you bring me chicken and waffles and no syrup? And then when we ask for syrup you bring melted butter and say that&#39;s how we make our syrup here. I have been here before (not to this location) but syrup has been syrup every time and not butter. Honestly I can go on with the burnt potatoes but what strikes me as the worst was the service. We weren&#39;t asked about dessert afterwards which after a poor experience I wouldn&#39;t even consider but this is TCF. Went to the counter to order a couple to-go and since it was was different people , we wanted separate bags. The server tried to tell us that we had to pay for a separate bag.  That wasn&#39;t as bad as how she said it. A fail across the board. Please take this &#34;L&#34; to heart! Your restaurant needs a complete overhaul. Bad experience for a special occasion. Thanks for the memory!
Impossible burger was AMAZING. And the server was kind and very attentive. Wanna come back tomorrow!

Definitely doesn&#39;t live up to the good management aura that Cheesecake Factory has had following Gawande&#39;s piece in the New Yorker about it.<br><br>- Some of the staff and bartenders are terrific!<br>- Saw a worker come out of a bathroom stall, not wash his hands, head to the kitchen, and then deliver food to the people next to us. Eww.<br>- One of our group&#39;s salad had wilted leaves. Manager came by, and basically said, that&#39;s too bad (slightly longer but same message).<br>- Poor capacity planning. There will be lots of empty tables, but not enough staff when conventions happen (all convention info is available online).<br>- 5 minute wait = not sure

I am SO disappointed. I order from various Cheesecake Factory&#39;s on the regular so I am a frequent customer. I have ordered from this specific location on Huntington Ave. 2 times. When I received my food it was cold and every single cheese ball was burnt I tasted it to see if it was edible but the burnt charcoal taste took over everything so I couldn&#39;t, not to mention the macaroni and cheese was very dry! The tomato sauce it comes with as shown in the picture was completely watered down and barely had any taste! In total after delivery I paid $17 for a a burnt appetizer that I was not able to eat!  Will not be coming back to this location, hopefully this doesn&#39;t happen to any more paying customers.
Was helping give Turkish friend a tour and Boston and decided on Cheesecake Factory for dinner. The waitress was great and the food was tasty and big portion. The ambience is great - will come back

We came to get a piece of cheesecake to watch the World Series.  I like Cheesecake Factory and the many choices are fun for choosing!  With a win like that, we may need to become superstitious and get a piece for every fame!  B STRONG!

Slowest service I&#39;ve ever had. Would wait 30 minutes for my waiter to come to the table. When my food came is was the thinnest New York strip I&#39;ve ever seen, a mouthful of gristle in every bite. Probably the cheapest cut they could find. In addition to this, the broccoli was under cooked. How do you do that??

I asked for a grilled rib eye steak and this is what i was brought. I&#39;m totally disgusted because If i didn&#39;t take a chance to open this steak up, i would of been chewing on this. Waiter took it back &amp; offered to get another one. But i lost my appetite &amp; interest.

Good cheesecake restaurant. <br><br>We ordered:<br>Factory Nachos: 5/5, OMG so good! Chips were freshly fried and toppings went together super well. Definitely add the chipotle chicken. <br>Fire roasted artichoke: 3.5/5. Best part of the dish is the aioli dip. Artichokes tastes fine and pretty standard. <br>Brick chicken: 1/5, The brick chicken was cooked well but so salty to the point of being inedible. They were nice enough to recook me the dish to go, however my to go order was also super salty. I would not recommend this dish unless you love salt!<br>Chocolate tuxedo cheesecake: 5/5, get this if you love chocolate. The cheesecake is super airy and smooth. Ask for extra whip cream in the side.<br><br>Waitress was friendly and service was good like most cheesecake restaurants.

I love this Cheesecake Factory. Nestled in the heart of Boston it&#39;s perfect for almost any occasion. The restaurant is huge and can accommodate large parties. On Sunday&#39;s when the entire city of Boston ventures out for brunch and most places require a blood sample and a minimum of at least an hour wait... you can be seated within 15 minutes at the factory. <br><br>The menu here is vast... but there is something to accommodate every taste. Fish, chicken, beef, turkey or vegetarian. My favorites are signature the avocado egg rolls and the fire cracker Salmon. These are appetizers but I usually get them as a meal and they are perfectly filling. <br><br>The price point is reasonable. Entrees typically don&#39;t go past 20.00 dollars here. Of course you can&#39;t end dinner at the factory with the cheesecake! Get the cheesecake and damn your diet! It&#39;s so very worth it. If you are looking for a good quality bite with lots of options in Boston this is a great option. You can work off the cheesecake with a walk through the prudential afterwards.

I was alone and decided the Cheesecake Factory would be a good dinner choice. The space I was given was typical for what is offered to a single diner. A two top in a line with other two tops. The bar space was noisy but okay. My choice of filet was perfect. The steak was done medium rare precisely how I ordered it. The mashed  potato side was ideal too. Perfectly seasoned and plentiful. The green beans that were on the plate were past their prime and easy to leave alone. Overall a fine meal and I&#39;m happy woth my choice. A little pricey but understandable for a convention center location. No complaints from me!!

Our tip to this Cheesecake Factory included some fantastic highs but also some lows that dragged this review down to three stars. After a long day of sightseeing, we wanted an easy, familiar restaurant where there was something for everyone.  <br>First the highlights. The appetizers came off without a hitch. The roasted Brussels sprouts were very good. I ordered the Asian lettuce wraps and I was very happy with my meal. Unfortunately, my fellow diners were not having the same experience. They had all ordered pasta dishes and were pushing it around their plates with various expressions of yuck. My daughters had to be sent back because it was ice cold. It came back over microwaved. <br>Then our drinks, very little alcohol, basically overpriced fruit drinks. Which would have been better served to the kids who ordered ice tea with their kiddie meals which happened to be unsweetened. <br>Dessert was good. <br>So to sum it up, it was pretty decent but avoid the pasta.

The menu is incredible. I could probably eat here for years and still never explore the entire menu. It makes for an interesting opportunity to try a lot of new things.<br><br>We have visited twice in the past month and had a great experience both times. Our waiters went above and beyond both times. <br><br>We were lucky enough to experience the soup of the day being Loaded Baked Potato and it was amazing.

Brian C took AMAZING care of us tonight!!<br><br>Walked in on a Saturday night with no reservation just wanting cheesecake and drinks. We knew we could self seat in the bar area on the high tops so we waited for a table to be open. <br><br>We claimed one immediately once it became available and an employee told us somebody would be over to clear the table for us soon. Sure enough, a busser came and was so kind and cleared/cleaned the table for us.<br><br>The employee came back and introduced himself as our server. He was so friendly and personable. I thanked him for working on a Saturday night and he smiled and said we would be well taken care of. <br>We ordered cheesecake and my friend asked him for advice on what to order. She ultimately decided on the Adam&#39;s cheesecake, but Brian was patient with us throughout the ordering process.<br><br>He joked with us and made us feel so comfortable. On a Saturday night when the whole restaurant is running around and things are hectic it&#39;s easy for the guest to feel like a burden. But Brian C made the most of his time with us to help us enjoy our experience. He took a couple moments extra to connect with us and it made such a big difference!<br><br>Also! There was a kind employee who helped me get into my coat once I got up! I didn&#39;t catch his name unfortunately but that small kind gesture went a long way! I was so touched! <br><br>MANAGEMENT! You&#39;re lucky to have an employee like Brian C! And the other gentleman that helped me get into my coat !

Chocolate Cake test complete, with the help of some friends...<br><br>Black-Out Cake - Our Deepest, Richest, Chocolate Cake with Chocolate Chips, Finished with Almonds<br><br>Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake - Layers of Rich Chocolate Cake and Fudge Frosting<br><br>Chocolate Tower Truffle Cake - Layers and layers of Fudge Cake with Chocolate Truffle Cream and Chocolate Mousse<br><br>Each one was a terrific chocolate cake.  The Black-Out Cake is their basic chocolate cake.  The Fudge Cake is extra moist and rich, while the Tower Truffle is a tad lighter with the layers of chocolate mousse.  So, go with your mood, and enjoy!  Perhaps with a glass of milk.<br><br>*** 1/2018 Happy Hour ***<br><br>Turns out the short tables circling the high tops in the bar area aren&#39;t quite bar tables.  Oopsie!<br><br>Three $5.95 appetizers made for a nice little dinner for the two of us before some smooth creamy cheesecake.<br><br>The Guacamole &amp; Chips were cool and refreshing, and the spiciness level of the salsa could be adjusted.  The Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes were nice as always.  Fried Macaroni &amp; Cheese were cheesey creamy goodness hidden beneath a crisp hot crust.<br><br>Their delicious oatmeal topped brown bread is now hitting grocery stores, starting with Winn-Dixie, Bi-Lo and Harveys, but nothing beats a warm loaf tiding us over at our local Cheesecake Factory, while we await the rest of our meal...<br><br>*** 2/2018 Happy Hour ***<br><br>New Happy Hour menu item!  Pork Belly Sliders $5.95 slices of slow roasted smoked pork belly with barbeque sauce, cole slaw and fried pickles!<br><br>I sat at the bar for this visit, and was handed their normal menu, but had to locate the special Happy Hour menu myself from where it was set along the bar.<br><br>The sliders came 4 to an order, with toasted and buttered bun tops placed askew.  There were two crunchy fried pickle slices to the roll, with 2-3 small slices of dense pork on each.  The contrasting textures and flavors worked well together.

It is what it is, and that&#39;s a Cheesecake factory. And, like so many of them, it&#39;s attached to a mall. So after you hit Banana Republic and want to get your over-eating on, head on over to the Cheese.<br><br>Never been a big fan but if you are, it will be business as usual. I was pleasantly surprised to see that the servers were wearing black pants, versus the silly and ridiculously impractical all-white outfits of yesteryear.

My son ordered Salmon thru Door Dash on 12/30.  The food arrived, besides the fact that the portion was tiny (so much different than in the restaurant), it was very under cooked.  He unfortunately did not realize it until he had already eaten a few bites.  Sure enough, withing a short period of time, he became very sick.  He clearly got food poisoning.<br><br>I had him call the restaurant the next day and he was transferred to a manager.  The manager did not seem to believe him, but said someone from the corporate office would be calling him, that did not happen.<br><br>It would be nice if they took this stuff serious, he spent over $70 and they just don&#39;t care.

HORRIBLE!!!!  Wish I could post with NO Stars!!!  <br>We stopped in on our way back to our hotel for dessert to go. We ordered my husband&#39;s cheesecake and I told the server I had celiac and asked which kind of cheesecake was gluten free, he told me all were and the crusts were all safe!  There was a long line and I verified with home to make certain what we heard was correct and he assured us it was.  I ordered the original. We got back to our room and I searched online to find out the in actuality NONE of the cheesecakes are truly gluten free. Extremely upset that in 2019, in a major city restaurants and employees still do t know how important it is to understand food allergies.  Will never, ever step for in a Cheesecake Factory location and will let others know how poor their concern is for their patrons!

The waitress was good, drinks were good, cheesecake excellent and good was okay.  It is Cheesecake Factory so that&#39;s standard.  So many dishes that nothing is really special.  We all got chicken dinners &amp; the flavor is just lacking. <br>The chicken and biscuits was great, the best meal I have had here.  The chicken was bland but the gravy was flavorful to carry the dish. Try it!

The Cheesecake Factory is filling and affordable. If you&#39;re looking for or expecting the best meal of your life, you&#39;re in the wrong place. If you&#39;re looking for something authentic, wrong place. Cheesecake Factory makes large portions in a pleasant setting. The food is tasty and filling largely due to the overuse of butter and salt. I think cheap large portions of pretty good food is great. Just come here with reasonable expectations.

I ordered the Molto Flatbread and Fries. Both were ice cold, and they gave me an extra fries only to make up that they were ice cold and limpy, soggy. I think I&#39;ll order with neighborhood restaurants going forward.  no utensils, napkins after I specified for some

The CF is as consistent as any chain you will find. Though perhaps best known for their desserts, every item I have ever ordered has been large and tasty -- this visit was no exception. Of course, Orange Chicken is a personal favourite and I indulge myself with that nearly every visi<br><br>We have visited this location several times when visiting Boston and will no doubt show up again. Until then...

Like every other Cheesecake Factory, ridiculously wide variety of cuisine, all served slightly above mediocre. The portions here are enormous. Great place to go if you have people who are all craving different things

I&#39;m genuinely upset. Cheesecake Factory is always a slow but good time, but I usually walk out feeling okay! Today was such a different story. We should have known the moment we walked in the back entrance! There were no signs indicating that we were at the back, and we had to awkwardly walk through the whole restaurant for the front. <br><br>We got there around 5:30, and was told 25 min for a table of 6. We were seated around 6:10, after I checked in with the hostess how long the wait would be. Our waiter took about 5 min to come to us the first time, and he seemed REAL flustered. My friend asked what the soup of the day was, and he looked at her blank faced saying that he &#34;doesn&#39;t normally work Monday&#39;s so he doesn&#39;t know and will check&#34;. Every time he left our table, it took him FOREVER to come back. We could not get his attention!!<br><br>The food was mediocre this time. My friend asked for a medium mushroom burger, but parts of it was DEFINITELY rare. The seasoning on the mashed potatoes was off, but the honey truffle chicken was good. I got the Evelyn&#39;s pasta, which was eh. It was a good mix of vegetables, but it all ended up tasting the same. The menu said it came with rigatoni pasta, but I definitely got a few elbows in there. My friend got the shrimp angel hair pasta, which she said just tasted not special. Overall, the extensive menu at cheesecake is overwhelming, but I don&#39;t think there&#39;s a terrible option. <br><br>THIS IS WHEN IT GETS SO MUCH WORSE. We literally waited 45 min between finishing eating to leaving the restaurant. Our server was just too busy. Every time we asked for something, it would take him over 10 min to come back and ask us to repeat what we just said. We even told him in the beginning that we had somewhere to be, but he did not seem to get that. Dinner should not take 2.5 hours when we just got an entree! <br><br>We were actually fuming when we walked out. Sat in silence in the Uber back home. Do not recommend this location!!
This place takes forever to get food. Every time we go there the kids have a meltdown because they are just starving. Food is okay. Just okay. Finally... why does the place is always so dark?

We have been in a few of these across the US from California to Florida.  <br><br>Not a place to visit if you are on a diet. They have a massive menu from sandwiches to pasta but as the name suggests Cheesecake is their thing and they do it well at 5000 calories a slice. <br><br>It&#39;s a bit of a tradition to find an outlet and scoff a wedge of cheesecake.<br><br>Located in Prudential Center.

This is not what we were expecting to come out of this restaurant. The chicken smells and tastes burnt not only looks like it came out of hell. I also ordered the buffalo chicken tenders with fries and for both orders the fries were stale the chicken tenders were no where near crunchy and the nachos we ordered had no chicken at all. Idk what happened last night in the kitchen crew but I would love either a refund or a complete remake of the order we made on doordash. This is literally irritating.

This was probably the worst Cheesecake Factory experience I have ever had. Despite being relatively empty  we waited 15 minutes for our waiter to arrive. When he finally did arrive and took all of our order we waited another 15 min for our drinks. All of our drinks were wrong and some were even forgot. After another few minutes the server acknowledged my nephew didn&#39;t have a drink, saying...you didn&#39;t want one? He had ordered the strawberry lemonade 2 times. <br><br>When our food came out my simple salad was doused in dressing even though I had asked for it on the side and the server repeated it back and said no problem. When the new salad came the cut chicken was two massive pieces under lettuce. Overall the service was poor. <br><br>The atmosphere and overall cleanliness was also gross. Despite it only being 3 pm they turned the lights down in the the restaurant and the bathroom was disgusting.
First time there yesterday and I loved it! Great food and prices. Customer service fabulous! Definitely will be back the next time I&#39;m in town!

3.5 stars, rounded up.<br><br>IF you want to get to this Cheesecake Factory (CF), you should exit at the E line of the green at prudential, takes you right out to where CF is in the mall. This CF honestly has a great location, so you probably won&#39;t miss it.<br><br>Ever since I came to America, I&#39;ve been a huge fan of the Cheesecake factory, primarily because they serve almost everything possibly imaginable here. The second reason I love this place in general is because of the crazy high calorie dishes they serve here. Some dishes here regularly make the &#34;Dishes with the Highest Number of Calories by Chain Restaurant&#34; lists: for instance, the chicken and garlic farfalle (according to the menu) has 2190 calories in just one serving. It&#39;s amazing, and only appropriate for special occasions. <br><br>This particular CF is not much different from other locations. The waitstaff is fine, and generally friendly, and if i recall correctly, the food comes out blazingly fast. I will say however that it is a little bit too dimly lit here, and wish that they would improve the lighting if possible. However, if you need to scratch your CF itch, this is definitely a great option.<br><br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.cheesecakefactorynutrition.com%2Frestaurant-nutrition-chart.php&amp;s=7112af61d4fa80c2681a7e95d4cf5888cf1aa7b99870d741b952d64a9a65c55c" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">cheesecakefactorynutriti…</a>?

Situated in a shopping center, this is a pretty good Cheesecake Factory. The lines were long getting in, due to a big conference running nearby, but the food was great, and the service was pretty good. All in all, good value for the money, and a nice place to eat.

Awful !! Was out shopping with my mom and we wanted something relatively easy, so I called ahead of time (from the other side of Prudential) to ask if there was a wait. The hostess told me that she can&#39;t tell me that information and I would need to come in and see--wtf??? We decided to walk over and sit in the bar area at the high tops to avoid the wait, but honestly we should&#39;ve just left right then. Three or four servers walked around us a few times, then a family came and sat at the next table from us and one of the servers went right over to them first. Server also happened to be our server which didn&#39;t make sense considering we were there at least five minutes without any service, server disappeared for another 10 minutes after greeting us and giving us water. She took our order and we sat there for at least half an hour which was ridiculous, considering my mom ordered a burger with a side salad and I ordered a salad-absolutely no reason it should&#39;ve taken that long. The waitress magically appeared and told us that we would have a new server because she was going home and it was the end of her shift, which explains why our food was taking so long because she didn&#39;t care anymore and just wanted to get out of there obviously. Food came out, my mom&#39;s mushroom burger was cold with no cheese on it, literally two tiny mushrooms on it and a side of fries which we specifically asked for a side salad. The runner stuck her hand on my mom&#39;s plate and took the fries away without saying anything and disappeared. My salad was supposed to have dressing on the side and it was already dressed, plus I asked for the onion topping to be on the side and that didn&#39;t and come out at all. Salad was pretty terrible and I&#39;ve ordered this at plenty of other cheesecake&#39;s and never had any issueNobody came to check on us and I had to ask a waiter for our waiter and the check to come out. Turns out that the waiter who I asked was actually our new waiter who didn&#39;t bother checking on us, greeting us or anything. I understand that this is a tourist spot but if you&#39;re going to be a waiter at least put some effort into it, it was such a fail and a complete regrettable experience.

The food is on the pricey side but it is worth it. I would describe this place like a high end diner since there are so many food options on the menu. The sweet potato  fries were amazing and their sauce with it was great. The portions are huge so you can share if you want. The brown bread that they give you at the table is also just amazing!

I was pretty excited to go here. Love all the different cheesecakes! I tried the Thai chicken lettuce wraps and they were amazing. Then, I had the celebration cheesecake which I did not like. I didn&#39;t really wanna come here because there&#39;s one near me I can go to any time... but it was fun!<br><br>Don&#39;t forget to check out my profile!

If only they had their act together.....<br><br>I was given the task of picking up dessert for 6 people, so I decided that 6 different desserts would be better than just one, this avoiding the &#34;oh no, I don&#39;t like xx&#34;.  I went in, went straight to the area on the left for take-out orders and waited.  Waited some more, waited more, noticed that there were now 5 people behind me also waiting (and worried that they would think the slow service is because I was picking up something that was causing this) and we were all just watching while one employee took his time cleaning a coffee machine.<br><br>Not once did he think to say to the gathered crowd &#34;someone will be right over&#34;.  Nope, just glanced at all of us and kept doing what he was doing.<br><br>Three (3!!!) other CF employees were at the host stand behind us and did nothing.  It&#39;s fine if their position is to be at the host stand and not handle orders, but SAY SOMETHING and then GO GET SOMEONE.  I finally decided I would not be forking over $35-40 for this and left (FYI, Flour bakery is around the corner on Belvidere).

Wait time was quick. I had a party of five and we were seated within five minutes for dinner. However we were placed at a table meant for four. It was a booth and they stuck a small armless chair at the end. Not the worst. But it took 45 minutes to be given a fifth place setting and when I finally got one the fork, spoon and plate were dirty with bits of greens still stuck on them. Super gross and I got attitude when I asked for another set. You could see the food on it. It also took over an hour for food. On top of that it was annoying to constantly move my chair out of the way for passing people.

We tried sitting in the bar area tables.  We sat down, two other tables got menus before us.  After ten minutes, we got two menus.  The other 2 tables got place settings and bread, we waited another 15 minutes and were totally ignored! We decided to leave ! I told the host people that we were ignored and questioned the fact that we are Asians ?  I would NEVER frequent this place again, rather go to a hot dog stand, at least you get service!

Great location near the Hynes Convention Center and wait time was quick. The food is very mediocre - had the crab bites and the &#34;Skinnylicious chicken rigatoni.  Service was also slow.  Not recommended.

Found a nail in my mashed potatoes!!!   jus got tooth pulled!!! manager only offered to pay $8 side and a gift card like I&#39;m ever coming back he also told me it definitely came from a tool in the kitchen

I don&#39;t know why it&#39;s so famous but nah... This Huntington ave. Cheesecake Factory is hugee with fancy structure and decor inside. The floor is super slippery!!! I almost felt off my boots walking in there. Don&#39;t they ever clean it?? <br><br>There are various types of food offered but I just feel like none of them is really good. There are American, Italian, Chinese, Thai, even Vietnamese food...and it sucks. I had fish and chips and garlic cheese bread. The fish is so bland. It has no taste at all I can&#39;t remember how much salt I had to put on. The garlic bread would be better without cheese cause it got too greasy. I did have a &#34;fresh&#34; strawberry cheesecake which was fine but Im not really a fan of cheesecake after all so...<br><br>The price sucks compared to the quality of food also. We only had three dishes, in which one of them is appetizer and one is dessert, with a cup of lemonade. It costs almost $50 icld tips. Ridiculous place don&#39;t know why people are so obsessed about it. They came to take pictures?
************This  people are going from bad to worse. It&#39;s incredible how slow they have *********************** turned lately.

We had visited the location at about 3:30pm 04/19/19.<br>This was my boyfriend&#39;s first time at The Cheesecake Factory, and to be honest he was very disappointed. He ordered a pineapple mojito (a 14$ drink), and though it came in a nice tall glass with nice decoration it tasted like watered down pineapple juice with a slight hint of mint and alcohol. He had talked to the server politely about it, and the server&#39;s tone was very off putting. <br>The server seemed very disinterested in her job, clearly not authentic and the service was poor. A half-attempt at empathy would have been better than how blatant she was in her tone and response to our complaint that she could not care less. <br>My boyfriend had also ordered the shrimp angel hair dish, and it was very bland, and loaded with tomatoes. For a 20$ dish this seems absurd.<br>Again this was his first time here, and he was very much let down which is embarrassing because I raved to him how great my previous experience here were.<br>We don&#39;t plan on coming back, and I feel bad for the other patrons who have experienced similar disappointments. As a couple that has been working in the food service industry for 6+ years it was especially frustrating to see this kind of disrespect in our line of work.

Terrible meal and not just for the price.  Ordered a filet mignon - had no flavor, was over cooked and was as tough as white chicken.  Asked for broccoli instead of mashed potatoes and they gave me broccoli instead of green beans.  Broccoli was undercooked and had no flavor. I placed this order for pick up so wasn&#39;t able to send it back.  Ordered brussel sprouts which were delicious, but only got about 10 halves in the order for $7.50.<br><br>VERY DISAPPOINTED in this location of an otherwise good chain<br><br>(Picture is my FULL order of brussel sprouts as it came .. it looks half eaten)

I have never been treated so terribly while dining in any Cheesecake Factory restaurant. Not only was our waiter ridiculously unresponsive and rude but when trying to order cheesecake at the take out counter upon our departure, we were ignored while the hostess proceeded to take 3 on the phone orders before even acknowledging our existence or god forbid apologize for our 15 minute (patient) wait. We were treated like an inconvenience from start to finish and I&#39;m appalled at the lack of respect and general regard for human beings during this experience. If you&#39;re looking for any kind of positive encounter or again, to be treated like a person, then go anywhere else.

Excellent happy hour. Keep in mind, while in Boston alcohol isn&#39;t discounted, but food in the bar area is-between 4-6 pm.<br><br>You can&#39;t beat the hamburger price- $5.95 with a stick!<br><br>All appetizers are aggressively priced for exceptional value.

The wait was 15 minutes for me and the wifey on Sat the 15th around 4:30 PM but I believe we sat before the 15 and food came out fast and very yummy. She had the factory nachos and I had the bacon bacon burger very delicious. Our waiter Donnie was good too

Cheesecake Factory chains are pretty standard, one of the reasons they&#39;re so popular is because it&#39;s reliable. But this one gets 5 stars from me because of Amus the server. 10/10 would recommend asking for a table in his section specifically!! <br><br>Also remember, MA doesn&#39;t allow for liquor discounts so happy hour is strictly food deals.

I&#39;ve only dined at the cheesecake factory a few times, but after my visit yesterday, I will definitely be back. My friends and I went for dinner before New Year&#39;s Eve and the staff was so gracious even when their own night was taken. Best of all was our server, Chris. What a smiley guy! So gracious and took all of our plates after eating without me having to ask. The Barbeque Salad was good like an 8 out of 10 and the pineapple Mojito was to die for!

Got two lovely dishes, the Da Vinci Pasta (it was a close call between this and my usual go-to pasta, Carbonara), and Choose-Your-Own omelette.<br><br>The omelette comes with 2 sides. I chose lovely home potatoes (imagine steak fries), and fruit (amazing mini-platter with ripe half-grapes, mini blueberries, half strawberries, and a few more things I can&#39;t remember).

Here&#39;s a breakdown of what we got and my thoughts: <br><br>*service was great. Super nice waitresses.** <br><br>Burrito - biggest burrito I&#39;ve ever seen in my life, at least a foot long, my whole table laughed when the waitress bought it. Finally made sense why it was $16. But you&#39;re paying for the size, not the flavor. It&#39;s a bland burrito that&#39;s smothered in sauce and cheese, so it&#39;s all one texture and looks more like an enchilada. <br><br>Mac and Cheese - first off, there was a nice long hair in it. So that&#39;s not super appetizing. But, better than the Mac at Max Brenner, yet that&#39;s not saying much. Cheesecake&#39;s Mac is Basic, just noodles with cheese melted on top, not even a cheese sauce. Could make it at home for the prize of a box of pasta and shredded cheese. But still, you&#39;d be making yourself a boring ass Mac and cheese. <br><br>Spring roll cheeseburger - confusing. Odd sour to it. Dipping sauce only makes it worse, an awful combination.  Why are we using a cheeseburger for an Asian fusion. So strange. <br><br>Steak Diane - medium well, cooked to that temp but sauce and mushrooms are again oddly sour and not well balanced. <br><br>Overall cheesecake has way to much on their menu to actually be able to execute everything well, and it shows in the food. I&#39;d rather they have only 10 options but they nail every single one, than 30 options where only a few are good. The food is boring, average, nothing to write home about. Way overpriced for what you get, which is a lack of any exciting flavor. <br><br>But hey, it&#39;s the CHEESECAKE factory. At least they&#39;re still good at making that.

Love this place. Its always my safe option cause you can never go wrong with this place. Food and price wise both. The place is always busy but lines go by fast. Loveee their cheesecakes and pastas. Ambiance and service is great too. Their servings are pretty generous too.

I love coming to the Cheesecake Factory. I always order chicken/shrimp gumbo every time I go. The gumbo is very flavorful and always hits the spot. I love mixing it together with the rice. My friend and I always order a cheesecake to share after our entree. One cheesecake is more than enough for two people.

Arrived at Boston last night and this is the only restaurant at 11:30 pm. Great service from the staff but the food were not as hot as we expected. Boston was freezing and the food were just warm. We ordered a burger and omelette with fries. The burger was tasty beef and the omelette was well fried with ham inside. Two dishes were well enough for two. Later we took away a chesscake and back to hotel for breakfast. We took it in the next morning and it still tasted good.<br><br>Just one point to improve not hot enough for the food.
Love everything about it; great service, good food, and fantastic music. Loved that they played Harry Styles! Please play more Harry Styles and I will definitely come more often .

Don&#39;t f@&amp;$king bother going here. Service is complete and utter garbage!! Sat in the bar for over 15 minutes and never got any kind of service at all. Made eye contact with the bartenders and 2 servers walked by us well over ten times. This place is a joke. Go up the street to California Pizza Kitchen for great service and drinks like we ended up doing. I&#39;d give zero stars if I could.

1 star for the service and another star for the laughs. Thanks for making my boyfriend and I&#39;s anniversary so memorable by effing everything up. Our date started off very....slow. We both had time to go to the bathroom (one at a time), chat and pick out our entire dinner plans (apps and entree&#39;s) before even being greeted. Finally she came over, dropped water and bread without saying anything and again, left. We finally got to order about 10 mins later and everything seemed fine! She was very nice, but I couldn&#39;t understand anything she said because she mumbled every word. We ordered avocado egg rolls with extra sauce, an old fashion burger with chipotle mayo on the side, and spicy cashew chicken with extra sauce on side (not too hard or complicated as I&#39;m also a waitress, and she wrote it all down it seemed!) App came without extra sauce, which is ok we asked someone else for it since our waitress never came around or checked on us. 25-30 mins later we got our entree&#39;s (this is where the 1 star for laughs comes in!). Another worker dropped off my burger (cooked perfectly!) which was slathered in regular mayo , no chipotle mayo :/  THEN came the funny part. The girl puts down a plate of plain white rice with plain chicken on top. I was so confused, I almost told her she had the wrong order. Then she puts down all the toppings down which were all individual and says &#34;and here&#39;s the toppings all on the side&#34;. She left, there wasn&#39;t even sauce. It was plain chicken with plain rice and toppings on the side. What? She finally came back and dropped off a bowl of sauce. I asked her if she could bring everything back to mix it all together as this is not what we ordered. She brought back the rice and sauce, not the toppings. 10 mins later she brought back the plain rice and plain chicken with the sauce poured over top , what? Our waitress still never came over. Thus, it was essentially a &#34;make your own dinner&#34;. We came out to be waited on to have a peaceful anniversary dinner, not a parade of trying to get multiple workers attentions, every order incorrect, make your own dishes, barely seeing our waitress and no corrections by the waitress. Thanks!

This cheesecake factory is located at an end of the bustling Prudential center in Boston. It&#39;s a very large space with lots of inside seating so it&#39;s always a place to consider dining at when you&#39;re nearby during those hot summers and cold winters. They serve a wide selection of standard american food ranging from burgers, pizzas, salads to pastas and of course their delicious cheesecake. <br><br>When I went a while back I did have to wait very briefly but this place is very spacious so it should not take take any time at all to get seated. I did have a very negative dining experience because of the quality of the food. I ordered the buffalo wings (bone in so not the tenders) and when I took a bite it was ice cold! The surface of the wing was warm but when I felt the bone it was very cold meaning the wings were probably frozen and then reheated. When I told my waitress they just reheated it but I lost my appetite then. The wait staff was always friendly and attentive every time I&#39;ve went to Cheesecake factory which is why I give them a star but the negative food experience has just turned me away from them since then.

First time eating here. Probably won&#39;t again. <br>We were seated quickly. Arianna. I think she was new, Seated my husband and myself. Then left us for 15 minutes. She came back and dropped menus on table. Took her enough time for my husband to go to bathroom and out for a cigarette. She came back took our order. Which was a steak medium and fisherman&#39;s platter.<br>When she returned steak was over cooked. I never got tartar sauce or lemon.<br>Food was flavorful. However dough on fried fish was way too much.<br>I asked for tartar sauce, lemon and bread while we were eating. She never came over and asked if everything was ok. I understand it was a holiday. But she was so unprofessional and inattentive.<br>Turned me off the whole experience.<br>My husband had to ask someone else for a second beer.<br>We were done by the time it came.<br>She came by gave my husband a thumbs up. And left. A group of woman came in while we were sitting there waiting for our waitress or some eye contact. <br>The table behind us got all sort of attention from her. As she walked by I asked her for the check. It took her 15 minutes to bring the check over.<br>We were so disgusted we left with half of my husband&#39;s beer on the table.<br>On our way out, I stopped and spoke to another waitress. She asked if I wanted to see the manager. My husband already walked out he was that mad.<br>It&#39;s a good thing we had no plans on a time schedule. <br>In my experience it was lack of staff on the holiday. Lack of experience on behalf of Arianna. Too many tables per waitress. Lack of follow up or follow through.<br>Place tries to be too many things. <br>I&#39;m seriously disappointed and WON&#39;Tbe back . Got a message from them through email. They directed me to contact them because they want to talk to me about my experience. I went to there web page and I haven&#39;t heard from them since.

Came in on a Friday night and was sat right away. Cheesecake Factory usually satisfies a quick food craving for average fare.<br><br>The table got beet and goat cheese salad, skinnylicious shrimp fresh rolls, spicy chicken chipotle pasta and mango chicken dish. All were hugely portioned and tasted good. Nothing outstanding in my book though. <br><br>The three stars is for the service. The waitstaff was extremely disorganized and we were brought over the wrong food 4 times before actually getting our order. My water did not come with lemon as requested and the waitress was joking and talking to another table in front us while we waited 5 min for our check.

I came here with my wife while attending a convention. We had been walking all day or sitting in uncomfortable chairs, and looked for a place to eat with guaranteed seating. The CF was packed and they advised that we had a 30 minute wait, but they gave us a beeper and let us wander the mall. Exactly 30 minutes later, we were seated at our table. <br><br>I had never been to a CF before and the menu was extensive. However, I didn&#39;t want something really heavy as I had a lot more walking to do. I ordered the Buffalo chicken sandwich, and my wife had their burger. Both meals came quickly. My chicken was fried perfectly with ample lettuce and tomato and I was 1/2 through it when I realized there was either no Buffalo sauce or it was so scantly applied as to be missing. They brought me more and that was nice. My wife enjoyed her burger. We split a piece of lime cheesecake, which was very flavorful and tart and not too sweet.<br><br>The atmosphere was loud, dimly lit (it got darker as the meal went on, as if they turned the lights down), and very compressed. Since it is at a mall, perhaps it is like this every Saturday for dinner. I can&#39;t say I enjoyed being packed in or struggling to hear my wife, but the food was very good and the prices were reasonable. I may try our local CF and explore other parts of their menu.
Food offering is the same as other Cheesecake Factory across the US. However, the service stands out as great. They are observant and on top of your needs.

Not worth your time. I ordered take out and got a chicken and pasta dish that comes with arugula, prosciutto, and sauce. I got back to my hotel room and found one dry, plain, fried slab of chicken (instead of 2 separate pieces) and pasta. No arugula, no prosciutto, no sauce (picture attached). Also attached is what it should have been. I called, talked to 2 people who put me on hold for 16 minutes. I hung up and called back and they offered me a discount on only &#34;the missing items&#34; or I could go back and get &#34;the missing items&#34;. Only giving 2 stars because they offered a gift card instead. [EDIT] looks like they block or don&#39;t allow pictures.

The Cheesecake Factory is a place you go if you feel like hating yourself after you eat. I went with my fiance and a friend and the food received pretty mixed reviews. We started with the mac n cheese balls which are honestly pretty good! They&#39;re crunchy on the outside and gooey on the inside. No complaints there.<br><br>I had the California Club sandwich with a side salad which was also good. Standard sandwich, HUGE like you&#39;d expect at the Cheesecake Factory. My fiance had shrimp linguini which was just OK, but he only had 5 or 6 shrimp! For nearly $20 you&#39;d think you&#39;d get a smidge more. <br><br>My friend had the chicken parm pizza style, which is just a debacle. It&#39;s a GIANT fried chicken patty topped with a (seemingly small) scoop of pasta on top. It was just ok. I can&#39;t poo poo the health of the chicken parm because it was clearly a disgusting thing to order, but the food was just genuinely not that good. It was more like a big soggy chicken nugget topped with a pile of greasy angel hair pasta.<br><br>As for drinks, DO NOT BOTHER. I paid $12 for a long island that tasted like lemonade. I rarely drink so I don&#39;t have any tolerance but I didn&#39;t feel so much of a whisper of a buzz.<br><br>The thing everyone loves: cheesecake. It&#39;s fine. You can get better cheesecake elsewhere, and at 1,500 calories a slice, I&#39;d rather have an entire pizza to myself instead.<br><br>Finally, the service here is always slow. The restaurant is massive so the waits aren&#39;t bad if you arrive before the weekend rush (6:30-7:30 or so), but they don&#39;t have enough waitresses so it took us 30 minutes to order, over an hour to get entrees, etc.

I love Cheesecake factory and have been to it many times in Cambridge, Chicago etc <br>But this unit has a very poor customer service!!! <br><br>We arrived 9:50PM Sunday maybe staff was tired but if it&#39;s says it&#39;s open until 11PM I expect the same service as any other time. <br><br>We were seated shortly but the waitress never brought our bread until I have asked after like 15 minutes. <br><br>We ordered and after another 15-20 minutes the manager came to say they ran out of that dish and tried to make it (chicken with pan gravy) but he sauce didn&#39;t work. Well, if the sauce is a pan gravy I really don&#39;t know how it can be ran out or not work. But the worst part is to wait again for another dish and the waitress did not even apologize for that. And every time we asked something that was missing (the bread, the plate, the ketchup) she just made an annoyed face to us when we finally could see her (because she was never around). <br><br>And to complete, while we were still eating she wanted to take the plate out &#34;can I leave the fries and take this out?&#34;. Well, no, can&#39;t you see there is still food, that I&#39;m holding my fork, eating after so much time waiting for a simple steak?! <br><br>Oh, and the New York style steak with &#34;veggies&#34; were only those miserable pieces of green beans. At least they changed my mashed potatoes for sweet fries. <br><br>And the floor of the dining room was so greasy it was dangerously slippery. <br><br>Won&#39;t go back to this one.

I love going to this Cheesecake Factory. Everybody is welcoming as you walk in, you are usually seated in 5-10min as checking in at a host stand. Service was always very fast and the food is standardized and really tasty. What stood out this time and i had to write a review is our server Chante, i got to tell you, she is amazing! Me and my friend were laughing the whole night, she is so positive and very knowledgeable about the menu, she recommended the cheesecakes and they were to die for. Definitely will be coming back!
Negative star for service. Service is especially bad at the cake counter. Kept me waiting for a long time even though the order was ready. 1 star for food probably!

The worst service ever! The two peoples the work in front reception even look at my face! And they said you have to wait 10min! Theres nobody inside the restaurant. <br>They are very mean peoples! You guys should hire better peoples to work with with public. The peoples with public should be more polite. This Cheesecake Factory its the worst service. Please don&#39;t say its good for me! I know whats good service is. Those two host work in front! Its should be more trained. Work with public its a challenge if you don&#39;t have a good day don&#39;t put on the clients. Don&#39;t go work. But don&#39;t treat your clients like a wall! They even look at my face or said good morning to me. Just said if you table need wait. A lot of table empty but have to wait.<br>So please choose better your employees!
My all time favorite restaurant. Specially the large variety of dishes that you get is amazing. Chicken samosa with mint chutney is mind blowing and the cheesecakes omg very yummy.

Such great cheesecake and the waitress Stacey is amazing! So energetic-so sweet-great recommendations! Best cheesecake I&#39;ve ever had and the place is really nice too! A bit crowded but depends on when you go.

What&#39;s good about going to a chain, is knowing what to expect. This Cheesecake Factory is no exception. <br><br>The food was just as good, the service friendly and accomodating. It was very baby friendly. On a saturday afternoon, the wait wasn&#39;t too bad- about an hour. <br><br>My only complaint is that the entrance sent you to the back of the resturant so you had to walk through to get to the front which was a little bit awkward.

This is my favorite cheesecake location because the staff are really nice and professional here and they time the food to table arrival time perfectly, the avocado spring roll appetizer always arrives crisp with the warm delicious gooey avocado pieces inside.<br>The bread basket contains this brown chocolate looking toast that tastes amaaaazing. It&#39;s not chocolate but it&#39;s delicious! <br>The spaghetti with meatballs was surprisingly good, the marinara sauce was addictive, noodles were yummy, and best of all the meatballs were not boring, they had herbs and spices all over inside of them!<br>The shepherds pie was very meh. Salty..<br><br>If you&#39;ve never been to a Cheesecake Factory location, portions are huge! Which is great to take back.

Solid. As in these cheesecake slices are solid. Solid like bricks. This may sound bad at first, but I&#39;d take a solid piece of cheesecake over a piece of fluff any day!<br><br>My visit was as normal as normal gets. A friend (let&#39;s call her H) and I came in to share a slice for dessert, we somehow managed to wander the entire shopping area before finding this place! We clearly weren&#39;t that hungry. So H decides that I can be her bf for the day bc only couples share dessert, but everyone in the bar area was sharing dessert so no shame there!<br><br>There wasn&#39;t much of a wait for the lounge at 8pm on a Wednesday night, and we were in and out in no time. Service was quick and attentive. Take a chance and try a flavor you&#39;ve never had before! I&#39;d personally only come for the dessert, but their regular entree portions are huge so come hungry! <br><br>PS. If you&#39;re not in a hurry, grab your slice to go and eat in the garden of the shopping area. You&#39;ll save a dollar too (tip)!

I heart Cheesecake Factory so just had to come here on a recent visit to Boston!<br><br>We had lunch. I had the spicy chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries followed by the new addition to their cheesecake menu - an amazing hazelnut chocolate cheesecake!!<br><br>Same decor etc as every other Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>The only reason I&#39;m not giving this particular Cheesecake Factory a five is because the service was pretty slow.

So just got back to this place twice recently bc a generous family member gave us a gift card. Both time we had not so good service.<br><br>First time we came right before closing time, around 11:30 pm so I dont really want to blame the bad experience on anyone but us. But you should avoid going this time if you can. The waiter didnt give us bread, which I figured due to the closing of the bakery. However, he didnt mention or apologize about it. The main course was so so. For dessert, we asked for cheesecake and was informed that they were no whipped cream since they are closed. I said it&#39;s fine but somehow we ended up with whipped cream anyway. I discussed with my hubby to bring the cake home since I dont want to make the staff wait for us any longer. So when my husband told the waiter to just box the cake and get the check, he said he already ordered it to go (???) Again, It&#39;s midnight, I dont blame him but yeah this isnt the best time to visit. Not once our water was refilled.<br><br>2nd visit, we came on a Sat and waited for 40 + min. I never knew they can get so busy. I got the cabonara and it isnt one really. I&#39;m not an Italian food expert but I know cabonara&#39;s sauce is made with cheese and eggs, but it was with cream. I was so white and wet that it&#39;s more like a alfredo sauce. It was still delicious but thats just misbranding. And again, no water was refilled. The waitress this time was nice though.<br><br>On the plus side, the cheesecakes was delicious both time. The chocolate mousse (recommended by our first water) was a chocolate bomb, so yummy. The chocolate hazelnut crunch was so good as well.

Everyone must order the egg roll sampler...OMG!  Sooo good.  Waiting on entrees, but the excellent sangria is pulling me through . Lol. I think the Cheesecake Factory does a wonderful job in food presentation and taste.  <br>BTW, we love our serverJohn.

I have eaten at the Cheesecake Factory many times and have always been very pleased with the food.  Tonight was a total exception. I sat at the bar, ordered the filet mignon and I can honestly say I have never been more disappointed in a meal. The cut of meat was very chewy and difficult to cut and eat.  There was no seasoning on the meat and it was undercooked. The potatoes were cold, and very dry.  They also had no flavor. And lastly the green beans were practically raw!  They were undercooked and cold as well. The only good thing I can say is that the bar tenders were wonderful and attentive. Great place for a drink but the food left a LOT to be desired.

The Louisiana Chicken Pasta is always different every time I order. Sometimes too cheesy, sometimes too dry, it is never the same. Unfortunately, it gets worse and worse every time I order. I wanted to get my pasta fix at Cheesecake, but I couldn&#39;t even finish a quarter of my lunch sized pasta. After coming here 5-6 times, I finally learned my lesson to stop coming to this location.<br><br>Nonetheless, other food is okay. But I am very picky with my pasta.. thus I probably won&#39;t be back for a while.<br><br>Wait time is pretty insane here during peak hours. Remember, prudential is a mall, and there are probably 6-7 hotels within a half mile radius of this Cheesecake. there are also a lot of tourists that visit... if youre hangry during lunch time or dinner time, this location might be a bad decision.
Decent very average chain restaurant. <br>Food is average <br>Service is good except the host.

Came here for lunch on a Tuesday as a party of 8 to celebrate the achievement of a co-worker.<br>Cheesecake was not busy and we had to wait about 10 mins for them to put a table together which I thought was surprising when I walked in and saw all the empty tables.<br>Our waiter, Paco, was good, he was able to remember who ordered ice water, water with no ice, and lemon with water. He was patient when we told him to come back so we could have more time to decide what to order.<br>I ordered the California avocado lunch salad without onions. The salad was recommended by the waiter. I ordered the salad with dressing on the side because Americans love to slather their salads with dressing which I don&#39;t like. My dish was presented nicely and there was a cup of dressing on the side. However as I started to eat my salad, I noticed that the dressing was mixed in. I was disappointed but decided to eat super-dressed salad. If you&#39;re going for salads, I highly recommend sweetgreen over salads from cheesecake.<br>After we finished eating, we ordered 2 desserts to share: 30th anniversary chocolate cheesecake and the strawberry shortcake. Never ever ever order the strawberry shortcake. The cake was dry and tasted really old. The ice cream and strawberries weren&#39;t able to recover the dish on their own. I&#39;m not a huge fan of cheesecakes, but the cheesecake was 10x better than the shortcake. We only ordered the shortcake because the person we wee congratulating isn&#39;t a fan of cheesecake.<br>Overall, service at the table was good. We had to wait in a half empty restaurant for a table. Food was ok, I really only come here for work outings.

I feel like you can never go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory. An American chain that serves EVERYTHING and when I mean EVERYTHING - just browse the menu! It is overwhelming, but they definitely have something you&#39;re looking for.   Attire is anything from nice to casual. It really doesn&#39;t matter what you wear. It may look fancy-ish, but it&#39;s low key. Good for groups, couples, families. Indoor and outdoor seating. The portions ARE HUGE! Remember that!<br>Go at a peek time and there is going to be a wait, however this restaurant is very large so turn around. Note that you could be waiting an hour during peek ours. Try to go just before prime times.  Free bread before your meal, the brown bread is my favorite. You can always ask for more and they are happy to bring it. I have never had a bad meal there, so no complaints. After dinner you may be too full for cheesecake, but definitely browse their trillions of options and you can always get it to go.

I don&#39;t expect a whole lot when dining at a Cheesecake Factory but my experience at this particular Cheesecake Factory was less than ideal. From my personal experience I think this place actually only should get 2 stars but since the other members in my party liked their food I gave a star back.<br><br>First off, we got there at 5:38 and were told it would be a 1 hour wait.  This was fine as we were a large group and longer wait times were to be expected.  We were finally seated OVER TWO HOURS later because they were waiting for a group to finish.  <br><br>The biggest strike against this place was because after the over two hour wait, my food was absolutely inedible. It was so disgusting I couldn&#39;t eat more than a couple of bites.  The chicken in the enchiladas were burnt and hard when you would normally expect soft shredded chicken inside.  I will never order that from Cheesecake Factory again. I left hungry and had to order take out when I got home.<br><br>The stars I gave were because the cheesecake is delicious and the wait staff and bartenders were friendly.  I also did like the chicken pot stickers so it gave me an indication that not all the food was puke worthy.

Up sides: Not very expensive, location, portion sizes.<br>Down sides: My wife ordered Filet Mignon but they brought her some other steak like ribeye or something like that. After we received our check we waited like 15 minutes for final checkout.
The place has great food.. It has an amazing ambience and delicioilus cakes.. Tried the &#34;Original Cheesecake&#34; simply loved it..!!

I went here two days in a row before I decided I had to try other dining places as well before going back home to Norway <br>The dishes are delicious, the menue varied, and the portionsizes is out of ordinary dimensions  You will definately be FULL after the salad dishes. And salad would be one of the better choices if you plan to go for any of the cheesecakes for dessert. I have never seen such huge portions and cakes stuffed with so many ingredients (and kcal&#39;s!!) before!!<br>The place is always crowded and often with waitperiods of 20-30 minutes....which you are offered to spend in the bar. I highly recommend the Sheilas warm chicken &amp; avocado salad with peanuts, and the salted caramel cheesecake

I normally LOVE the Cheesecake Factory, but this visit fell short of the normal standard! I ordered one of my usual dishes, the chicken parm sandwich and it wasn&#39;t as good as usual. My fellow diners enjoyed their meals (chicken with asparagus &amp; mashed potato and nachos), the portions were huge, but the quality wasn&#39;t there. We ordered 2 slices of cheesecake, key lime &amp; salted caramel, they were delicious! Service was great, our service was really helpful and able to provide recommendations and the food came out quickly. Another added bonus was that we were seated straight away, with no wait! Not often heard of at the Cheesecake Factory!

Came here for a quick lunch with the family.  We were  seated quickly witch was nice.  The waiter came over took care of our drinks right away also very convenient. Decided what we wanted and ordered.  The waiter brought bread out which the kids enjoyed.  Shortly after came out meal. Everything came as ordered.  Overall the food was good and service was excellent.

4 of us came to the restaurant after a long day of touring Boston city.  We were super hungry and were ready to get large portions.  We had no reservations, and ended up waiting in a super crowded area for only 15 minutes until we got a table.<br><br>Pros:<br>+ 15-20 minute wait even with a large line<br>+ Super large portions<br><br>Cons:<br>- Sub par service (primarily due to such large restaurant) <br><br>Ambiance (5 stars):<br>The restaurant looks really clean, and modern.  It has high ceilings and comfortable chairs. The washrooms are clean and spacious.  <br><br>Food: (4.5 stars)<br>Knowing their large portions we only got the main meal.<br>I got a Burrito (4 stars) - super large and tasty.<br>Smokehouse Burgers  (5 stars) - After recommendation from the waiter we got 2 of these instead of the Bacon Bacon Burger.  The burger was amazing.  One of the best burgers I ever had.   Real juicy with a generous portion of bacon and cheese and great sauce.  Would def recommend it.  <br>A Salad with Salmon (5 stars) - All the ingredients were really fresh and they went well together.  <br><br>Service: ( 3 stars)<br>We order drinks at the start and then we ordered food. <br>We were given bread at the start, and most of the drinks about 5 minutes later.   We finished the bread, and still waited another 5 minutes for the drink (After reminding the waiter that the drink was missing he came back with it).<br>We did not get extra bread or anything and waited another 10 minutes at least for the food to arrive.  the waiter was not around to help us.  <br><br>The bill came to 115 with tax and tip for 4 meals, and 6 drinks.

Like every other chain Cheesecake Factory. Hostess in the front was a little rude and the floor was slippery and dirty which was odd knowing that lawsuits can happen. The food was good and our waiter was actually pretty good. Location is in the back bay of Boston which is a nicer part of town really touristy.

The most important thing I have to say is that there&#39;s no plate that can be complete without the Strawberry Lemonade.<br><br>Finding variety in a restaurant menu is quite the hard task around the area, but thanks to this restaurant I can just come and eat plates from around the world without the overpriced expenses. <br><br>My favorites are the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp, Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp and the flatbreads. In the least favorite plates, I would have to add the White Chcken Chili since it lacks flavor and it&#39;s really watery.

One of the must go to restaurants in Boston. I always order their pasta and some flatbread. My favorite is the pasta they cook with wine and has penne in it. It&#39;s very tasty. Their advacado rolls are pretty good too!

Follow Up 8/13/19: I was very impressed that I got a personalized letter and gift card as a reflection of my feedback. I was also happy to hear that the manager followed up with the hostess. Thank you for following up.
I love it. Very tasty, big portions and very friendly staff. I think it is the best restaurant in Boston.

This is by far the WORST Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to!!!! Our Server had to be asked to for EVERYTHING! Our bread was COLD. My order was wrong, so they took it back to the kitchen &amp; brought me the SAME PLATE with the corrections.....now my plate was 1/2 HOT &amp; 1/2 COLD!!!! They proceed to fix me another plate &amp; it too was messed up!!!! <br><br>I&#39;M DONE.......<br><br>THANK YOU CHEESECAKE FACTORY for one of the WORST Birthday Dinners we&#39;ve ever had!!!
A lot of food! The have nearly everything you can imagine. Had the impossible burger which contains no meat at all but it tasted like beef! Solid burger and awesome cheesecake.

Be prepared to wait an eternity! Do not come here if you are the HANGRY type!<br><br>My boyfriend and I decided to go to the cheesecake factory on the basis that we simply did not know what to eat. The cheesecake factory was the perfect place to go to since their menu has pretty much everything and anything you could think of from italian, Asian fusion, mexican, etc. <br><br>Our total wait time for a table was 20 min. When we sat down the waitress wanted us to order within 5 min, but of course we needed longer to peruse the lengthy menu. It took her 15 minutes to come back to take the order. <br><br>I ordered the cauliflower steak, since it had less than 1500 calories unlike most things on the menu. My boyfriend ordered the fish and chips with a side of Mac and cheese. <br><br>Another 15 passes and the waitress tells me they&#39;re out of cauliflower. She tries to suggest something to me but I ask for the menu again. Another 10 passes and I decide on the Americana cheeseburger. <br><br>The kitchen was extremely backed up. Although it was mother&#39;s day, I would expect the kitchen to keep up with the tables, considering the establishment is HUGE and always crowded when I pass by.
