For some reason, the orders of everyone in the section came out at different times. The table to my right had gotten there after us but we watched them FINISH their meal and dessert before we even got ours. The table to the left of us ordered before us and didn&#39;t get their food until 15 minutes after we got ours. <br><br>The cheesecake factory was completely unorganized. What we wanted to be a quick meal turned out to be a 2.5 hour ordeal! <br><br>The best food item we had was the side of Mac and cheese. My burger was completely falling apart once I got it. The patty was dry and charred. <br><br>Bottom line: do not come here unless you need time to kill and are looking for a guilty meal

My partner and I stayed at the Sheraton in Boston along with a friend visiting from Denver CO. On a Sunday morning St Patrick&#39;s Day weekend, we looked for a place to have a late breakfast. We were surprised that The Cheesecake Factory offered breakfast every Sunday. <br><br>I ordered pancakes, eggs and bacon, my partner had eggs, bacon, hash-browns and toast and or friend had french toast and bacon. The servings were large. The eggs were fluffy as well as the pancakes. The bacon was crispy the way I like it. The french-toast was moist with a slight crunch on the edges and the hash-browns were nicely seasoned. We all had orange juice that tasted freshly squeezed. <br><br>What was nice is that each dish was plentiful and the cost was reasonable as compared to a mediocre yet expensive breakfast at the Sheraton.

It saddens me that the only &#34;decent&#34; place college kids seem to be aware of in Boston is the Cheesecake Factory. CF is always the default #1 idea when it comes to brainstorming a place to eat for a fairly large group. There&#39;s more to Boston you know!!! <br><br>As a foodie, I secretly die a little inside every time CF is chosen. I&#39;ll let the exchange students wanting to visit CF reason slide, but with the rest of my American friends, there&#39;s no reason to visit this place more than once a year. I don&#39;t have a thing against chains, it just baffles me when a lot of people don&#39;t want to venture beyond CF for a nice dining experience. If I&#39;m in charge of deciding where to eat, CF will not exist in my list.<br><br>Yes, CF has food that doesn&#39;t disappoint, but I wouldn&#39;t say it&#39;s outstanding. Portions are large and for the most part overpriced. Menu offerings lean towards Italian and Mexican cuisine. I thought it was brilliant when a friend ordered off of the appetizers list because of the smaller yet filling portions. Their skinnylicious side menu is an annoyance. In an ideal world if one dines out, one should enjoy food wholeheartedly without having to give a #(*k about calorie count. <br><br>Recent visits, I&#39;ve had their White Chicken Chili and Kobe Burger. The Chicken Chili is on the hot end similar to that of salsa. It&#39;s like a spicy tomato chicken soup with rice. Kobe Burger was decent, done medium rare as requested. Pricing was obvious it wasn&#39;t real Japanese Kobe beef, but their pseduo Kobe beef tasted decent. It&#39;d be  foolish to use real Wagyu Kobe beef as burger patties anyways! <br><br>Their cheesecake is on the heavy, sweet end. If you&#39;re looking for a slightly lighter, not overly sweet cheesecake, go for their Wild Blueberry White Chocolate or their Vanilla Bean.

Service was horrible. Went to celebrate my 17 year olds birthday and we decided to leave after waiting 50 minutes. They sat us within 15 minutes than 35 minutes passed by I decided to let the manager know that someone forgot about us since the table next to us paid left and another customer was seated. They got water and bread and yet we still didnt receive not even a hello. Manager J.D  did nothing when I complained the first time. When the waiter, Stacy, finally came to take our order it was almost 50 minutes after we were seated. She was leaning and almost fell on my sister. She ended up sitting next to my sister and was nodding off. She HAD to be on drugs. She kept  asking me to repeat myself but she was not writing anything on her notepad. As my sister was placing the order for the 3rd time, I went to get a manager AGAIN to tell him that our waitress was nodding off. We waited another 15 minutes, still no water or bread. Nor did a manager come to address the situation. We were there for over an hour and 20 minutes in total before we decided to leave. None of the managers ever came to speak to us, apologize, NOTHING. This was the worse experience we have ever had.

This review is simply for the cheesecakes and desserts at The Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve never eaten a proper meal there, although I have seen their lunch and dinner menus, which seem overwhelming with the sheer number of items on the menu. From what I&#39;ve heard, dessert is where The Cheesecake Factory excels, and entrees are not as much of a strength (mediocre and overpriced, from what I&#39;ve heard). However, their cheesecakes are really phenomenal. They come in huge slices with mountains of whipped cream. As a whipped cream lover, I am a huge fan of the amount of whipped cream that goes onto these cheesecakes. They are perfect for sharing among a group of friends. Every July, The Cheesecake Factory restaurants nationwide also celebrate National Cheesecake Day with 50% of all cheesecake slices, so the cost of one slice drops down to about $3.50. One of my favorite desserts there (besides the cheesecakes) is the strawberry shortbread. This is a massive dessert with sugary, crunchy shortbread topped with a large quantity of fresh cut strawberries, with generous scoops of vanilla ice cream and swirls of whipped cream on top. At only $8 or $9, the amount of food is really good value. <br><br>The ambiance at this place is nice. It is a huge restaurant located in the Prudential Center, so even when there are a lot of patrons there isn&#39;t much of a wait.

Normally i don&#39;t have an issue with Cheesecake Factory at any locations.   However tonight is by far the ridiculous night.    My family have been waiting for a table for more than an hour.   Seriously!!!!  OVER AN HOUR!  In the beginning the wait time was 45 minutes.  What&#39;s going on?  I&#39;ve checked with the hostess a couple of times and was told we still needed to wait.   First response was the table was eating desserts.   Then maybe 30 minutes later i got a response saying that the manager is checking the table.  What does that mean? People who lined up behind us had gotten their tables.   This is surely unfair.   Why can&#39;t they take small random tables and make a big one?  I am still currently waiting like forever.

These restaurants under the same brand usually feels the same. Huge rooms, dent light, decent dishes.<br>Pros:<br>Dishes were very nice. We ordered separately and shared everything. I personally favor the pasta but all others were nice as well. I recall better with pictures so see the description on my photo.<br><br>Con<br>Inefficient waiter

not that A okay. Extremely noisy, to the point that i ended up with a headache. Our server was okay, but forgot to bring me hot water. We ordered from the lite menu and enjoyed our salad and small sandwich. We couldn&#39;t resist the decadent desserts. We 3 shared a chocolate chip cheese cake. It was very good. This dinner ended up costing us $100.00 CAD, as we have to pay the exchange. Not worth the hassle of sitting in an extremely noisy restaurant. The same thing happen in Chicago, also very noisy.

Cheesecake factory will always be an all time favorite! However this experience was like no other. The waiter was so rude and unprofessional! From the very moment he seated he he forgot the bread. Once placed on the table it was hard. He was impatient when we were placing our orders. He bought the drinks out and we asked him if the bar tender could add more alcohol to the drinks. Instead of him agreeing and accommodating us, he looked at us as asked. &#34;So what is it that you want me to do?&#34; Furthermore, towards the end of the dinner I had forgotten my credit card. I asked him a silly question but serious. Regardless of how ridiculous he thought the question to be he could&#39;ve politely given an answer. He looked at me as though I was speaking a foreign language. Lastly, we were in a hurry to catch a show. So we I told my friend I would ask the waiter if we could leave through the back revolving doors. I approached the waiter and I said to him, &#34;Can I ask you a question?&#34; He said to me. &#34;No I am busy, sorry I can&#39;t answer it!&#34;, Following his response I asked for the managers name. He refused to give it to me, and stated &#34;Sorry, I don&#39;t know what his name is and walked away.&#34; This waiter was offensive, and stereotyping me and my friend. I spoke to the manager but it seems as though the waiter was going to get a slap on the wrist. If the resturant general mgmr doesn&#39;t handle it I&#39;ll most certainly be calling the regional mgmr. So the moral of the story is go to any other cheesecake factory other than Huntington Avenue in Boston, MA. The service was horrible and you&#39;ll regret it!!!!!

Okay it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory; and good food should be a treat. NO THANK YOU. We were crazy to think that. LIKE ALL GLORIFIED CRAPPY CHAINS, it misses the mark. (We do like PF CHANG&#39;S though.)<br><br>We waited a few minutes (10) before being seated. It was Okay. We had Chris (Christopher) as our server. He was great throughout the meal. Very friendly.<br><br>DRAFT PRICES ARE NOT WORTH IT, TRUST ME. JUST A RIP-OFF. <br><br>BACON-BACON CHEESEBURGER $12.95 (2/5)<br>We, also, did a sweet potato upgrade. Look at the burger pic taken. In the old classic commercials &#34;WHERE&#39;S THE BEEF&#34;. Almost a third smaller than the bun used.<br><br>SPICY CHICKEN CASHEW $17.95 (1.5/5)<br>OMG, it was SALTY and MEATLESS. The whole mound in the picture is RICE. SERIOUSLY, RICE; seriously, this place is a joke. $17.95 for RICE, what a joke.<br><br>WE ONLY DINED HERE FOR A GIFT CARD ONLY (given to us). Otherwise, we would not step inside one of these crappy restaurant. They will be like the old Steak and Ale&#39;s, Bennigans and other restaurant chains that closed.

I live around the corner from this location and have had mediocre experiences in the past, but after last night&#39;s dinner I will never go back. We got there about 8pm and we&#39;re quickly seated because it wasn&#39;t overly crowded. Took 15 minutes for anyone to come over to say hello or bring water and we quickly ordered. The drinks and avocado egg rolls came soon enough and were tasty, but the good stopped there. <br><br>The Kobe beef burger I ordered medium rare took 30 minutes to come out and was cooked through, charred, dry, and crumbly. The waitress asked if we wanted a new one (yes) and sent the manager over to apologize. Another 20 minutes later I asked the waitress to please check on the burger and she brought one 10 minutes later-pink but dry inside, room temperature, cut in half, and charred on the outside with a grease soaked bun. It was like the kitchen cooked it, checked the color inside, plated it to sit, and heated it up on a hot grill when the waitress came to finally bring it to us. The burger fell apart and was not edible. <br><br>The waitress offered to bring something else but after an hour and a half we just wanted to leave. Never saw the manager again and was offered a free slice of cheesecake and meek apology. <br><br>I&#39;d encourage anyone go visit another locally owned restaurant (there are dozens in a 2 block radius) rather than eat here.
I&#39;m a Cheesecake Factory skeptic but I just had three great appetizers and am converted. The pork belly sliders are as good as any restaurant in the city. Couldn&#39;t believe it either!

It&#39;s really tasty. Both of dessert and main course. We ordered chicken farfalla and strawberry cheesecake. <br><br>The cheesecake texture is creamy, and the strawberry are juicy. And the chicken farfalla is fantastic use fry chicken breast but not dry, and the pasta is chewy. All the seasoning is alright!<br><br>Strongly recommended!
Probably the best place to eat huge quantites of food with a great environment and service. Mango smoothie is fantastic and all dishes are what you expect.

Factory is the right word. What was once a fun concept 20 years ago is now a joke. Escorted to a dirty table and hostess asked to sit anyway and wait for a busser ???<br><br>Busser set up 4 settings for 2 of us even though we asked him not to. Server then came and asked if 2 more people would be joining us and left the extra silverware, plate etc. Nice start !<br><br>Chicken Picatta was swimming in runny, raw cream sauce (not cooked or reduced)  Chicken cutlets looked and tasted boiled, not sautéed.<br><br>Salad was underdressed and took 10 minutes to get more. Was told &#34;bread was in the oven&#34; three times before it came out as we finished dinner.<br><br>The good news is that both Cheesecakes were delish - thank God.

This is an okay Cheesecake Factory but the one at the end of lechemere is better and worth the travel. They don&#39;t take reservations so be ready to wait but maybe not on the weekdays. The hosts were okay greeted me quickly told me to wait and forgot about me. But they came back shortly and got me so I wasn&#39;t upset. Then a waiter greeted us and he was very nice, probably the best thing about the trip. <br>We ordered drinks and got a Cesar salad for an app, it was good and perfect size. I ordered pasta with sauce and my boyfriend got a spicy pasta dish. My dish came out 50% tomatoes  and my boyfriend said his was okay but agreed we probably wouldn&#39;t be back. <br>We got the Oreo cheesecake and the strawberry shortcake. They were both good but the biscuits with the shortcake were way to hard. <br>So to summarize: food was okay and service was great - probably won&#39;t be back tho.

Horrible service.  We were seated and then it took an hour to get our appetizers/food while our 4 year old was loosing it at the end of the hour.   <br><br>Food was lukewarm meaning they just forgot us.<br><br>To the manager&#39;s credit he made things right on the bill and offered a complimentary sundae, so I bumped up the rating to 3 stars.

This place is no hidden gem so I&#39;ll just add to the praise it already receives. I went here for lunch and got the cajun jambalaya. It was amazing! Loved the taste of everything. The bread is also amazing. Gotta love a place with good bread! Anyways go here! Great food and an incredibly large menu. Drinks are pretty good too. Try the tropical tiki punch.

Located at the entrance of the Prudential Centre right by the T stop, this place caught my eye immediately. <br><br>We had to wait a few minutes for a table, however whilst waiting we had time to view the vast cheesecake counter and eye our top choices. <br>After being sat down we were promptly provided with the menu, as we were only there for cheesecake we flipped right to the back of the menu to view the sweets. We were shocked when the list of cheesecakes covered two entire pages. <br>Sadly my first choice of fresh blueberry and white chocolate had sold out, however our waitress recommended that I try the raspberry and white chocolate instead, so I did.<br><br>The slices were not at all skimpy, so much so that my sugar levels were off the radar after finishing. <br>The cheesecake itself was moist and light with exceptional flavours running throughout. The bases was strong enough to support the weight and structure too so it didn&#39;t fall apart when you stuck your fork in.<br><br>If you&#39;re in need of a sugar fix and are in the area, I would recommend this place!

I&#39;ve been here several times, and they always do a solid job. Kind service (if not the fastest, but honestly it&#39;s not anything notably bad, just don&#39;t expect a 20 minute in and out), great cheesecake, and excellent entrees. Most recently visited with my girlfriend for her first exposure, and had a really excellent meal and a wonderful time!

Ordered the Skinnylicious Chicken Lettuce Wrap Tacos. I think these pictures say enough. Absolutely disgusted and crossing my fingers I don&#39;t get sick because unfortunately I did not notice until after eating half of the pictured piece of chicken.

Probably the worst restaurant experience, ever. Normally we&#39;re huge fans but tonight was TERRIBLE. We had never been to this location before and still never go again.  Starting our plates and silverware were dirty.  Server ignored us, brought appetizers with main meal and was so rude that I wondered if perhaps er had an encounter in another life that left his feathers ruffled.  He was snarky, defensive, and unapologetic. We spoke to the manager and were given a new server. Not our request but evidently the manager thought it best,  if that tells you anything.  They gave us free cheesecake but still charged us for the appetizer that never came and charged the dinner price for that lunch portion were ordered.  It was a catastrophe and I&#39;ll never go back to this location.
I gotta miss cheesecake factory. I love the appetites here even though I know they r not that health. It is really cheap and high quality.
I had dinner with my friend here. The food, people and the ambience was good. I had their vanilla bean cheese cake which was awesome.
Extremely slow service. Took me 30mins for buying just one piece of cheesecake to go. They really should consider hiring few more people to separate the job for taking order and preparing order

Nothing is ever the same here. I think the only thing that is made the same every time is the samosas on the skinnylicous menu. The salads taste like dirt! Literally like they never washed the lettuce, the Nashville hot nuggets never have enough sauce (especially if you order to pick up nothings done properly), their go to sauce is ranch which is disgusting. Even when I ask for bleu cheese I still get that buttermilk nasty stuff. The chicken and waffles never taste the same. Waffle is always soggy like they already poured syrup on it. I used to love this place but now the integrity of your food is questionable to me.

Ordered the Bacon-Bacon cheeseburger (yes, there are two kinds of bacon on it) for takeout. The burger was cooked to perfection. Just make sure you eat it right away. After letting it sit for almost an hour, the bun had become hard and of course, the cheese was no longer melty goodness. I would definitely order this again and make sure that I eat it while it&#39;s still hot.
Overall, I had a good experience at this location. I came on a Wednesday night and the wait was 10 mins. Our server came soon after we sat down and our food came out quickly. Would come back again .

The Cheesecake Factory is a classic favorite; however, the waits are obscenely long. My friends and I waited about an hour for a table, which is typical. We were seated and proceeded to order our food. Two dishes came out on time, but one dish took an additional hour. Although the staff was apologetic, it became known that the dish wasn&#39;t on our table because no one had checked to see if the order was actually submitted (it was not).<br><br>Either way, it&#39;s definitely a typical Cheesecake Factory, an American favorite. I&#39;d recommend the chicken tostada salad and literally any appetizers with buffalo in them. For dessert, I&#39;d recommend the fresh strawberry cheesecake or any of the peanut butter cheesecakes.

I must admit that me and my wife are Cheesecake Factory enthusiasts and we go there every time we find one to try our favorite burger and one of their famous cheesecakes.<br><br>Las Vegas, Honolulu, San Francisco and now Boston... the place is always a guarantee in terms of quality and flavor and at the end the price is not bad too.<br><br>As usual we had the Smokehouse BBQ Burger and we didn&#39;t get disappointed at all. Juicy and smokey as usual... better if tasted with sweet potato fries and some good beer.<br><br>Nothing much else to add rather than try it if you never did!

John is a rude server. He was ignoring us all the time and didn&#39;t check on us. We asked to have plates and he was almost throwing the plates on table! I haven&#39;t seen this treatment in Cheesecake Factory in all around the world! Not a pleasant experience.

What a mess! So we have been going to this location for years and never had a bad meal. So after waiting 90 minutes we were finally seated. I ordered the Crusted Chicken Romano with pasta, green beans and a side of sauce. After waiting about a half hour we were finally served. Cold beans, cold pasta and  luke warm soggy chicken breasts with what I described as a stuffed clam stuffing that wasn&#39;t cooked. Closer to powder than Crusty. <br>My daughters friends raved about the Chicken Parm Pizza style from past experience. All three said it tasted funny and it was not even edible. My daughters other friend had a salad that looked like it sat under a heat lamp before being served. Not sure whats going on here in Braintree but even my daughter who loves the place said she isn&#39;t coming  back anytime soon. If you have 3 hours and 10 minutes to waste on a bad meal I highly recommend this place.

I live in Back Bay and order from here all of the time and I&#39;m surprised they don&#39;t know me by now cause it&#39;s at least once a week! <br><br>But the take out service is fantastic, with employees who are friendly and know exactly what they are doing!<br><br>If you&#39;re looking to get takeout and have it be good food with threat service, this is the place to go!<br><br>Plus, they have fantastic dessert (I just don&#39;t remember what it&#39;s called )

It&#39;s my first time ever trying Cheesecake Factory...and.....meh. The food and service here was very mediocre. I ordered a spinach dip, quesadilla, BBQ chicken pizza, and a slice of cheesecake. The spinach dip lacked cheese and was overall just very plain. The quesadilla was on the soggy side and although we ordered the &#34;plain&#34; quesadilla (aka the one without chicken) there was only cheese inside and on the side was some salsa, sour cream and guac (though the guac was quite good and tasted fresh). The BBQ chicken pizza was good since BBQ on pizza is such a great combination....but otherwise the cheese was not very stringy/cheesy, and it was just a plain pizza. Their cheesecake was quite good, we ordered their 30th anniversary cake and it was layers of cheesecake and chocolate cake; although it was very sweet, it was quite satisfying. Their menu is quite extensive so perhaps I can try out their other dishes.....but I kinda don&#39;t have the urge to. <br><br>Service wise, our server was kind but he never came back to check up on us, and he never bothered to refill our drinks. We tried to wave him down several times but he never looked. <br><br>Overall, just an extremely average meal. In other words, even if I was desperately hungry, Cheesecake Factory would be my 5th choice. I&#39;d come here for the cheesecake again but food...pass.
Had a great experience with my family. The waitress was very accommodating with any requests and helped make my little sister&#39;s birthday flawless. Thank you!

Don&#39;t get me wrong, everything about The Cheesecake Factory sounds amazing 20+ pages of food options, gigantic place, great location.. that being said the staff was meh. Quite sassy, and blamed us for mistakes sometimes that was wrong. Some of the glasses and cutlery was very dirty as well.. in the &#34;moment of truth&#34; the waitresses showed themselves as people who shouldn&#39;t exactly be working in the costumer service industry. <br><br>But needless to say the food was amazing in my books.. quite a few gluten free options, which is quite nice. My food was perfect and put to my standards but my friends at the table was not, the chicken and shrimp was over cooked. <br><br>Great chain, not so great as a single restaurant.

There was a huge line for this place. I didn&#39;t expect the long wait at all. As I walk in, everything was fine. However, the lighting was awful and I could barely see a thing. When I was served with water there was a bug in my drink. It was nasty. I don&#39;t recommend this place at all.

Good food as always! Had the chicken taquitas and mushrooms. Finished up with the lovely cheesecake with strawberries and fresh cream. Took my sister here she enjoyed am glad. Special mention of the bread they give. Try the brown one (may be it is a rye bread) put some butter on top and have it. It is gorgeous!!

Went on a Sunday night and the place was packed. Food is pricey but the portions are large and the food high quality, especially the cheesecake. I can&#39;t exaggerate how large the portion sizes of the entrees are. You will almost definitely be taking a to-go bag with you when you leave. I ordered the nachos for an appetizer, Chicken Avocado Club sandwich for the entree, and for dessert the fresh banana cream cheesecake. I ended up taking some of the appetizer and dessert home. For a drink I ordered a virgin piña colada, which was just okay. I know I won&#39;t be eating here too much just because my arteries couldn&#39;t take it and I&#39;d probably have a stroke at the table, but coming to Cheesecake Factory is like a field trip, fun to do once in a while as a special outing with friends.

I give the Cheesecake Factory 5 stars because every time I&#39;ve been it&#39;s been smooth based on food and service. Their menu is 27 pages I believe and their Cheesecake selection is quite large. Their portions are large and if you plan on counting calories they now have a skinny-licious (I think that&#39;s what it&#39;s called) menu. But the calories in all the meals are pretty high.<br><br>Definitely a casual night out if you&#39;re hungry and want food with lots of options. It&#39;s inside the prudential center so if you wanna take a walk around the mall while you wait to be seated there&#39;s that. But you should be prepared to wait if you come here for dinner. There&#39;s always a huge wait. It&#39;s not super long but if they give you a little buzzer then you can&#39;t go far because it won&#39;t register when they try to tell you your table is ready.<br><br>Also, if you wanted to just come here for dessert that&#39;s a great option. You can just get Cheesecake at the front they have a little table. Oh! And they have a pretty nice bar area.

This is an beautiful place. Some slight errors here and there but exceptionally good service. This would 5 out of 5 stars but they use tons of plastic. The drinks come in plastic and are served with straws.
I had the Louisiana pasta it was very delicious and the service was great we wait like 5 mins for a table the food was nice and hot No complaints at all

I came in at around 3pm today, and to my surprise, there was actually a decent amount of people eating. Lot of people were having late lunches, or early dinners , I guess. I was here for what seemed to be lunch #2. <br><br>Anyhow, I&#39;ll just say that right off the bat, that the service we received was pretty terrible. Our waitress was slow, wasn&#39;t very friendly, never asked about water refills, or checked up on how we&#39;re doing. -1 star for that.<br><br>As you may all know, this place offers A TON of food. After 15 minutes of looking at the menu, we managed to narrow our order down to: Crab Artichoke Dip, Shepard&#39;s Pie, Grilled Salmon, and Caramel Pecan Turtle Cheesecake.<br><br>Crab Artichoke Dip- served with thin, crispy slices of buttery bread. The dip itself was pretty good; it was thick and creamy, and reminded me of chowder. The only complaint I had was that there wasn&#39;t much crab in the dip. Maybe it was blended in or something, but I was expecting chunks of crab meat. Not really worth the $11.50.<br><br>Sherpard&#39;s Pie- This was my first time trying sherpard&#39;s pie, but I thought it was tasty! Has meat, peas, mushrooms, carrots covered in a rich sauce and topped with a mound of mashed potatoes. Meat was flavorful and not dry , and the portion was pretty generous, so would give this dish 5 stars.<br><br>Grilled Salmon- Fish itself was pretty standard, maybe a little above average. But then again, I&#39;ve never really had a grilled salmon that made me go &#39;MMMMmm, OH SO DELICIOUS!!!!&#39; It&#39;s served with side of tartar sauce and steamed, seasonless broccoli. 3 stars<br><br>Caramel Pecan Turtle Cheesecake- caramel+pecan layer, followed by cheesecake layer+ chocolate brownie layer. The chocolate thing on top was super good. That&#39;s some solid chocolate right there. But the cheesecake itself was ok. Good, but not something I would want to order again. 3 stars<br><br>Love the menu offerings. Love the portions. Kinda love some of the food. Hate the service. And the prices. There are so many places to eat in that area. I would advise that if you have the time, explore somewhere new, fun, and cool to try! But otherwise, Cheesecake Factory is always a safe bet for a meal out.

I came here with my boyfriend on a weekday for lunch. I am a big fan of cheesecakes so I usually go to Cheesecake Factory for my birthday. This location was so disappointing. The food was good, but the server was not very friendly. I ordered the soup and salad and asked what kind of soup do they have. The server gave me an attitude &#34;onion&#34;. Does Cheesecake Factory only have one type of soups per day? Anyway, she never came and checked if the food was ok and if we needed anything else. The only time she came was when we asked for the dessert menu. <br>The food: <br>Appetizer - fried calamari 5/5 always good<br>Soup and salad - 1/5 maybe they only have one soup per day, but the onion soup was not good. It looks and tastes like soy sauce. The salad also lacks other ingredients and taste. This was $8.95 for lunch. I would rather go to Olive Gardens for soup and salad. <br>My boyfriend had a burger, I didn&#39;t try it so I can&#39;t comment. <br>Godiva cheesecake - 3/5 my boyfriend liked it, but I didn&#39;t. It was ok, a little denser than others. <br>Overall, I don&#39;t want to come back to this location. Horrible service when we spent almost $50 for lunch. My bf tipped her 15%. I would give her 10%.

Yum. Always my go-to from takeout to a chill Thursday night. Always somewhat busy, the staff still gives you all the attention. Food is always reliable and doesn&#39;t take too much time. My favorite is the new &#34;Chicken Parmesan pizza-style&#34;, and the Sunday brunch is to die for!

This was my first time dining here at the Cheesecake Factory. First observations  were the prices are SKY High. But, Very large portions and Delicious.  Very well prepared also. I recommend them highly. I was at the<br>Boston , Ma location on Huntington Ave at the Prudential Center.

We came here for some snacks and a drink back in November and it was just an okay experience. The service was fine and the food and drinks came out quickly. It was decently tasty, but nothing that I would go out of my way to try again. We didn&#39;t have a chance to get dessert, so I can&#39;t comment on that.

Ordered takeout from here because it was close to the hotel .  What was I thinking? The food was 15 minutes behind, cold when they handed it to me, and a tiny portion.  Do not talk yourself into this.

This place has taken a terrible nosedive. Our horrible experience began with 3 day old bread and butter served on a dirty plate. It continued with being served cold food and ended with my sister discovering a piece of a broken toothpick in a bite of her sandwich. The staff were friendly and apologetic although most were poorly groomed and some looked outright dirty. White shirts are not recyclable. Staff should not have extremely visible ring around the collar. Waitresses should not scratch as if they have a heroin addiction while taking orders. I definitely will not be returning to this location.

The food was much better than I expected. They had a great menu for more healthy options in which I chose a pear arugula pecan flat bread. I felt good about my decisions with just 380 calories and didn&#39;t feel bad ordering a piece of cheesecake. Ironically I liked the food much better than the cheesecake. I am sure the cheesecake is amazing it was just too sweet for me. It was very decitant. Overall a good experience. Xlean, nice staff. Wasn&#39;t the best meal I ever had but it was good

This location is located in the Prudential center of Boston, the host team was quick to greet me and I was placed on a 5 minute wait. we ordered appetizers and they were great I would strongly recommend the Loaded Tater Tots!<br>The service was just Okay, had to wait for refills when the location wasn&#39;t busy.

Although we had to wait, the queue was organized very effectively and we were seated to our table relatively quickly. <br>We only ordered cheesecake, but the choice was immense and our waiter was attentive and got us our food very rapidly. The cheesecake portions are massive, so we each had dessert set for the next day! Overall it was a great experience

All kinds of fabulous! They have a dish for every mood! Except sushi... I wish they had sushi... I would live there!<br><br>The Godiva cheesecake is to die for and the original with strawberries is equally fabulous. Completely recommend all Cheesecake Factory restaurants I have been to so far.

I love the Cheesecake Factory.  Was in Boston attending a conference at the Marriott and didn&#39;t want the boxed lunch that was provided.  A colleague and I ventured over and made use of the overhead connector from the hotel.  It was nice not to have to go outside as rain was in the forecast (luckily did not materialize :)  This was quite possibly the largest dining room at a Cheesecake Factory location I have ever seen which I am sure helps cut wait times during peak hours.<br><br>The food doesn&#39;t really need to be reviewed.  I got the carbonara pasta which was yummy.  The only thing I wanted to mention was that we had an interesting interaction with our server.  He seemed to be making a federal case about not being able to split a check but trying to reassure me that it could be done at the end when payment was made.  I used to wait tables and I like to think of myself as being a very gracious and considerate guest.  I only asked because I know in most places there is a policy against splitting a check if you don&#39;t mention it upfront as you order.  I would expect a lecture if I had not asked ahead of time but I was not expecting the tongue lashing when I mentioned it early while ordering.  Okay, so just say that it can be taken care of at the end and it would have been fine dude.<br><br>The hotel did have a small fridge for leftovers but no microwave to heat it up, go figure.  Pasta is still yummy cold!
Everyone at the factory had cake except for my waitress. I was hoping it was open real late at night so I could get topped off. The cake was moist, juicy...... sensational.

The bar is a great place to be ignored... Honestly don&#39;t mind waiting, but server after server after server walked by, even after we bussed the table ourselves. Disappointing and I&#39;m still thirsty....

I never make yelp reviews or complain since I am in the industry, but I came in for lunch and was asked if the bar seating was self seat and it was and we watched about 4 servers walk by and no one greet us for over 20 mins, then we finally did and the waitress came over and was very quiet and look uninterested and didn&#39;t want to be there she took our full order and never checked back. We both wanted more drinks and she never offered to get us another one and then we finished our meals and set them to the end of the table and she has not been back over for 15 mins to cash is out or ask if we need anything. Needless to say I will never come back to this location.
Great kids menu, good portions for the price and wonderful selection.  And of course the cheesecake rocks!

Worst service ever. Came here twice in 3 nights. Both times just for desserts. Sat at the high tops in the bar area as recommended by the hostess. Took forever to get greeted. Even longer to get served.
Delicious breakfast on Easter Sunday! Tried to go to Thorntons- long line and no parking- when in the Prudential mall, parked and saw Cheesecake/ a sure bet and it was awesome!!

My first visit to a Cheesecake Factory location.  We had a wonderful lunch; food was excellent, delivered in a timely manner.  Waitstaff was wonderful, Sam did a great job without making us wait or hovering.  A little more expensive than my usual favorites, but it was a day out with a great friend and the food &amp; atmosphere were definitely worth every penny.  I had fried mac &amp; cheese (appetizer) - YUMMY!! - and Cobb Salad, which was excellent.  I took my cheesecake to go - just had a few bites at the table.  I will definitely return in the future.  This place makes the trip feel like an event!

Been here with my husband and a couple of friends.<br>Food was good.<br>As always, the glitch was the waitress: so busy trying to flirt and coming back again and again to ask &#34;how was everything&#34; that she did not notice that nobody at the table was interested in her extras (a married straight couple and a married gay couple).<br>Seriously?

I always enjoy going to the Cheesecake Factory. It is by far my favorite chain restaurant. I have always experienced nice staff and fast service here. And the food has always been great! And the convince of having the subway station right next to the restaurant is extremely nice. Especially on a rainy day.

My daughter and I came here for a &#34;girls night out&#34; while my husband and son went to a baseball game.  This restaurant is located inside the Prudential Mall.  Décor is nice and modern.  The tile floors were amazingly greasy, it was very hazardous to walk on them!  I can only assume it is tracked in from the kitchen floor- which is a little scary to think about. <br><br>We ordered the factory nachos as appetizer.  She had the filet mignon and I had the grilled chicken tostada salad.  Overall, the food was not bad.  As described by my daughter &#34;its just ok&#34;.  However, the service was another story.  We sat down at 6:35pm.  Because of the astonishingly slow service, we did not leave until 8:18pm!  Constantly having to ask for our server to refill drinks, etc.  <br><br>Taking into account the cost of the menu items and obvious cleaning issues, I would suggest another one of the surrounding restaurants for your next night out.

I would love to give you A5 star review because I usually get their chicken tender strip things. This time we decided to go with the nachos because we&#39;re in a quick hurry and we&#39;ve had nachos at other locations. This order was Tiny in comparison. Practically zero chicken very few chips.<br><br>At first it took awhile to get our server to us as well. When she came she was good
The food is good but the sizes are being reduced, before you could get a big size plate, know it&#39;s just average. Only 3 draft beers. In Boston? That too few. The restaurant is just ok.

Yay yay yay I love this place.<br><br>The location is perfect. The service is fast and very good. The place is big enough to accommodate big crowds. This place do get filled up so try to make a reservation.<br>The food is super delicious. Whenever I go, I can&#39;t help to always order the shrimp Scampy, super delicious. However, the last time I went for a friend birthday celebration, I choose the Chiken Katsu.<br>OMG! It&#39;s amazing! Much better than the one at Wagamana. That place rocks! <br><br>Did I mention the ambiance is great?! <br>And Au don&#39;t think I have to mentions their desserts.

It was a disappointing experience.<br><br>Everyone who ordered red meat described their meal as &#34;okay&#34; and &#34;very salty.&#34;<br><br>I had the wasabi crusted tuna, which I would recommend if you want a large portion of mediocre and surprisingly bland fish.<br><br>Another ordered their &#34;spiciest dish,&#34; some new chicken thing which was neither spicy nor particularly tasty.<br><br>The best thing on the table was likely the kale salad.<br><br>Not planning going back.

I get food from here all the time, and today is one of many dissapointments. Should of learned my lesson the first time. Tonight I ordered two alfredo one with shrimp&amp; chicken the other with just shrimps. First of all they were literally $1 difference. Second of all my shrimps were cut in half like they were running out of shrimps, and there are FIVE pieces of shrimps so basically they put 2 1/2 of shrimps in my alfredo. THIS SHIT DOES NOT WORTH $20+. I WILL NEVER COME BACK TO THIS PLACE EVER AGAIN. HORRIBLE!!!

PSA: A food coma WILL occur after your meal.<br><br>Who goes to the Cheesecake Factory and orders just exclusively Mexican dishes? Me. But I&#39;ve gotta say--the chicken quesadilla is pretty bomb (my go to dish--probably ordered it 5 times). I can&#39;t exactly say the same for the massive burrito I ordered that I couldn&#39;t exactly finish, nor could I say the same for the avocado rolls I ordered. What was I thinking?  I don&#39;t really know. I guess my strive for novelty and new tastes worked against my liking. The two previously mentioned above were extremely sub-par meals. The factory nachos, however, were to die for--although they were a bit too spicy for my liking, nevertheless, it was a flavorful explosion. <br><br>The Godiva cheesecake, I must say, is absolutely fantastic. It may or may have not been more fantastic if I hadn&#39;t engulfed a massive burrito prior to the engagement. Oh, and the Godiva sundae was alright...there was barely any ice cream on it though...Extremely chocolate-ty though. <br><br>I think this should be a lesson for y&#39;all, save room for dessert if you can.

First, this is not a review about the food. I love the beef medallions I had there, also the cheesecake. On the other hand, the service is AWFUL. It was my friend&#39;s birthday, we had to wait more ONE HOUR to be placed. We almost gave up. What pissed me off the most was the receptionist who told us that we&#39;d wait about 15 min. It turned out we waited for an hour. I hated that.<br>Plus, Idk why the waitress took so long to fill our glasses with water. Eating that sweet cheesecake made us so thirsty! All the time we had to ask her to come to our table. That was really disappointing and it made our experience at Cheesecake Factory not really pleasant.

For a chain restaurant, this place never disappoints!  The waitstaff can sometimes be hit or miss, but the food is always stellar.  Some of my favorites include the Ahi Tartare (an appetizer dish consisting of a puck of chopped raw ahi tuna sitting on top of a puck of avocado, sitting in a pool of soy ginger sauce, topped with spicy mayo, pickled ginger, and sesame seeds, garnished with fried wonton chips.  It&#39;s a delightful Asian twist to a French dish (or a French twist to a Japanese dish, you decide!).<br><br>Normally I opt for ordering two or three appetizers instead of an entree.  Another decent &#34;appetizer&#34; that&#39;s actually entree sized are the Thai Lettuce Wraps.  They&#39;re not authentic by any means, but they are DELICIOUS!  It&#39;s simple.  All you do is make a taco/burrito with fresh lettuce as the shell.  It comes with pickled carrots, noodles, chicken in a peanut sauce, parsley, cucumbers, and bean sprouts.  It also comes with three sauces.  I&#39;m not quite sure what&#39;s in them, but they&#39;re all good!<br><br>As for entrees, the sandwiches are very good, and the burgers are very good as well.  The burgers are actually quite large, and come with decent sized patties and generous portions of condiments such as lettuce, tomato, and onion.  Plus, they&#39;re cooked to order!<br><br>After stuffing and/or gorging yourself on this delicious food, you might want to take your leftovers to go, then go home to hibernate, but what&#39;s this?  The waiter/waitress just brought you a dessert menu!  Oh no! You&#39;re stuffed!  But somehow you still have room for dessert!  Why would you come here if you&#39;re not going to have a slice of their namesake!  I usually either opt for the Fresh Strawberry Cheesecake, or the White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle Cheesecake.  I&#39;ve tried the Vanilla Bean Cheesecake and have found it to be lacking a bit in the vanilla department.  The Hot Fudge Sundae is good too, but only order it if you intend on picking up a slice of cheesecake at the to-go counter up front!<br><br>Yes, the price is a bit steep for some of the menu items, but if you want to take someone out to dinner, this is a spot that will never fail you!

Near closing time, the waitress said they &#34;threw out&#34; the bread and we weren&#39;t able to get any. It&#39;s like 10:30 pm hits and they start to clean up, even when they are still open for another hour. I got the vegab cobb salad because I was trying to be healthy. Big mistake. That salad is a disaster. It was like a the cook went to a salad bar and put EVERYTHING on a plate and covered it in dressing. I think the vegan cobb salad needs a revamp because usually vegan is awesome.

Cheesecakes Factory is my family&#39;s go to place to eat, delicious food all the time but my experience yesterday at the back bay was very disappointing! We got our usual appetizer quickly but our food took over an hour apparently the grill was not working per our waitress, she came to apologize after 45 mins then came back in another 15 mins to say we will be getting our food, we just ordered sandwiches! Apparently all the tables around us got their food and were all done! We told her to pack it up and we even ordered dessert to go! I told her I was not pleased but did not blame her, I still left her a decent tip over 18% which in my opinion is bad because I like to leave a 25% tip because I worked in the restaurant business and it&#39;s not easy! I guess she didn&#39;t want to deal with it or try to make up for it like I would have done for my customers! I regret not telling management but instead I will say it on Yelp!

Craved eggs and came in Sunday 3pm and the place is packed. Small wait but worked out fine for us actually! Service is kinda slow as expected but food came out warm. Not the best eggs I have had but they were able to accommodate my gluten free requests and swap in spinach for me. Kiddo got the vanilla ice cream and it was huge. All in a fine causal eat. However it&#39;s probably possible to find better eggs with less hassle in the area!

4 stars for the cheesecake, 3 stars for the food. Let&#39;s be real. I don&#39;t think we go to the Cheesecake Factory for the food. <br><br>They do have a nice range of options on the menu but I find that nothing tends to stand out very much. I&#39;ve had most of their pastas and usually they&#39;re quite bland. They do have different sauces and taste accordingly, but generally there are no spices or special flavors used to accentuate the natural taste of the vegetables/meats in the dish. The one appetizer I&#39;ve had that really stands out is the Buffalo Blasts. They&#39;re fried balls of Buffalo chicken bits and cheese and they taste heavenly though they&#39;re also extremely greasy... My favorite salad is the Luau salad and not surprisingly, it errs on the unhealthier side of salads. <br><br>I would definitely recommend sharing main courses and appetizers per table instead of each ordering a main because the serving sizes are very generous. It&#39;s important to make sure to save room for cheesecake at the end! And on that note, I&#39;ll just say that I think the best part about the Cheesecake Factory is the range of choice you get with cheesecakes. I&#39;ve made it a personal goal to never repeat a flavor and to be honest, they&#39;re all amazing in their own way. The texture of the cheesecake tends to be fairly consistent regardless of flavor.

My only two experiences here were poor.  The last one yesterday.  Their AC was broken so the place was hot and when I asked to be seated at a table, the gal seemed confused; I told her that I&#39;d show her what to do if we both went to the reception area.  Secondly, the service was poor.  It took a many minutes to get a server over and when she did arrive, we placed our orders for drinks and food and waited....and waited.  The management here needs to get additional help rather than under budget during peak hours (Sunday dinner time).  Really long story short is that this place is a salty, &#39;processed food&#39; mill where service is poor and taste is below average.   We will not be going back a third time.
Absolutely loved this place and there chicken carbonara soooo good. Very affordable and interior is very nice also!!

***GLUTEN-FREE REVIEW***<br><br>GF items are clearly labeled on the menu! What a plus. This makes dining out so much more pleasant for me. <br><br>They only have one GF cheesecake available (the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake). I wish they&#39;d have a larger selection of GF cheesecakes. Otherwise, this isn&#39;t a bad place for many GF cordials, appetizers, and entrees.

I love the pasta and bread here! The food is consistent and the service is attentive, even during busy times. It&#39;s a little pricey for what it is and I wouldn&#39;t recommend anything aside from the pasta and the free bread (brown bread of course). There isn&#39;t typically a long wait (I&#39;ve only waited 15-20 minutes at most) but during peak meal times I&#39;ve seen wait times up to an hour. The atmosphere is loud though, so don&#39;t come here for a romantic dinner or anything.

This restaurant had the absolute worst service at the front desk IN HISTORY! I am college educated in hospitality management and I can unequivocally say that the hostess was terrible. We had a party of 12 people and the hostess gave us 2 booths of 4, even though there were 3 empty tables of 4 right next to us. Our waiter was a saint and echoed our sentiments immediately. Horrible service! ANY OTHER CHEESCAKE IS BETTER THAN THIS PLACE. If we could tip hostesses, I would CHARGE her $100! Any other restaurant is better than this branch.

Extensive selection on the menu.  Love this place because there&#39;s always alot I can choose from.  My friend and I came around 5:30p for an early dinner ( I waited for 10 minutes or so for a table, so pretty quick for us to get a table).  The two of us ordered a luau salad ( my first time trying this and it was outstandingly delicious. It has mango with crispy wontons and other veggies in it..), pasta da Vinci ( mushrooms with chicken meats mix in with a wine sauce..awesome dish! We didn&#39;t like penne pasta so ended up having the waiter to switch it to fettuccine instead without additional cost ).  Lastly we got to have a cheesecake dessert ( had the lemon raspberry kind. It was alright. )

I came here for lunch, and the restaurant is really large and gets quite busy. I ate the chicken piccata which tasted fine, as well as the tiramisu cheesecake which was ok. The lunch specials are definitely worth it, and you also get bread which was surprisingly warm and good. Overall though the food was just ok and I&#39;m not sure why it&#39;s so popular

Always have a positive experience here.<br><br>Pros:<br><br>- food is always great<br>- huge menu<br>- good bread<br>- friendly service<br>- no wait at lunch<br>- huge portions<br><br>Cons:<br><br>- On the pricier side but far from the worst

Worst service I&#39;ve experienced. My table of 3 waited 45 minutes (at our table) before anyone took our order. We were starving, no one was bringing any bread or anything until later. I ordered the veggie burger and the bun was very very soggy. It fell apart after the first bite. I wish our waitress would have kept us updated at least on the status of our food or something. I&#39;ve been to CF before and this visit was truly a disappointment.

This was my first ever visit to The Cheesecake Factory. Although the ambience of the place was good and the service was speedy, the food was outright horrible. I ordered the Fried Shrimp Platter and it was served with fries, tar-tar dip, ketchup and coleslaw. From the first bite of the shrimp it was certain that they use the cheapest cooking oil available on the market - the shrimp tasted terrible. Possibly the worst shrimp I&#39;ve had in my life. The shrimp pieces themselves were very unnaturally &#34;flat&#34; in shape and still had an intact tail which came off without any effort and didn&#39;t seem to be connected to the flesh at all...making me quite suspicious of the place they order their fishes from.<br>Verdict: Definitely not worth the money. The portions may seem very generous for the price but trust me they aren&#39;t. They use cheap raw ingredients to increase the portions. You&#39;ll be better off going to a local place which uses fresh ingredients and gives similar portions for a lower price.

The place was packed even on a Wednesday. This says the value of this chain. I was given a wait time of 10 mins and was provided a table in 5-7 mins. The place is big, clean and has ample of sitting area. The server was kind and had a smile in his face. We were given ample time to go through the enormous menu and select our meal. We had ordered the avocado toast which was a bit bland in taste but the toast was crisp. The chipotle pasta was delicious and the best part was the giant hersheys cheesecake.. a must have for any chocolate lover. Would definitely visit again.

Great food, okay service, HUGE portions.<br><br>Do your inner kid a favor and get the fried mac n cheese balls, as a starter. My friend was a bit worried about the sauce but it blew his mind how well it worked--I already knew it did because its my fav item.<br><br>If you order from tge skinny menu it might be cheaper than the regular menu! My veggie burger didnt compromise on flavor either.<br><br>I always have to get the cheesecake to go because the portions are so big! I guess that&#39;s why you pay a bit more...do the kid another favor and get the smores one. Served with fluff on top.<br><br>Our service was fine but we waited a bit at first and saw others who ordered after us get food first.

Was told that the wait was between 15-20. Waited for an hour and had to remind them 3 times for them to finally sit us at the table. There was no apology at first for the mistake and if we had not brought this to there attention who knows how long the wait would have been. Really upset with the process as this has not happened in the past at this location. To make matter worst there were a lot of empty tables.

The chocolate something shake is really nice. They hardly have any purely vegetarian options but ask the server and they&#39;ll ask the chef to speak with you. (They will give quite a few options)<br><br>Ambience is nice. But loud at times. Pasta is good. They don&#39;t have any eggless cheesecakes / no vegan ones :(

I love Cheesecake Factory, the food is always great no matter which one to go to. Chicken Madeira was delicious I can never finish a whole meal, also the bacon bacon burger was thick and tasty. We asked for it medium and it was at its point. Great food, great ambience, great service.
Kayla was the best server we have ever had!! She made our dining experience exponentially better! We will be back and will request her table!!

I love food from the cheesecake factory--don&#39;t get me wrong. I&#39;ve eaten from enough cheesecake factories to know this menu top to bottom, front to back. So as you can expect, I&#39;ve got a couple things Ialways order and a couple of preferences that come with it. Here&#39;s how my experience usually pans out at this location:<br><br>Get seated, wait, give up and get up to find a waiter, put in an order for the miso salmon with white rice and extra sauces on the wide. After not seeing my waiter, hail one down for bread and butter. Salmon comes without extra sauces and occasionally brown rice instead of white. I&#39;ll wait ten minutes after I&#39;ve licked my plate clean before waiter comes back. <br><br>Anyway, you get the point. I love this place because it has everything but it&#39;s always terrible service.<br><br>As for the other dishes--well with this menu, everyone can find something they like.<br><br>I like the crab cakes. There&#39;s just enough crab meat to keep me from complaining for more. Calamari is usually done right. but the dipping sauce has too much....is it horseradish in that thing? I&#39;m not a fan.<br><br>Most of the pasta dishes not in a red sauce are VERY salty. Eater beware.<br><br>I love their milkshakes from here teehee<br><br>And you definitely can&#39;t leave without a slice of cheesecake. They&#39;re all delicious so do yourself a favor and order an extra one to bring home :]

Came back from The Cheesecake Factory and loved my experience here! Waited 15 minutes for a table and had the pleasure of having John L as a server! He was knowledgeable on the menu, funny and very personable! He&#39;s what every waiter should be! Will definitely be back and highly recommended this Cheesecake Factory!!

We ate here for the first time in July 2017 and had the pleasure of having John as our server.  He was excellent and did so much to accommodate us as my husband had just had surgery and needed some menu adjustments.  His personality was fantastic and we laughed with him and truly enjoyed our experience here so much more because of John.  Flash forward to today and we sat near John&#39;s section but not in his section.  He actually delivered some of our meals to our table and we told him how we remembered him from last time.  He chatted with us for a few minutes and actually remembered us - then came back just to see how we liked our food!  He told us this is his 14th year with the restaurant - they are lucky to have him!!!

I like to sit at the bar for a quick bite when I&#39;m shopping at the Pru. Cheesecake is always great, service is friendly and quick, and the 600 calorie and under &#34;Skinny&#34; menu is great. It&#39;s a big chain, but the food is usually pretty great.

*the entrance was a bit confusing. If you entered thru the revolving doors by outdoor seating, the front area is all the way back around the restaurant. <br>*there are really no obvious waiting vs order lines in the front area, so if you only want to order a cheesecake to go, ask everyone around you if they are waiting to order/get a seat/etc.<br>*cashier lady and staff were nice, and my salted caramel cheesecake slice took only a few minutes to pack. But expect tons of pple waiting around, and try to focus really hard on the staff calling your name for your order over the loud music/chatter/noise.<br>*the salted caramel cheesecake was delicious! I suggest sharing one slice between two pple, otherwise it feels a bit overwhelming.

One star only because food was outstanding as always, however it came out in trickles and there was about five minutes in between each plate. My husband had to wait almost 8 or 9 minutes to eat his burger because the sauce he ordered did not arrive. Service was a joke. Chanda took nearly 15 minutes to greet us, and we saw other tables around us experiencing the same issue throughout our meal;  Drinks took forever, she could not be bothered to come check on us, when we finally caught her eye to grab a water she didn&#39;t stop long enough for everybody at the table to order a water and 10 minutes later returned with only one. Food came out staggered, second drinks came out after we were already done eating, it was really really horrible especially for the price we paid. We would&#39;ve had coffee with dessert but she didn&#39;t stop long enough for us to ask for it. Her attitude was terrible, we do not recommend. Burlington location is much better.

Absolutely do not come here. Unless you want to be taken advantage of and robbed. Hadn&#39;t been to the cheese cake factory in almost 2 years, &amp; was beyond excited to come here. Fail. My boy friend, &amp; I were seated and it took about 20 mins for someone to come over to us. When I saw and heard our waitresses slurred speech it all made sense. (SHE WAS ON DRUGS) At that moment my boy friend said &#34;should we just leave now&#34; but me being Hangry at this point figured the food would be out in no time although we still hadn&#39;t received our drinks or bread for table. I then grabbed a bus boy who was cleaning the table next to us and politely asked him to find our waitress since now it had been a half our since we were seated and the only thing on our tables were menus. The waitress came back over and pointed at me and repeated my drink out loud like she had forgotten them disappeared for another 20 mins. Now almost one hour prior to arrival I finally got up and found a manager whose name was (RYAN) I told him what was<br>going on and he already knew who my waitress was and described her to the T. He then said that she had numerous complaints and her behavior had progressively gotten worse through out the night. I told him we were just going to leave and he pleaded and begged for me to stay saying he would take care of the check and was very sorry for what was happening. I went back to the table and they brought out our bread, one app, and on entree at the same time. I said to the food runner isn&#39;t the whole point of appetizers so it comes out prior to your meal, &amp; with the other apps we ordered? Not one and one?! I was beyond frustrated at this point and asked the food runner to take the entree back and bring out our other app. We ordered buffalo blasts with ranch on the side and Mac and cheese balls. The buffalo blasts came out right away but there was no ranch so we waited and waited and waited for about 15 mins until the buffalo blasts were ice cold so we didn&#39;t eat them. We only ate the Mac and cheese balls. The manager told showed us who was supposed to be taken care of us for the rest of the night the only time he checked on me was when he asked if I wanted to comp the entree since it had been sitting in the kitchen and was now cold.. I told him well I would hope they would make and send me out a new entree since it&#39;s not my fault our waitress was busy getting high in the bathroom.. then was very confused because the manager had just begged me to stay saying he would comp the bill. Our new waiter disappears and my self and boy friend are just awkwardly sitting there with empty drinks thinking sooo are we all set then since he said it was taken care of and no one has come over to us for 30 mins. So we got up and walked over to the cheese cake counter to take desert home since we didn&#39;t touch anything but our one app we knew we would be hungry later the SO CALLED MANAGER chases us over causing a scene saying we were DINNING AND DASHING! I was mortified and began to cry I couldn&#39;t believe this and him causing a scene did he not remember the conversation we just had!? Probably not because it was a long dreadful 21/2 hour of painful waiting later. He claimed he said he would only comp one thing off the bill and not entire bill although we only touched one plate... he didn&#39;t take anything off the bill and charged us 70$ in full for food and a miserable experience.  I WILL NEVER COME HERE AGAIN. Ps he also let the waitress keep her table right next to us where she was creepily laughing and slamming silverware and plates while serving. It was one of the most uncomfortable dining experiences of my life.

We asked the waitress for more bread please and she relied &#34;um.&#34; Her face looked pained and disgusted, as if the thought of giving us more bread was going to make her vomit. My sister and I were speechless.

I don&#39;t really like to eat here unless it&#39;s for the deserts. The food is good and service too but it really depends on what type of server you get. First time eating there with my girls I got the Diane steak which was burnt and one side was just burnt black pepper. Another time I had ordered the hibachi steak the waiter took it away saying it&#39;s not my order and gave me a steak that&#39;s a credit card size. I never met a waiter like that. It&#39;s pretty much always busy so don&#39;t be afraid to get your plate right.

This is by far the worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever experienced.  I went there for a late dinner with a friend, we were seated the process itself was smooth and painless the attendant who seated us was pleasant.  I arrived first so I was seated before my friend got there, 1st things first the bread basket.  The waitress asked if I wanted one and promptly brought it out, although I normally love their bread this one was not fresh, it wasn&#39;t even warm and was quite stale.  So needless to say I chose not to partake. Next up cocktail I needed one after that stale bread,  I decided to order the factory peach Bellini, that was delicious but unfortunately that&#39;s where taste ceased to be a factor.  I had the fried zucchini for an appetizer I ended up returning it, the zucchini was fried incorrectly and it tasted bland.   For my main course I had the farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic.   I was super excited for this, it&#39;s definitely my go to meal.  When they brought me my plate I dug right in, first thing I noticed were the pieces of burnt bacon bits, I politely asked the waiter to remake it sans burnt bacon bits which she obliged.  When I got the replacement meal the sauce was more watery and there was a noticeable absence of garlic.  Needless to say it looked like something thrown together, and tasted just as bad.  Although I took it home (I hate wasting food) I haven&#39;t eaten it, my pallet is on strike it&#39;s still in my fridge as we speak.  But don&#39;t worry I plan to throw it out I refuse to bring that type of bad food energy into 2019.  Additionally I&#39;d like to add the service itself left much to be desired but I didn&#39;t expect much that seems to be common with this particular restaurant chain.

We came here at the peak of lunchtime. Amazingly we had to wait just 5 minutes. After we have been seated the waiter came around quickly to take first our orders to drink. He gave us another minute to choose for the eating and we had not to wait longer than this. After we placed our orders we got the appetizers quite quickly. Very tasty and also nicely arranged. Good one. Talking about waiting time. After we had the drinks and the appetizers we started to wait. Longer than usual It was just about to take off a star when the main course arrived. And they were as we expected. Good taste and nicely displayed. So we give this place 4 stars because at the end we enjoyed our lunch here

i usually visit this place for food rather than cheesecake. lmao <br>i gurantee food they have is tasty and flavorful. i couldn&#39;t try all of them but whenever i order something new i have never disappointed. i always eat up whole plate though the portion is pretty big for one person. <br>the cakes there are so sweet for me and sometimes i feel some grain of sugar in it. <br>i always order cheesecake after having food as desert but i never finish it. <br>i wish they have a less sugar cake for someone like me.

Ordered food from there and clearly stated that I have a gluten allergy. Got a meal that was clearly not gluten free. When I called back to get the order amended, I was placed on hold for 17 minutes and was told by the manager that I need to come pick up the food myself. If I hadn&#39;t realized that the food was not gluten free this could have ended terribly for me. Horrible, careless place.

All of the food at the Cheesecake Factory is so good, but I knocked off a star because of the service. People at the front desk aren&#39;t very friendly, they only want to get your name and thats it. Service can be pretty slow, but the food and desserts always brings me back.
I have gone to this place multiple times. Great bread, serving size for the price, and desserts!

The wait times are atrocious. My friend reserved a table about 2 hours ago and as we came in, we have yet to be seated. There is a huge party of 20 waiting in the lobby, probably obstructing everyone else but they have the group at possibly the lowest priority. Honestly horrendous service and I have yet to try the food which better be served in gold plating. I demand a huge compensation for this atrociously long wait time.
Hoses are horrible. Asked for a bigger table and she gave me a same size table but different location. Wish there is a negative stars

To me the Cheesecake Factory looks like Walt Disney threw up in this place.  Too much tacky decor.  The menu is a book, I just want a few simple things.  The food is so so, it&#39;s an upscale Apple Bee&#39;s (ouch right!).<br>They could not over decorate and lower the menu prices, I mean I like the place but don&#39;t like the touristy prices.<br>Of course any type of chocolate cheese cake  saved the day!

If the machines in&#34;The Matrix&#34; tried to create a three or four star, vaguely Italian catch-all chain of restaurants, The Cheesecake Factory is what they might come up with.<br><br>The ambiance is impressive, on the brink of oppressive, with soft lighting, walls that imply rustic texture, and ornamental fixtures at every turn (of which there are many).<br><br>Indeed, every inch of the cheesecake factory seems to have been designed with care and intelligence for a life-like traditional dining experience.<br><br>It is this impeccable attention to detail, multiplied by 1000, which results in something other than coziness. There are few if any dusty corners, no cracks to go along with the vintage plaster appearance of the walls, no fading of the colors or warping of the glass. In short, it&#39;s perfect in a way that life is not.<br><br>The menu is absurd and overwhelming. Maybe it&#39;s designed to provide for the varied desires of large groups, on multiple occasions, or maybe it&#39;s just a show of corporate force. Either way you simply can&#39;t comprehend the full extent of the choices. <br><br>This begs the question, what is it that you&#39;re supposed to think of when you consider the cheesecake factory? Well, namely, cheesecake. It&#39;s a megalith built on the idea of dessert, but outrageously overblown. <br><br>Even the servers are sanitized and multiplied, dozens of them on any given night, dressed all in white instead of the usual black. Unique? Yes. When multiplied by dozens upon dozens? Not so much.<br><br>Which brings it back to the patrons. Somehow the place doesn&#39;t, and I suspect couldn&#39;t, ever really feel full. Even when every one of the hundreds of seats is filled The Cheesecake Factory has the feeling of exactly that, a factory. Customers are the raw material. Money is the product. Food is just the process...
Extremely busy, long wait to be seated. Restaurant was cold. Server was very nice and helpful. Food was lovely and portions were huge.
Five stars for Aliah. The best waiter ever.<br>Thanks for your outstanding service buddy.

I have nothing good to say about this location and its entirely because of poor service. I have come here 4 times in the past month (it&#39;s awfully close to my office) but have only eaten here successfully once. Each time it takes about 10-15 minutes to get a server&#39;s attention for water and then about another 10-15 minutes to get my order in. I don&#39;t know about anyone else but I don&#39;t have all the time in the world for lunch. I generally like their food but 3 times this month I&#39;ve had to skip lunch because I can&#39;t for the life of me find my waiter.
My first time at this Cheesecake Factory. We were happy with the service and the food . Nothing to complain about . Next time in Boston I will go again

Newest member of the 100 club. You know the feeling. You drop 100 bucks and wonder why the quality didn&#39;t go with it. Service was fine. The dishes were the four cheese pasta, da Vinci and the bang bang chicken.  All of them were simply average. My chicken dish was nearly flavorless. The rice was mushy. Very sparse. Onward......
I wanted to give minus if I could. Worst Cheesecake Factory ever and very rude staff!! Terrible!

Everyone likes cheesecake. I mean, it&#39;s almost as American as apple pie. <br><br>However, I do not understand the huge hype around Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve been to the ones in Providence, Braintree, and Boston, and they are consistently mediocre and overpriced. The cheesecake is yummy, for sure. Everything else is just meh. Their menu is like a book but it&#39;s not a good thing, it takes me 20 minutes just to read, and when I&#39;m done I don&#39;t even want to order anything. Nothing jumps out. It&#39;s almost too much. Not only that, but everything is an enormous portion with thousands of calories - they consistently top lists of least-healthy foods. <br><br>The one thing I love here is the brown bread they serve to start the meal. I&#39;ve had the carbonara (sans peas) and it&#39;s fine. Orange chicken is fine. The Caesar salad tastes rancid - so bad that I sent it back (at two different places!). <br><br>Try somewhere local instead.

I ordered their steak sandwich with fries and my fiance ordered the turkey club with fries. The steak sandwich was absolutely amazing! My fiance and I both liked the turkey club but it wasn&#39;t the best we&#39;ve ever had. The fries were a lot better than I expected. They give you free bread before your meal comes out which was also very good. The service was great! We were stuffed from dinner so we came back a few hours later for the cheese cake. I am not typically a cheese cake fan but I have to say that their chocolate mousse cheesecake is amazing! I love the whipped cream they give you with it. You definitely need it because the chocolate mousse is rich. My fiance got the fresh strawberry cheesecake and he loved it!

I usually love cheesecake factory.  I placed a take-out order and after being placed on hold for 15 minutes, I was able to speak to someone who put me on hold for another 7.  You&#39;d think this is because they were busy but when I got there they were almost empty.  <br><br>When I got to cheesecake factory, I asked for a latte with skim milk to be added to the order.  They then had to remake it when they added whole milk.  They then asked if I wanted utentsils and napkins, to which I answered yes.  They did not put utensils or napkins in the order.<br><br>Overall, a bunch of small things went wrong that ultimately led to a terrible experience.  I love cheesecake factory in general, and I live right near this one so it&#39;s a shame that this venue is below the standard par of cheesecake factories.

Cheesecake was good as usual, but when I asked for a takeaway box I think one of the kitchen staff had a few bites of my food. There wasn&#39;t much left of the cake and the cookie that came with it was gone. Pretty gross and unprofessional.
Keep bothering the hostesses. We were told 10 minute wait for lunch- it&#39;s now been an hour and they &#34;lost&#34; our name.

Drinks are good but barely any alcohol in them ...lots of sugar, purée and Ice. I like most of the apps but I had pasta there for the third time at different sites and the fettuccini Alfredo is SO greasy and oily. I have never seen a place use so much d**n oil on pasta? On top of that the pasta doesn&#39;t taste like anything at all. The sauce is tasteless, the chicken is tasteless...I had to add crushed red peppers, salt and pepper...I shouldn&#39;t have to. <br><br>The girl at the bar (our server) was super nice though.

The food are good the workers their are nice. It is a friendly place to eat and enjoy your time. The room lights are lite so you can see. It is a nice place in Boston back bay . The cheese cakes are delicious that is why I want to come back again. After all it is a good place and good time.

This was the worst meal I&#39;ve ever had from The Cheesecake Factory. I was in Boston for just a day and a half, and thought this would be a pretty safe bet for a good meal - I was wrong. I got the Chicken Salad Sandwich which I could barely eat 3 bites of. It was awful. The chicken tasted like the scraps that aren&#39;t good enough to use on their main entrees, and it was full of peanuts and WAY too much celery.  The bread was too buttery and was soggy. The best part of my meal was the sweet potato fries, but they were undercooked.  Worst meal I&#39;ve ever had from a Cheesecake Factory.

It&#39;s definitely not the best location of this chain. The inside is laid out very awkwardly, almost like there are two different restaurants that sort of melted together. <br><br>I haven&#39;t loved my food here as much as at some of the other cheesecake factory locations, maybe the traffic from all the tourists makes it hard to do each meal right.
Can never go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory. Definitely a once in a while thing for me because it&#39;s very pricey. Always get the same things and never regret it

Great experience at the Cheesecake Factory.<br>After I let the waitress Savannah know I was allergic to peanut oil and canola oil she informed her manager Denise Phillips who sat with us to discuss what options would work. Ms Phillips had the kitchen cook my steak/ Potatoes using olive oil. <br>MY dinner was delicious as well as my family&#39;s and friend.<br><br>Great atmosphere, great staff including the host, the two young men bringing our food.<br><br>We highly recommend a visit if near Fenway Park, Boston.

I have mixed feelings about the Cheesecake Factory in general. I love the fried macaroni balls and the food is usually decent.<br><br>However, the menu is definitely way too extensive and overwhelming. I don&#39;t trust places that serve ten different styles of cuisine. I would rather go to a place that specializes in one thing.<br><br>In sum, Cheesecake is okay if you don&#39;t mind waiting around an hour for a table and like mediocre food. But I say scratch that and head to a local place around the corner.
