Yikes!  I was in the Prudential Center and needed to kill some time on a Saturday morning.  I wanted to get lunch but didn&#39;t feel like hoofing it over to Copley in the rain to Legals (yeah, I know there&#39;s a skybridge), so I talked myself into enchiladas from Cheesecake Factory.  Since it was early, I figured I wouldn&#39;t have a problem getting a seat at the bar.  It was empty on a Saturday afternoon and that should have been a red flag.<br><br>Now I&#39;m not expecting dinner and a show, but I do expect some type of friendly engagement with a bartender.  You&#39;d think that since Saturday mornings at noon aren&#39;t exactly heavy drinking times, if you were a bartender, you would at least chat up your guests to see how they&#39;re doing, talk about the weather, or ask if they were from Boston ... anything.  This bartender wanted to be anywhere but at work.  I sat down at the bar, perused the menu and was greeted with &#34;Whatdaya want to drink?&#34;  Is this a diner on a New Jersey roadside?<br><br>I ordered lunch and he chatted up a buddy of his at the bar in regards to their latest gym session.  I had some time to kill, not all afternoon.  It must have been at least five minutes before he put my order in the computer.  Since it wasn&#39;t too busy, I figured it wouldn&#39;t take too long.  <br><br>My lunch came out and it was just as delicious as I&#39;ve had in the past.  I ate quickly and then practically had to flag the bartender down to run my credit card through.  <br><br>I&#39;m definitely thinking that I won&#39;t be back at this location any time soon.  I&#39;m sure the other staff are friendly and efficient, but since I&#39;m frequently over here by myself, I don&#39;t think I&#39;d be apt to sit at the bar.  Bar-goers beware!

A star goes out to you, with great disappointment cause I actually love this place and the food.<br><br>I&#39;m giving you only 1 star because of your cocky, racist bartender. After holding onto my international ID for 5 minutes, he kept telling me it&#39;s a federal law to carry my passport around and that I could be arrested for not having it. (WHICH IS TOTAL BS) he kept laughing because apparently I was unaware of the ridiculous law <br><br>Most restaurants in Boston take my ID, I explained to him I was there for 4 days and my passport has important visas in it that cannot be retrieved that easily if lost. Then he laughed and kept telling me if get arrested for it. You know what? I just got up and left and took the party of 6 away with me. The service was rude and horrible

I was staying at the Sheraton. The location was convenient. Although it was busy, the wait time for a table was under 5 minutes.  The drinks were strong but good.  My whole family enjoyed the selections available and the food came out quickly.   I would recommend to anyone staying in the area to hit there for lunch or dinner.

Whats to say. I been going to cheese cake for years and at times its always been good to me. The food always good but I do love their salads. The cheesecake on the other hand never disappoints always new flavors and they are just so damn good. The Copley location is one of my favorites.

It has been a few months since I came here so my friend and I decided to come back to eat. I am on a more strict diet so there are things I wouldn&#39;t be able to eat. The menu is huge -- more like a book so it does take a while get through it and check out what you want. <br><br>The place, usually around dinner time is very busy with long waits. We didn&#39;t wait long, probably about 7 minutes or so. Could have been worse, i suppose. We waited over 30 minutes once and still had to wait another minute or 2 even after our buzzer lit up. <br><br>After we placed our drink order, it took awhile to get to us - it was only water. I don&#39;t know why it took so long. Maybe they took a while to cut the lemon and lime? The bread came out and they were out of wheat so all we got were white bread which my friend and I both really care for. The waiter apologized and could get us a fresh batch but there might be a few minute wait because they were out of it. We were ok with that. <br><br>We didn&#39;t order an appetizer but just went straight for our entrees. My friend order her usual and I ordered the Grilled Salmon. It came with Broccoli and Mashed potatoes. I can&#39;t eat potatoes so opted for another green side - asparagus. <br><br>The bread finally came and we were both starving. That was good. I chose not to put butter and it was still good. (Usually i smother it with butter... mmmm). <br><br>Our entrees took a little while. The broccoli looked like they were previously frozen florets. When you bite into it, it wasn&#39;t exactly like fresh ones either -- taste just like previously frozen florets. There was no flavor to it, no crispiness, just very limpy. The asparagus was a little bit over looked and limpy as well. I do have to say, the Salmon was done just right. It was a good size piece and was not over cooked. I am however, disappointed in the 6 pieces of asparagus. <br><br>We waited for the water to be refilled but that never came. When it did, we were pretty much done with our meals. <br><br>Finally, after much wait, the check came. I was in shock they charge an extra $1 for asparagus. I asked the waiter about it. He said the computer automatically charged me it because I substituted a different side. When did this happen??? There was nothing written on the menu that they&#39;d charge you extra for sides. What if you can&#39;t eat certain foods?? So obsurb and never heard of. He apologized for it but didn&#39;t offer to talk to a manager... so we opted to give less than our usual generous 20% tip because clearly he didn&#39;t deserve it. <br><br>We didn&#39;t get dessert either because neither of us were happy with the service and didn&#39;t want to stay longer than we had to.

My friend and I tried to go to eat here on a late Friday evening.  The bathroom was filthy, there were neither toilet paper in many of the stalls nor paper towels to dry our hands after washing them. Moreover, after being seated, we waited at least 15 minutes without getting water or even bread. I would definitely NOT recommend this place, especially on a Friday night.  By the way, we just left without getting served. That this place is located at the Prudential Building in the Back Bay is ironic because the service was non existent and the staff unprofessional and unhelpful.  I would not visit this place because its cheesecake is overpriced and the service is really poor.

Dirty silverware. We asked to have it replaced and greeter replaced with attitude that it was fresh out of washing but it was still dirty. We just decided to walk out and leave at that point. 5Napkin burger next door much better.
Food was great Jamaican chicken and shrimp was awesome  my honey had the bacon bacon burger it was great as well

OMG the whole restaurant floor is covered in grease!!! Can&#39;t even walk a few feet without slipping.... Such a hazard and liability, how do they not fall!!!<br><br>There&#39;s NO paper towels in the bathroom. So unkept.<br><br>Traveling from California, I expected a chain restaurant to have standards!<br><br>I must add that the service was nice and pleasant. Thank goodness!

I&#39;ve eaten here (except, well, the one in the North Shore) more times than I can count. Birthdays, graduations, date-nights, just because - you name it. The Cheesecake Factory is a great place and also well-known, the service is slow, the menu too big, but great quality and pretty pricey. This time however, the service was the best service I&#39;ve ever had at a Cheesecake. <br><br>The place was pretty busy, it was a Saturday around 6pm. We didn&#39;t make a reservation, which got me hesitant to go there because usually the wait is about 30mins -1 hour without a reservation and at least 10-20 with one. They say us down immediately, gave us our appetizer within 10 minutes of ordering it. The cooks really do have to be appreciated here. They did a fantastic job.<br><br>Although the waiter didn&#39;t come around as often as I would have liked, especially not have my drink refilled, was slightly annoying, but everything was fast. The appetizer was interrupted by our entree of Steak Diane (slightly salty, but great meat and mashed potatoes!). Although mine was over the medium-cooked amount I asked, it was still great and made for even better leftovers.<br><br>For dessert, my boyfriend and I split a cookie-dough slice of cheesecake. It wasn&#39;t very good, and I usually love love love cookie-dough. The piece of cheesecake seemed frozen and hard to chew and that was two hours later as we had gotten it to go because we were too stuffed to eat any more. From previous visits, the strawberries is whipped cream is way underrated and the banana cheesecake is the best!<br><br>Obviously, with any Cheesecake, you&#39;re going to have an expensive bill, but at least its better than subpar takeout!

I chose this Cheesecake factory location as a blind date place for 2 of my friends and wanted to stress how great of the experience they&#39;ve had at this restaurant. They were happy with the service and food. And the price is always great at Cheescake. <br><br>Thank you guys.

I&#39;ve always lived in a city, and in NYC for the last 13 years, so The Cheesecake Factory is not a go-to (maybe I&#39;ve been to one 5 times during my 50+ years of age).  But I have to tell you, I&#39;ve never been disappointed in the quality of the food (and I&#39;m a bit picky, i.e. I like the food to be fresh, interesting, and well presented).  While in Boston I almost always stay at the Hilton Back Bay (across the street from The Cheesecake Factory) &amp; today when I arrived in town I wanted to sit outside and chose this place for lunch.  I loved my waiter (Kevin), who recommended Sylia&#39;s (I think that&#39;s her name) Chicken &amp; Avocado salad.<br><br>And.....last week I was in Providence RI, and while waiting for the train (the Amtrak station is right across the street from the Cheesecake Factory), I sat at the bar &amp; discovered their $5 Happy Hour food items (had the Avocado Egg Rolls - try to avoid fried food but these were pretty darn good) &amp; a regulation salad.<br><br>Would I normally write a review on Yelp for a chain restaurant - NO!  But twice in the last 2 weeks The CF has been a restaurant of convenience, the meals have been more than satisfactory, and the service I got today was outstanding, thus the reason for this post.

My group of four ate here near just a few days ago a little after 10 PM.<br><br>Luckily the wait was about ten minutes (just as the hostess had estimated). The host staff were very friendly. I did notice on our way to the table the the floor is very slick and must have grease or something on it.<br>After being seated we began looking through the menu. Our waiter was awkward, but did get our orders right. I would have to note though that I had to ask for a straw three times and we had to ask for refills on drinks everytime. I have eaten at this specific store two prior times though and the waitstaff was much better each time. <br><br>The four of us ordered the macoroni and cheese burger with vegetarian patty, chicken and buscuit, BBQ chicken salad and a regular cheeseburger. I sampled a bit of everything and it was all delicious as always. We each got a piece of cheesecake as well and they all did not dissapoint. <br><br>Vegetarian options here are pretty decent considering that there is a veggie patty for burgers as well as salads and pastas that can be ordered without the meat(s). <br><br>I&#39;m giving this four stars because the food and sweets are very delicious, there is a great selection (almost too big though), the room we were in was near a window and not too crowded or dark, and although the waiter on this occasion wasn&#39;t the most pleasant or helpful. <br><br>I would love to give a five star rating, but the greasy floor and not as clean as I would have expected bathroom situation had me a little worried about the kitchen situation and the waiter we had this time left us frustrated at times. <br><br>I do plan on going back again, especially when visitors come to town.

If it wasn&#39;t for the semi-decent quality of the food this review would be a single star. Went Sunday during a break from seeing the tattoo convention and got the flakiest, most befuddled service I&#39;ve ever experienced outside of a Waffle House. Our young, brunette waitress took forever to take our order and then kept promising us bread and not bringing it. When the table that arrived next to us the sat down half an hour after we arrived they got bread and service immediately (from a different, older staff member) while we were still waiting for our entrees to come out. <br><br>Asked for a salad with balsamic vinaigrette dressing and she brought me bottles of oil and vinegar. Bread finally came out after entrees and we were told &#34;guess this can be your dessert, ha ha.&#34; Rude, awful service in a restaurant mainly being staffed by college kids makes me wish I had talked to a manager before I left. I will *never* be eating here when I&#39;m at the Prudential Center again, and with service as awful as theirs I don&#39;t recommend you eat here either.

We only came in for desert and coffee.  Both were out of this world amazing good!   We sat in the bar area and  didn&#39;t have to wait. <br>The bar had a stench of a dirty dish rag.  The bathroom was a mess, overflowing trash and no toilet paper in some of the stalls.

Typical Cheesecake Factory, nothing too different in terms of food and ambience from anywhere around the country. We had brunch here with friends visiting from California. The good thing about this brunch is that it will hold you over all day. No small portions here for he price. They definitely get a star for that. <br><br>I take a star off since they had trouble giving us good seating, and the potatoes were way too salty. <br><br>Nevertheless, I&#39;d go back here again for brunch. Perfect spot to go to before attending waking tours. Might just be my meal for the day.

Very rude and quite discriminative hosts. We checked-in,  the host told us 15 minutes. We waited and then they called us. We asked for a high chair for our child. She looked at us and said that would be another 20 minutes !!!! Why didn&#39;t you say so from the beginning didn&#39;t you see me walking in with a stroller!!! Very rude!! No wonder why people keep complaining about their service. Honestly not worth your time or money.

Went here on a Sunday brunch date because a nearby place, which will remain nameless, had a long line.<br><br>NO WAIT for Sunday brunch, do you know how awesome that is to find in Boston?!?! Special menu too. Asked the waiter for a recommendation between the huevos rancheros and chilaquiles. He recommended the huevos rancheros and I was not disappointed! So good, cheesy, and the perfect amount of spice with sunny side up eggs. My date got a typical breakfast dish with eggs, toast, ham steak, and potatoes. Everything was so so good!<br><br>I can&#39;t remember our waiters name (would love to give him a shout out cause of his friendly and helpful demeanor). Management, if you are reading this he looks like Adrian Grenier.

Wow, the server talent here has dropped substantially. Dirty B&amp;B plates and silverware. This is the simplest task in a restaurant, the first thing a guest sees, and it&#39;s a big fail. At least the food is consistent here still. Cheesecake Factory used to be at the top of its game but seems to have some lazy servers now. Email me and I can come help improve this (for your lunch service anyway).

I wanted a ruben and they didn&#39;t have it on the menu. I wanted a simple grilled cheese sandwich, but they had to make it their job to load it with a pound of butter and clog my arteries. they ran out of fries and i sat there looking like a dick without my fries. they brought out our orders in at complete different times and my friends finished theirs before mine even came. once the fries finally came out , of course they were something of a salt miners nightmare. my mouth was dryer then the dead sea and greasier than the oil spill in the gulf of mexico  overall this was pretty shitty considering that it is a somewhat decent priced meal.  our waitress took away my friends present not realizing it. they didn&#39;t sing happy birthday to my friend. fuck you cheesecake factory
Ordered the Kobe beef burger. It was delicious and the portions were huge! Will definitely return.

Yeah, you wait an hour or more sometimes to eat here (especially on a weekend) and it&#39;s always crowded but dudes, c&#39;mon, the Cheesecake Factory is excellent. Their food is top notch, always fresh, their staff is accommodating and unrelentingly nice, and the prices are good. <br><br>We went here last night just for cheesecake and waited 50 minutes. Maybe we&#39;re nuts but I say it&#39;s worth it. $20 for two slices, two hot teas, awesome service, and a really nice end to the night.

This Cheesecake Factory is poor in both service, food quality, and cleanliness.<br><br>Did I mention there are mice running through the dinning room floor?  The floors are slippery from grime, and several tabletops slippery from not being properly cleaned.

I just had lunch at the C.K. Pearl and we had a really great time. A surprisingly good restaurant with fresh good, nice view of the water (marshland) and really happy servers. <br>We ordered a large clam chowder, mussels for appetizer and fish and chips. I shared between me and husband, and it was plenty. I ordered more of the crostinis to have the mussel juice after. <br>The plates were delicious and fresh, one of the best we had in the area. Also it was not expensive at all, but we didn&#39;t have any drinks. <br>I also ordered a kids menu for my 4 year old son and I thought it was great quality, with a good selection. <br>The dessert menu is not that great do that&#39;s why we are giving the 4 star review.I would definitely come back.

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE. Today we walked in and went to the cheesecake display/takeout section. We placed an order for a 6in chocolate mousse cheesecake and the cashier asked if we were OK with it being frozen. We said yes, paid, took our receipt, and then waited. 10 minutes flew by and we noticed the staff standing around doing nothing. So we asked about our order with a different cashier. She told us she didn&#39;t know about our order and went to check. She came back and said they&#39;d run out of the 6inch cake but they had a 7inch. She went to get her manager, who then came up to us and said, &#34;Sorry we can&#39;t do that.&#34; We were sooooo confused. Apparently cashier #2 told him we wanted the 7inch cake for the price of the 6inch. We hadn&#39;t asked for that. At all. So then he wanted to offer us a free slice on top of the 7inch cake that we had to pay the difference for. Nope, that&#39;s when we had had enough of this and asked for our money back. <br><br>Sorry, but I&#39;m not stepping into a place of business where the manager starts off an apology by accusing us. His employees lied to our faces. That&#39;s that.<br><br>UPDATE: Another manager called and apologized after my sister sent them a message online. Still, I&#39;m not coming back to this location.

My family and I have gone to cheesecake factories in New Jersey in many cities for many years. Last night I was visiting my daughter in Boston and went to the one in the prudential center with her and one of her friends. After drinks and appetizers, we ordered dinner... The friend ordered chicken piccata which was not cheap at I think around for $24. When the meals came, the chicken piccata meal was so skimpy that I could not let it pass. I asked for a manager and showed her the 2 tablespoons of pasta and the half breast of chicken that was $24. She said ok we will give him more pasta. It arrived when we were finished with dinner. It was very disappointing and I would not go back to that particular restaurant. I don&#39;t know if it was just the management in that restaurant or if all Cheesecake Factory kitchens have been directed to hand out skimpy meals. Also , when we first sat down, I asked the waitress to clear the dishes from the table of the patrons before us. She said it&#39;s not my job. The bus boys will be here. UGH!!

This is my favorite spot in Copley to eat. The restaurant is so big and I love going through the maze to my table. The service is excellent, food never disappoints. They&#39;re well known for their cheesecakes but their pasta is amazing as well. Portions are huge and their cheesecakes just melt in your mouth! Go for the honey wheat brown bread while you wait for your food. Super romantic but I wish the lighting was brighter!

Oh man where to start. I never even ate because the wait was so long. Table of two I was quoted &#34;5-10 minutes&#34; 40 minutes later I just left after not having my name called. Maybe it&#39;s just on fridays but the entrance was a mess of people.  I never even got a pager. Some people got pagers and some didn&#39;t , doesn&#39;t make sense to me. The way they organize calling people is a disaster. There is no screen to tell you which number/party is being called, and although a paging system is good , they didn&#39;t give half the parties one!  The people call out names but when your in a loud cluster of people, how can you hear it ? Some hosts walk around in the crowd of people yelling a name 5 times. There&#39;s about 6 seats and 50 people waiting at the entrance, and waiters going back and forth between the jumbled entrance of people while holding: cash trays with cash in it, plates, food, orders, etc. what a mess.  The place is packed. Id recommend not going at peak hours. 2 stars because I know this place is good and there were a few hot girls in line.

My first food stop during my trip to Boston was at this restaurant. My initial impression of the place was that it is a typical chain restaurant in terms of decor and menu items. They do offer a &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu for those that are watching their calories. <br><br>I ordered the crab cake bites to start. I did not find anything too special about these items except that they were edible. I also ordered the smoked salmon spring rolls which I would suggest not ordering as they were not very impressive. I found the smoked salmon spring rolls to be bland and I essentially had to drench them in the sweet chill sauce that they came with in order to add some flavour to it. <br><br>For dessert I had the classic cheesecake with glazed strawberry. This cake is to die for. Absolutely heavenly. The cheesecake itself isn&#39;t dense and heavy, it was surprisingly light in texture and flavour and had the perfect amount of sweetness to it. The pie crust was a tad salty with hints of cinnamon flavour - a very good complement to the sweet cheesecake it holds. I really loved this dessert and recommend it to anyone craving something sweet.<br><br>Overall, this restaurant was OK. Typical chain restaurant meals but the cheesecake is definitely worth ordering and eating.

I work very close by and we (me and co-workers) order 1-2x a month. Called an placed an order at 12:07 and was told to come pick it up in 20 minutes. I get there and have to wait for another 30 so minutes. Customer service was lousy when I inquired of the status of my call in and the girl went to check and never came back. I inquired a second time with the guy that seemed to replace her, he said he would go out back and check. I watched him ring up 5 separate transactions with customers who were also picking up or paying for the cheesecake that they just walked in and ordered. After the 5 transaction I asked for a manger, took about 10 minutes for him to get to me, he went back to check the order and came back with it and apologized. I told him we would not be ordering from there anymore. Obviously if i&#39;m asking for a manger I am looking for something other than a &#34;i&#39;m sorry&#34;. I get back to the office and I am missing part of my order. I call there and no lie....had to wit on hold for 10 minutes for the same manager. He is dropping a gift card in the mail to me. Not satisfied with the service.

Good food not so amazing like everyone hyped about cheesecake but it was my first time ever going to cheesecake period. THE SERVICE was phenomenal let me tell you my server Cesar was FIERCE!!! He was quick charming and on point. It was effortless yet perfect for me.y food was good the mac and cheese was my favorite and a lot of it too. It was big

I was here last summer and the place is the most crowded cheesecake factory I have ever been to... Unfortunately, this means that the service is very slow and bartenders have no time for those actually sitting in front of them... OK not &#34;no time&#34; but very little.<br><br>Food was consistent to cheesecake factory standards.

Always a fan of Cheesecake Factory.  There isn&#39;t a CF near me - closest is a 3-hour drive away so I always put it on my list wherever I go, as it&#39;s always a comfortable and safe bet where ever you are.<br><br>My husband and I had just flown in, left our luggage at our hotel, and walked over to Cheesecake Factory as we were tired from the early flight, hungry to search for much else and wanted something sit-down.  The menu ceases to amaze us every time because all the food we&#39;ve ever had has been great and you have LOTS and LOTS to choose from.  We were seated immediately at around 11:30am as the restaurant was hardly busy, maybe because they had just opened a half hour prior.<br><br>Our server was super nice. Really perky and thorough with all the questions we had.  Maybe a little too perky.<br><br>We almost always order the avocado egg rolls because they are pretty amazing, but decided to try things we&#39;ve never tried before.  We went with the fire roasted chili rellenos, the chop salad, and salmon that was wrapped in a wonton wrapper.  Everything we had was pretty delicious!  The salad was fresh, the salmon didn&#39;t taste too fish&#39;y, and the chili rellenos had a good amount of spice with lots of sauce surrounding it.<br><br>Like I said, can&#39;t go wrong with Cheesecake Factory, but once my husband and I went exploring Copley Square area a bit more, we knew we should have eaten at one of those cute outdoor café&#39;s on Newbury street.  Oh well, still a really good meal.

Good location, the best location in Boston. I didn&#39;t need to wait for seats. There were not many people dining here in Monday evening. So we get seats very quickly. We ordered rib eye, fillet and Hibachi steak, all medium rare. For fillet, it was perfect for me because I don&#39;t like very raw steak. I like the doneness here. However, rib eye was a little overcooked. I could see little pink at the center, but brown almost. And the cake was so sweet for me. Recommend if you want to try cheaper steak.

After a long day of walking around Boston in the heat and burning up 1400 calories from all the walking decided to treat ourselves to some desert while we waited for the Boston traffic to subside. <br><br>Dulche de leche cheescake according to husband was fabulous but really 1080 calorie? However very tasty. <br><br>Strawberry shortcake was massive and probably one of the very best I have ever had. This could feed a table of 4+ it was so big. Needless to say I only ate less than half. Again as I was waiting for the dish researched and found it had 880 calories so my enjoyment of is was a bit guilt driven. <br><br>Anyone who is health conscious like my family I would highly recommended looking at the nutritional sites and avoid this place. While again it was very good the popularity of this place is really contributing to the obesity problem in the country there are 166 menu items that are over 1,000 calories...just walk by!

I consider The Cheesecake Factory as the only large chain restaurant that provides consistent quality and service. I know what to expect with any location that I visit. In the rare cases where they haven&#39;t delivered to my expectations, managers have stepped in to rectify for either quality (e.g., food came out cold) or service (e.g., unusually long wait for an order or waiter messed up the order).<br><br>The menu is broad, you can come back over and over again to try something new. The portions are also generous (although I have noticed that they are a bit smaller these days than in the past - not sure if that is a trend or a few one-offs). Overall, I rate 5 stars because no other chain comes close.

The service was really bad.. We waited an hour for the tabel and more than 40 minutes before the food arrive.. When the food arrived 3 dishes were cold and when we complained they heated them in microwave. Worst service i ever had.

Amazing service!  Great managers and serves.  Fantastic service. <br><br>Cheesecakes - well:-). It&#39;s a chain.  They have awesome selection.  <br><br>Nice place to enjoy desert. <br><br>This is NOT people watching spot though.
Good food and service. The quality is consistent and the place is really enjoyable.

The Cheesecake Factory here is really so amazing, I don&#39;t know why it has so few stars! The past few times I&#39;ve been here has always been as a treat after a long hard day, and let me say, it is ALWAYS a treat. The server Shayne is so nice and considerate, and we&#39;ve had servers who are even better. On one occasion, they even brought us boxes and packing tape to our table when we had to move on short notice. Again - they&#39;re amazing!<br><br>Our favorite things to eat here are the Friend Macaroni and Cheese, and any of the pastas. The cheesecake, of course, is unsurpassed - the Fresh Banana, S&#39;Mores, and Ultimate Red Velvet probably at the top of my list. It&#39;s really a classy and delicious place to spend your evening. And, for Sunday brunch, the breakfast Monte Cristo sandwich gives me cravings for weeks afterward.  Amazing.
I love the high dome and fancy pattern decorated walls here. Warm sunshine throughout the window with excellent service. Afternoon tea time  for girls or energy station while shopping.

Well, first off every person in my party currently works in a restaurant and is aware of how a restaurant works. We walked in within an hour of closing time, which I understand sometimes can be annoying. However, we waited about 5 minutes for our sever Sarah to come over who was clearly under the influence of dugs or alcohol. Everything was fine until my boyfriend ordered his second drunk which had 0 alcohol and was filled with juice. He told her he didn&#39;t want it because there was no alcohol and she laughed and snatched it back. Food came out about 30 minutes later. My food had clearly been sitting in the window for a decent amount of time and had a clear fluid all over the top, my boyfriend ordered medium rare steak that came out med-well/well with broccoli that was freshly out of the freezer and ice cold. Sever did not come back, let someone else know about the food, he took it back, server came back in the meantime, asked how it was over the rail.. ripped my plate out of my hands and didn&#39;t let us finish what we were saying. The Manger Denise came over... the most unprofessional, inside and out manger I have EVER come across, didn&#39;t offer any apology, or anything. My food came back, the sever handed me my new plate over the rail, didn&#39;t offer me cheese, about 10 minutes later my boyfriends steak came back... same exact  steak with the same bite he took out of it.. now extra well done when it was supposed to be med rare and microwaved the broccoli . He found Denise and she argued with him for about 5 minutes telling him that it&#39;s normal procedure to heat up already eaten food and put it back on the grill to warm it up(why would you warm up a med well steak that was supposed to be med rare) still didn&#39;t apologize, said she was correct several times and that he was wrong. In this time another manger Sam came over. She was the nicest person we came across the entire night, and made sure we were as happy as we could be,and actually apologized for her co workers. About 15 minutes later the new steak got delivered Denise who threw it on the table and walked away. <br><br>Not once did Any one except Sam apologize. This was by far the worst restaurant experience I&#39;ve ever had and all we got out of it was a free piece of steak. So next time you think about going to the cheese cake factory, just remember your food is being cooked on the same grill as half eaten steak, as Denise reassured us SEVERAL times.<br><br>Attached is the picture of the steak that was sent back

Always love coming back to cheesecake the only fact I dislike is it makes a hole in my pocket because i overboard with orders, only because the food is so good. Avocado egg rolls, Chicken chipolate pasta are my all time faves. Also the chicken samosas and veggie burger are to be tried. I am sure all the dishes here are hands down delicious. The other prob is long waiting line. Cheesecake at pru is the largest restaurant I have ever seen but still they always have waiting which again speaks for itself. And love their quantity. And lets not even start talking about the cheescakes. All are just fabulous. Also should try the cocktail named *something gorilla* its yummmm!! <br>Overall great place to eat and chit chat.
This place is blah.. i only come here because there&#39;s not Ma y places to eat around here for lunch.. the food is just basic

I just want to say is very difficult to make everyone happy, however, when we leave work and we come to this place, the attention to our family is fear.<br>Besides, I&#39;m writing this review because last time we went, Diana, our waitress, was the best ever, she was polite and really took care of us, she understands the concept of family.<br>Our meals were fantastic! End of the story.

Worst experience ever. I love the cheesecake factory, but i will never come here again. The only thing that was good was my drinks. The food was dry and looked like it had been sitting out for awhile. Wasn&#39;t fresh and the pasta was way over cooked. And the wait. They told us 30 mins. Well it was 45 mins just to be told to wait on the wall for another 20 mins!!

Our waiter made great recommendations for my bf and I. It was absolutely delicious. We ordered the Cuban rolls, herb salmon mashed potato asparagus fish, Louisiana chicken pasta &amp; the chocolate hazelnut Nutella crunch cheesecake. The cheesecake was delicious but a bit too sweet for my palette.

I hate this location. I literally eat at Cheesecake Factory once a month and this is probably the worst location I&#39;ve been to. The staff is rude and the food almost always comes out cold. I once got something to go that I have had probably about 100 times before and it was made with incorrect ingredients. I confronted the counter staff and the woman told me I was full of it and if I didn&#39;t want it I should leave it. I have never been treated this way and I will not be returning.

Horrible waiter! Was extremely unfriendly. Came with a group of friends to celebrate my graduation and unfortunately we ended up with the one of the worst Cheesecake Factory experience ever. The waiter was just plain rude from the beginning. We hardly saw him, had to flag down other waiters to just get water. The appetizers came with the food even though we specifically asked for them to be prepared and served in advance. When confronted about this, the waiter instead of understanding our disappointment, was just plain dismissive. <br><br>We are used to fast service, so anything over an hour is too long, and yes the wait was definitely longer than an hour, and we sat there without any refills on water, or anything edible for that period of time. <br><br>Never going back. Avoid this location!

Food was pretty good - I went with a party of four, and we rarely go to Cheesecake so we didn&#39;t really know what to get, but our server, Matt Yang, definitely made the experience a lot better! He was friendly, helped us make our food choices, and was very professional.

In any Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been in, in any state, I have never ONCE had anything except exceptional food and service. I was a waitress as a teenager and young adult so I appreciate good service.<br><br>I got out of work here today, the day before Thanksgiving, early, and it was pouring rain.  I needed to eat lunch, and since my bus wasn&#39;t going to come for another hour (and it was so dreadful out, I really didn&#39;t want to walk far), I came in around 11:15 AM and asked for a quiet table.<br><br>As I was dining alone, they let me sit far away from the few groups that were there.  Dining alone is always awkward and their bar area wasn&#39;t open at this time, so I had a booth away from the other guests.<br><br>I had a Diet Coke no ice, Garlic Noodles, and free bread. (Saying &#34;free bread&#34; makes me think of Jim Gaffigan).  The Diet Coke was good, the free bread was good, and the Garlic Noodles were good.  Everything was great, and my waiter was so nice.  He didn&#39;t make me feel awkward for eating alone, which surprisingly, some waiters can do!

Normally, I don&#39;t write reviews about chains because they&#39;re all the same and I assume no one really benefits from it...but this cheesecake factory really deserves props for how they handled our crowd on Wednesday night.<br><br>A group of 24 of us came to the restaurant (reservation at 6PM, but of course, only 19 of us were there by 6:10PM). Even though on the phone, they had said we couldn&#39;t be seated until the entire party was seated, they graciously seated us in the back with two gigantic tables where we could be loud and rowdy like how birthday guests are supposed to be without being completely isolated from the restaurant. <br><br>I won&#39;t comment too much on food since it&#39;s pretty standard - many of us ordered from the skinnylicious menu for the first time, which was a little small portioned, but to be expected. Regular menu items were MASSIVE (definitely two meals worthy if you want to save money/ prevent obesity). <br><br>When it came to checks, they separated everyone&#39;s bills in an orderly and prompt way, which included 20% gratuity so no one had to embarrass themselves by pulling out the cell phone calculator. <br><br>I usually dread large birthday dinners because when money&#39;s all pooled together on one check, there&#39;s ALWAYS $10 missing somehow. Cheesecake factory made it easy for people to be accountable and service for such a large group was impeccable. <br><br>Oh, and they sang the birthday song with us - extra props :D

I came with some friends long time ago. It still gives me a good memory. It has nice salmon here. The one I ordered is herb chicken which just fulfilled my taste. They also serve nice cakes, my favorite one is the mango cheese cake.

I am very impressed with our waiter .Asa very helpful.  I don&#39;t usually give 5 stars , but he was very nice to us . We hadn&#39;t been to cheese cake factory in more the 6 years . So this was all new to us . Food was great too .

I went to the Cheesecake Factory for a reunion dinner. While planning, we called ahead and asked for a reservation. The first time we called, we were told that they did not take reservations. The second time another member called, someone allowed a reservation for us at 4:30.  When we arrived, we were told there was no reservation under our name so we had to get a pager and wait 30 minutes and that was fine. The part that was the most appalling part was when a waitress (not even a hostess) called out the name of our party&#39;s name. She kept calling so we went up. She looked at us, we said the party&#39;s name and then she looked at us with a disapproving look and said &#34;Is your pager buzzing?&#34; When we responded no, she said &#34;Nice try.&#34; Um, since when did we need to prove our identity? She continued to call the party&#39;s name but no one stepped up. So they moved on to another table. We waited another 20 minutes before we knew that we had been waiting way over a half hour. So my party went up and asked about the reservation as well as when we would be seated. They conveniently said that we were next. When we were lead to our table, we were seated at a booth meant for four with a chair at the end. No other booth had that kind of arrangement. It looked like the table had been put together in a rush and last minute. My party was positive that the table being called earlier was ours. <br><br>The rest of our experience was okay. The service from our waiter was okay, but there could definitely be room for improvement. I would like to think that the waiter was new and was trying to still get the hang of things. The food was as expected. <br><br>I am very put off by the way the staff talked to us, as if we were trying to take someone else&#39;s place in line. No one else was coming forward and the name they had been calling was one of my party members. We genuinely thought that she was calling our party. I felt that it was very unnecessary for the hostess to talk to us that way. We were polite the entire time as well as treated the staff with respect. I am not sure that person should be in an industry that involves being nice to customers. What I noticed the biggest problem about this location is the staff. The host/hostess stand seemed very unorganized, the waitstaff seemed to be less than thrilled to be there. It&#39;s understandable, not many people want to WANT to work in the industry, but if you&#39;re going to at least try and hide how much you hate to be there.
This was a surprisingly nice place, the food was decent, the prices ok. (One star off for not so clean tableware)

I love the cheesecake factory---for its cheesecakes and their food.<br><br>Usually there&#39;s some sort of wait--maybe a 15 min wait at this location, but this past friday, there was no wait at 6pm! Our server was nice, but he didn&#39;t give me my water with lime, and i mentioned lime 3 times..making sure he understood, and my friend didn&#39;t get a lemon with his water. Their nachos with the spicy chicken--GET IT! Would be better with more cheese, just because I love cheese, but it&#39;s sooo good. The fried calamari was delicious, especially paired with the cocktail sauce, the other garlic sauce? My friend says not so much. My other friend enjoyed his Margarita flat bread. I wish I got a taste of it, so I can tell you whether it&#39;s good or not, but it looked pretty appetizing! And again, our server did not rush us out, and he tried to sell us some desserts, but alas, we weren&#39;t that hungry after we devoured our meal.<br><br>Their cheese cake is good, as with all the other locations. The tirimisu cake is my favorite..Their mojito is pretty good too.
Matthew H was an amazing server! Really attentive, took time with us. Will definitely come back!

They failed they failed they failed. I cannot tell you how disappointed I am in this place. Twice I tried to eat here during Anime Boston and twice they tried to kill me!!<br><br>IF YOU HAVE A FOOD ALLERGY JUST STAY AWAY THEY ARE UTTERLY INCOMPETENT!!!!!!<br><br>First fail happened when the moron waitress gave me a Dr. Pepper instead of a root beer. I immediately went into anaphalaxis and had to use my epi pen. Obviously we left. The Providence location is awesome, so I had high hopes for this place, so in thinking it was just the waitress who failed, we decided to give them another chance. I ordered a pasta dish loaded with garlic and substituted the shrimp for chicken. While I&#39;m not allergic to shrimp, I&#39;m pretty much allergic to every other kind of seafood, and since shrimp is commonly contaminated by other seafood, I thought chicken would be safe. I informed my waitress that I had a major seafood allergy and told her I wanted chicken instead. Well, what ended up on my plate? I found 2 stray pieces of shrimp in my dish. I refused to touch it and we left. Never again Boston Cheesecake Factory, never again.

We ordered an appetizer and entree. The waitress didn&#39;t write the order down, when the food came out it was dumped on the table on the table by &#34;runner&#39;s&#34; and everything came out at once.  We never saw the waitress until it was time to pay. We had to ask repeatedly for ketsup, salt.  When placing the order I asked for dressing on the side for the salad, the salad was soaked with dressing.  In hind sight we should have requested to see the manager.  In the end we will never go back. Too many other options available in Boston with better service.

Started sucky, but ended like a good Pam Anderson home video. <br><br>I usually don&#39;t Yelp about major, fan-famous food joints, but my experience here yesterday warranted a review.<br><br>I went there with 7.5 family members (0.5 for the new pint-sized addition that&#39;s all of 8 months old), around 3pm-ish (to escape the horrendous dinner crowd that NEVER seems to go away.<br><br>Now, I&#39;m a Cheesecake factory regular up and down Southern California, so I&#39;m used to the all-to-infamous crappy-hostess-that-makes-you-wait-because-I&#39;m-too-good-for-you attitude, but yesterday they took it to a new level. There were about 3 hostess&#39; there, and they all acknowledged that I had 7.5 people, and the wait would be about 5-10 minutes.<br><br>About 30 people piled in after our group, including a party of 8 and party of 6. Within 15 minutes, both groups got seated before me. 35 minutes later (which is my normal Cheesecake factory fook-it--gimme-my-damn-table-now bar), we were still waiting, and I sent in the family informer (my 3 year old daughter) to ask if our table was ready. Nope.<br><br>Granted, one of the girls came up and &#34;double-checked&#34; on my table needs (which we all know is industry lingo for &#34;oops, we totally fooked up your table order&#34;). At this stage, the family psycho (my sister) took over.<br><br>Now... here is my issue. I&#39;m from LA. I&#39;m used to waits, unless I&#39;m with my celeb friends. And I&#39;m the pretty laid-back mellow fellow that doesn&#39;t get mad at a lot of things that typically drive others nuts. BUT, at least the host/hostess has always been frank about it and managed my expectations. This snooty blondie I-think-I&#39;m-hot-and-have-the-power 4&#39;5&#34; barbie-wannabe didnt&#39; even have the courtesy to apologize or excuse herself, and simpy said &#34;well if you have an issue, I&#34;ll get the manager..&#34;.  <br><br>Dude, this is Boston, not LA. I frickin own you, you $5.50/hour bimbette that actually didn&#39;t brush your teeth properly because you had ass-breath underneath that cheap-excuse of an immitation tic-tac you chewed on an hour ago.<br><br>At this stage, I started to get...... sweaty palms... not a good sign if you&#39;re 1/2 Sicilian like me. That&#39;s usually the first step before I threaten somebody with &#34;i know where you live...&#34;<br><br>Now... the good thing, the manager, a nice lady named Katrina, came out, very nice, very apologetic (and hey, even if she was acting, she acted well), walked us to our table, and gave us all our appetizer orders on the house. Now... psycho sister took that offer to the max with 5 appies, but for myself, I really liked that she at least had a great attitude.<br><br>I&#39;ve been in the food business, hotel business, and rent-a-car business. People mess up all the time by mistake. But have the decency to keep the customer/client happy and manage their expectations. Frickin apologize if you fook up. <br><br>I was so ready to slam this place down with my lawsuit forte (18 and counting, and all wins so far), but Katrina saved the day, and gave us a very friendly, very helpful water named Gray (yes, like the color). <br><br>I was happy, gave Gray a very generous tip (gave him what the appies would have cost), because I personally don&#39;t give a hoot about freebies in an upscale environment. I just want good food and service.<br><br>The food? LOVED the Bang-Bang Thai chicken, the Thai Lettuce wraps, the crispy spicy beef, and the avocado eggrolls (VERY creative).<br><br>The fish tacos were a total miss. I&#39;m a fish taco connaisseur, a these were a yuckfest.<br><br>The kids loved the cheese pizza, and the garlic noodles were decent.<br><br>Banana cheesecake, and strawberry cheesecake were up to par (great). I left thoroughly satisfied, but mostly because mom said she finally found a restaurant in the Backbay where she adores the food.

My friend and I recently dined at this establishment. <br><br>Let&#39;s face it, it&#39;s a standard chain, with standard food. Not that the food was particularly bad, but it wasn&#39;t particularly good either. <br><br>Service was pretty blah. Our waiter didn&#39;t do anything crazy, it was more what he didn&#39;t do. For example, he certainly didn&#39;t pick up dirty dishes, and our dirty appetizer plates were on the table until the end of the meal, and he certainly didn&#39;t check up on his often, as water glasses were dry and ready to be filled most of the meal. <br><br>If you expect good service or exciting food, this may not be your place. If you&#39;re happy with standard chain fare, with poor service, then this is it.

So this Cheesecake Factory has a lot of good and bad things about it. Okay let&#39;s first start off with the fact that they don&#39;t take reservations so depending on what day and time you go be prepared for a wait. Because I&#39;ve been here before on a Saturday and it was packed with an hour wait. But I came here today on a Wednesday night and there was no wait at all. So it&#39;s pretty much luck of the draw. I went with a group of 4 and managed to get a booth seat. As an appetizer I got the buffalo wings. They were good but the skin was kind of chewy. The buffalo wings aren&#39;t that spicy so those with timid taste buds have no fear. My friend asked for the shrimp scampi pasta and they messed up her order so make sure your waiter understands your order. As a quick side note the bathroom here is mad nice. The lighting in there (and the whole restaurant at that) is really dim. Nice for the atmosphere but terrible for pictures (hence why my food pictures suck &amp; I&#39;m not a good photographer). My main dish I got the Cajan Jambalaya Pasta. I&#39;m a person that enjoys extremely spicy food and the description of the Cajan Jambalaya Pasta said that it was in a very spice sauce and it really wasn&#39;t even that spicy. So don&#39;t be fooled. It&#39;s still a great dish though (enjoy the picture of me obnoxiously eating my pasta). For the desert I got the Dulce De Leche Cheesecake. Okay this had to be my favorite part of the meal! I&#39;m not usually a fan of Cheesecake Factory cheesecake surprisingly. But this one has me re-questioning not liking their cheesecake because this cheesecake was fucking delicious! If you&#39;re a fan of caramel this is the one for you. Delicious and it cuts real smooth. Make sure to get the whip cream with it!
It&#39;s a good place to go if you want steak. But bad service!!! We are Asian so the waitress looks so unhappy. And we got the bread after ours meals. That&#39;s ridiculous ！！ Never come back!!

Okay, the skeezballs that work here really creep me out.<br><br>Like, one guy actually sat at our table to talk with us, which could be friendly, but then when he gives you his myspace page, turns into like, a breach of company policy or something.  (Funny at the time, creepy upon reflection.)<br><br>Last time we got a used car salesman with a cheesy smile, who just so happened think that every dish we ordered was his absolute favorite on the enormous menu.<br><br>The woman who sat us (a server) did what the hostesses couldn&#39;t seem to (sat us) and was genuinely friendly.  She actually took the time to learn how to pronounce my name correctly.  Nice!  Also, Michael is a hilarious waiter full of jokes and speils and ways to con you into eating more cheesecake. <br><br>I still think the Crusted Chicken Romano is the sh*t and last time I got it, it fed me gourmet leftovers at work for two days!<br><br>Adam&#39;s PB Fudge Ripple Cheesecake also rocks my world, even though I could&#39;ve sworn it was brown when I got it in the dimmer lights of the Burlington CF.  Anyways, CF is good fun and all, but watch out for those male waiters.  They might give you the heebee jeebies, or if you let them get too close, something even worse!

My mother has a peanut allergy. It is hard to find a restaurant that takes the time to make sure the food is safe for my mother to eat. We walked in and the hostess told us to step aside and she would find out if my mother would be able to eat there. with in minutes the manager arrived and was happy to answer any questions. after assuring us that it was safe to eat there. we were seated. the manager alerted our waiter  and he came to the the table and told us he knew about moms allergy and would take care of her.  <br>The food was wonderful as was the service.

Yes, CCF is a chain, but I really do love it.  So many great menu items, it&#39;s always hard to choose.  They have a newer &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu, w everything less than 590 calories.  I&#39;d rather splurge on drinks and dessert, so on my last visit, I ordered a salad off the skinny menu.  It was delicious, more of the size of their &#34;appetizer&#34; salads, which are still quite large.  The strawberry martini here is amazing.  Fresh strawberries muddled and mixed w vodka-tasty and strong! The pear martini is a little too sweet for me.  My favorite cheesecakes are: Adam&#39;s PB Cup, Stephanie&#39;s Red Velvet and Chocolate Tuxedo Cream.  I don&#39;t eat here often, I&#39;d be 300 lbs, if I did, so it&#39;s always a welcome treat to go here and indulge a little!

Food was alright although the wait was terribly long as we went by on a weekend. I had the nachos, which was a huge portion fit for two. Although it was an appetizer, it really should have been listed under entrees! The chicken salad was also a massive portion. We were so full that we did not order mains after that. <br><br>The food was okay, but it&#39;s become the kind of chain restaurant that I wouldn&#39;t go for a special occasion like a birthday celebration. The wait was long although service was decent. Dessert is the big hit here of course, like the Godiva Cheesecake and Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Cheesecake. Excellent desserts, whole meals on their own. Actually, to skip the lines and have the best food available (cheesecake), I think the next time I&#39;ll go have dinner elsewhere with a shorter waiting line and either come here for dessert after the dinner crowd is gone; or even take home the cheesecakes for some delectable, delicious end of meal savoring!

4 STAR DINING IN:<br>My boyfriend and I visited this location while on vacation once and now that we&#39;re official Bostonians, we frequent this spot.<br><br>We are literal junkies for the red velvet cheesecake!<br><br>The food is decent, my favorite dish is the Chicken Di Pana and my boyfriend&#39;s was Mexico City. They cancelled it; life went on, he ordered something else, but it&#39;s such a pain when companies get rid of classics and things that their consumers like!<br><br>The (non-alcoholic) tropical smoothie is also amaze- perfectly blended and super fresh and fruity!<br><br>Honestly, if it weren&#39;t for the fruit smoothie and cheesecake (mostly the cheesecake), I wouldn&#39;t necessarily care to eat here because the food options are limited (they&#39;re all basic variations of the same main dish).<br><br>The customer service is good, nothing to rant or rave about.<br>Friday and Saturday nights have unnecessarily extended wait times.<br><br>PROS: Great location, great dessert, nice ambiance,<br>CONS: long wait times, decent/somewhat bland meals that are slightly overpriced<br><br>---<br><br>5 STAR CATERING:<br>My sisters and I used their catering service for my mom&#39;s bridal shower/bachelorette party in August. Food was prepared on time and nicely packaged/handled. It was absolutely delicious and reasonably priced considering it was catered Cheesecake Factory. Someone from the dessert counter helped us bring the food out to the car and the catering customer service was really awesome in general. Again, the food was immaculate and only needed minimal heating by the time it arrived to our place!

Just like any other Cheesecake Factory, but be prepared to wait by a wall for 15-20 minutes AFTER they buzz you. They should buzz you when they are ready to seat you, not when they&#39;re ready to line you up by the wall. The lobby is extremely crowded and full of stinky, sweaty people because of this.
What a delightful late lunch we had, ahi carpaccio, catfish and steak medallions but what really topped it off was the 5  service we received from Matt Yang !

Its Cheesecake Factory, a 3 star venture. Giant menu, decently cooked food served in ridiculous proportions in an other-worldly looking  venue.  This is a restaurant for women, guys go there to please them but there is still enough good stuff on the menu to make it tolerable. Just get the meatloaf and pig out on it, its a solid meatloaf.<br><br>All the deserts are good, let your girl order from a vast collection of cheesecakes, thats the main reason she loves this place. Get a nice ice cream sundae or some chocolate cake instead. Desert is the main reason to go here so don&#39;t skip it.<br><br>Its a reasonable place for a super trendy tourist friendly joint.

Food is seriously meh. We got the BBQ burger and the chicken but neither were great dishes yet still pretty overpriced. Our server was adorable though hence the three stars. He actually went dadalada when serving our cheesecake and it was the sweetest thing. The cheesecake unlike the actual meal was great. We had the strawberry cheesecake and the juiciness of the strawberry and the creaminess of the cake balance out perfectly. If you ever come by the Cheesecake Factory, opt for the cake not the food.

Where do I start?<br><br>The food here is great. But the servings are HUGE. Even the allegedly &#34;Skinny&#34; menu servings are large. All the food - cheesecake and otherwise - is quite good.<br><br>It&#39;s the decor that throws me a little. It&#39;s perfect in a way. Warm lighting, soft calm colored walls reminiscent of a cozy little Italian restaurant, and clean. Super clean.<br><br>So why 3 stars? <br><br>It&#39;s too perfect. Although it tries to be warm and cozy, it fails to achieve such a feeling. The mix of the super-cleanliness and the high ceilings (All of which are nice), it still gives off a feeling of trying too hard. And it&#39;s this feeling that takes away from what otherwise could be a very pleasant atmosphere. <br><br>If the feeling and looks of a place don&#39;t affect you much, and all you really care about is food, then I&#39;d recommend it. If you&#39;re looking for a place to stay for an extended period of time and eat and talk with friends/famliy, then I suggest doing some more research.

First visit to a Cheesecake Factory after years of wanting to try eating at one.<br><br>Food was good, portions are far too big (I don&#39;t think I&#39;ve ever said that), I don&#39;t really get the doggy bag culture of this place, I&#39;d rather pay for an average portion and be able to manage it. I could have eaten the dessert for a main meal! Maybe it&#39;s a UK thing, I don&#39;t know!!<br><br>Main meal was good, service was ok, dessert was really good, coffee was luke warm, prices are reasonable.<br><br>My main memory of this place though is of it being freezing cold. Turn off the air con or turn on the heating please! It&#39;s this more than anything that would put me off returning!<br><br>If you do intend to go I&#39;d try and book ahead if you can, it was busy every night and we waited about 40 minutes for a table.
wonder how the chain formed...<br>got the salted caramel and it was no more than just okay<br>probably not returning<br>pricey ($8+for one piece)

After coming here several times and trying their food (pasta, appetizer, salad), I&#39;ve never been impressed. Perhaps I&#39;ve just ordered the wrong thing on the menu because many of my friends come here for the food... <br><br>But I&#39;m so glad I ordered dessert because I would go back for the cheese cake and nothing else. Don&#39;t bother trying the fancy Oreo or Red Velvet or Caramel or any of those cheese cakes. Just go with the plain Original Cheese Cake -- you will not regret it. It&#39;s simple, sweet, creamy and crusty perfection.

Well we slept in till 10 so there weren&#39;t too many places open around us. Well there might have been but its the first time I was in Boston so I&#39;m glad it was here.<br><br>The food is decent and it came out quick, I had the mushroom burger which was decent at best. The salads have a enormous portion for the price. All in all chain restaurants all uphold to a certain standard they won&#39;t disappoint you but neither will they amaze you

Words cannot describe what hell this place is. Dante has not been able to describe it. We waited over an hour which was not ideal but expected. However the hosts buzzed us to leave our comfy spot at the bar to then line up in the entrance for 20 minutes to wait AGAIN. I imagine this is based on the McDonald&#39;s wait time. So that they can say people only wait a mere 60 min before sitting. The children at the hostess stand were not helpful or courteous. So thanks for the absolute worst experience I&#39;ve ever had eating anywhere.
It&#39;s the chain, quality is as expected, but this location is in a beautiful setting. Plus, great cheesecake-tiramisu is wonderful.

famous for more than cheesecake,<br>this popular chain restaurant is a<br>family favorite in any major cities.<br><br>Food:  their extremely large menu<br> can be overwhelming at first.<br>I recommend going with friends and sharing their large plates.<br>FAVE DISH:  Lettuce Wraps appetizer...make your own wraps.<br><br>The deal: the Cheesecake Factory had many dishes <br>make the top 10 list for most fat and calories...oops!

Let&#39;s be honest, this is a chain restaurant.  I&#39;m not expecting it to be the greatest meal on Earth, and they don&#39;t even come close.  They do turn out consistent food, and it&#39;s not always consistently good.  The staff generally isn&#39;t going to bend over backwards or rush for you.<br><br>Way back when, I used to work in one of these for a couple of months.  The menu is somehow more daunting as a diner than it is as a cook, and that&#39;s saying something.  I mean... look at this thing, who designed this menu?  It&#39;s like someone actually sat there and asked &#34;well, what about the people who don&#39;t like that&#34; to every culinary concept that came up and finally the pastry chef just said &#34;FUCK IT.  Let them have Italian, Chinese, French, American, AND Mexican food, I&#39;m making fucking Cheesecake, bitches!&#34;  I mean, I don&#39;t know if that&#39;s exactly how it went down, but the only other thing I can think of is that someone ate a bunch of recipes and then barfed them all back onto a menu.<br><br>Anyway, the cheesecake they make is generally good for what it is, and the rest of the menu is a cluttered mishmash of various ethnic cuisines and standard American fare.  Do NOT take an indecisive eater here or you will be waiting for fucking ever for them to make up their minds, and who can blame them... the menu is like 300 pages.

The staff here was so friendly that it totally made the experience for me.<br><br>Friends and I came in here late at night to have a couple drinks before heading back to our respective hotels. I was amazed at how friendly the staff still was when their shifts were so close to over and they were probably getting anxious to get out of there!<br><br>A couple friends also ordered cheesecakes. I was in awe with how large each slice was and they were so fancy looking.

Completely terrible staff.<br><br>We requested a booth and we had to wait with everyone else. Then when we were placed in a tiny &#34;booth&#34;, we requested it to be changed. The hostess put us in the bottom of the list and we ended up waiting again. I requested to speak with the manager who couldn&#39;t care less about our predicament. <br><br>We left and went to Capital Grille which was awesome.

I feel like The Cheesecake Factory is the place you go either when you&#39;re craving some really fantastic cheesecake or you can&#39;t think of anywhere else to eat. The food is pretty good, so it&#39;s a safe bet. <br><br>I think a year ago, it was reported that David Beckham was seen here when he was in town. WTH. I should frequent Cheescake Factory&#39;s more often. If it&#39;s good enough for David &#34;Emporio Armani underwear model extraordinaire&#34; Beckham, I think it&#39;s good enough for me. <br><br>Especially if Beckham decides to hang out at the Cheesecake Factory in his Armani skivvies. I, for one, wouldn&#39;t mind.

Look, it is Cheesecake Factory. Not somewhere I would go to, but my mother-in-law likes it, so I guess I needed to go to keep the peace.<br>Staff is nice, but lines are always long, food comes bit slow, and even &#34;lite&#34; selections are not that low-cal.
Ordered the chicken salad and chicken chili. Both were very tasty. We went at a busy time but the service was still great.
Had dinner with friends here last night - had to wait 45 minutes to get a table but had a pleasant evening and our server made all the difference - 5 star minus 1 for the long wait

Rude front people who are anything but helpful. You guys gotta train or cut loose these idiots before you really alienate your clientele. Taking my money elsewhere despite being a fan of Cheesecake Factory.

My wife and I have been to a good number of  Cheesecake Factory locations throughout different parts of the US because the food is consistently good and we know what we will get.  This location was no different.  However the waitress Fransheska was probably the least attentive one we&#39;ve ever had in any C.F.  first she was hardly ever available the entire time we were there.  Only took orders and delivered our drinks one time.  She got the order wrong.  Never checked back once, not even once.  No refilling empty water glasses.  Not asking if we wanted more bread.  Never checked to see if the food was fine.  We had to ask her coworker who was able to correct the error in one minute because we could not see or find her.  Entree took about 40 min to show.  Maybe kitchen issues but never once updated us.  We just sat there with empty bread basket and empty water glasses and kept ourselves entertained thankfully to smartphones.  <br>Never once had a unprofessional waitress in any C.F. and this was first

Great food and service! I ordered the angel hair with shrimp and it was delicious. There is always a long line at the cheese cake factory but they did their best to have everyone seated as fast as possible. I would definitely go back. :)
First time going to The Cheese Cake Factory was not disappointed.  Went after lunch crowd so wait wasn&#39;t long at all. Looking forward to going back again soon.
The food was to say the very least, wonderful. Go here and make sure you try their Hershey&#39;s Chocolate Bar Cheesecake. It was spectacular.

I&#39;ll keep this review simple.<br><br>Huge portions (One dinner dish can serve 2-4 people).<br><br>A tad pricey.<br><br>Food can be poor or fantastic, it greatly depends on what you order.<br><br>Desert is great.<br><br>I like to go to the cheesecake factory when I have a group of 5 or more friends due to the huge portions.

Basic, boring, good. Cheesecake isn&#39;t my favorite place (it&#39;s a chain, crowded, etc) but it&#39;s good for those large crowds of hard to please people. If we have to go to out to dinner for a friends birthday, this place is great to find something everyone likes. <br>The food isn&#39;t that healthy or superb but most things are filling and relatively good. However, their cheesecake is amazing filled with tons of crazy fattening options (yummy chocolate peanut butter cookie dough anyone?). <br>It&#39;s not that crowded on weeknights, during snow storms, or during the day. Any week night or lunch time will be so crowded with tourists.

I do like cheesecake factory most of the time but not this place particularly...<br>It is always so damn crowded!!  One reason is because everything close so early in Boston and this place is one of the few places open late.  Expect to wait over an hour when it is busy.   My friends and I had to come here two nights in a row because we are not from the area and it is so hard to find a place to eat late at night.  <br>  <br>I found the food here was not as good as other cheesecake factory locations.  I ordered Jambalaya pasta and it was not tasty at all.  However my friends seemed to enjoy their food so maybe it was just my dish.  They had Miso salmon and Hibachi steak and Spicy Chicken pasta.  <br><br>If I knew the area better, I probably would not have gone to this place 3 times.

I&#39;m not much of a chain restaurant fan, but I liked coming here to sit at the bar...you  don&#39;t have to wait an hour and a half, and the servers are entertaining<br><br>I had a piece of tiramasu cheesecake and a cappucino = bliss<br><br>Come here for dessert and cocktails, skip the wait and titanic-sized dinners

The Cheesecake Factory is, well, the Cheesecake Factory - decent, overpriced food served in a perpetually noisy atmosphere.  <br><br>My classmate&#39;s birthday gathering last week, however, was fun times =D  Our server did a good job throughout the night and was pleasant to talk to with regards to drink recommendations, etc.  On that note, the Beringer Merlot and Matua Sauvignon Blanc offered here were both quite good =D  I had the Ahi Tuna Tartare and would recommend that if you wanna spend a bit less - reasonably portioned (unlike everything else here lol) and priced.<br><br>To wrap things up, it&#39;s a solid spot for larger parties, but it&#39;d much appreciated if CF would actually take reservations.

I&#39;m not a fan of cheesecake but The Cheesecake Factory just so happens to have a sandwich I love.<br><br>Everyone should try the spicy crispy chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries - total life changing meal.<br><br>Anyway, like coming here to grab lunch at the bar. The service is always fast and attentive and it&#39;s never crowded around lunchtime.
Wooooow, finally got to this place! So moist and great cheesecake!

Food is ok, not worth the price by any means.<br><br>Asked for goat cheese instead of blue cheese on a salad and was charged $6 extra. It would have been better if they had just stolen my wallet, at least that would have made a better story.
Service sucks. All I wanted was a cafe mocha and somehow it took the employee 15min to make it. Doesn&#39;t take that long to make...

Alex the manager says &#34;we can steal your things if we want&#34;<br><br>I enjoy the Cheesecake Factory but the manager here, ALEX, is shady. I accidentally left a birthday card at the table and while the table was being cleared off, the card was stolen. I confronted the staff and they went and got my card but stole the gift card that was inside the envelope. Alex, the manager here, says &#34;oh well, tough luck pal. We aren&#39;t legally responsible for your things.&#34; So I&#39;ll leave it up to you whether you want to support a restaurant that condones stealing your belongings. I&#39;ll go to the Cheesecake Factory, but avoid this location.

BANG BANG!    ....chicken and shrimp!   So good!<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is somewhat over rated to me.  Although their food quality is good, their menu endless, and location superb, the price stops me dead in my tracks from coming back here [I only come back on special occasions].  <br><br>All of the wait staff that I have encountered have been friendly and seem very knowledgable about their menu, which is a plus.  Bread and butter is always given at the biginning of the meal, which is delicious.   I always order the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp, which consists of white jasmine rice with shrimp and chicken coconut curry -- it is amazing!  The portion is decent -- I ALWAYS doggy bag about half to leave room for Cheesecake.<br><br>If I could give 5 stars to solely the Cheesecake component of the restaurant, I would.  They have a variety of different flavor combinations all ranging from about $6-7.  Sooo good!  Theyre extremely rich, however, and one slice is good enough to share amongst 2-3 people.<br><br>For approximately $20 per visit, I do get full, but am 110% positive that I can find good food much similar to this elsewhere for a cheaper price.  Overall do I recommend this place? <br><br>If you&#39;re feeling classy and want to indulge after a long day of shopping on Newbury Street, I&#39;m sure coming here will be suitable;  Pinky&#39;s Up to you.
Love the Asian lettuce wraps and fried zucchini. Service great at the bar. Get the skinnylicious sangria.
The food was good but the waiter was horrible.  He would disappear, forget my order come back and ask me again and he just didn&#39;t care that it was my gfs birthday... :(
Service and food was great!I recommend this place especially if you want a relaxing environment.

Cheesecake factory almost always serves consistent buttery and delicious food! <br><br>On the other random note: On the day that I visited, the young hostess probably for sh*ts and giggles, started placing all the minorities in one section and all the white people in one section.<br><br>Immaturity?  <br><br>Definitely ruined the ambiance.

Pretty good experience. Great menu selection. I was craving for eggs at 6pm (I know it&#39;s a little strange), but they had omelette on the menu all day. They have everything: seafood, pasta, burgers, meat, vegetarian, skinny menu....and yum yum cheesecakes :)<br><br>Service is pretty good. Space itself is big, lots of sitting area. I liked the atmosphere. Parking a bit of an issue, you might need to park in a garage or walk for 5 min.<br><br>I would defenitely go back!

Me and my friend came here right after the movies for drinks and an app. We honestly could&#39;ve sat at the bar but I&#39;m so happy we didn&#39;t. Our server Richie was phenomenal. We arrived at cheesecake around 11pm and he was so friendly and happy i just fed off his energy. I work in the service industry and I get so annoyed when people come in so close to closing Especially after a long shift. I say this to mention Richie had such a great mood despite it being so close to closing. He was very insightful when I inquired about which peach drink I should go for. The only bad thing was We didn&#39;t get our bread but we literally only ordered a app and two drinks so I&#39;m not tripping (Olive Garden bread is better anyway lol) oh and the food was great. I work right by and used to work in the prudential so I&#39;ve tried a lot of things on the menu but my favorite is the peach drink with the vodka. I Can&#39;t remember its exact name  if it&#39;s Georgia peach or peach fuzz. But it&#39;s a nice blended drink. And the avocado egg rolls were bomb

If you have friends or relatives visiting the area, this is a great place to take them for great dessert and cool ambiance.<br><br>This is NOT a good place to go if you are counting calories or if you want attentive service.<br><br>The location--right there in the Copley Mall area--is fantastic for tourists and visitors. The orange and green lines have subway stops right there. The interior design is dim with a great view outside, if you get a window seat. The booths are hard and uncomfortable but beautiful to look at. There are intriguing Eye-of-Sauron tribal lights on the sides of the booths... needless to say while waiting (and waiting...) for your food, your eyes will have plenty of decorations to look at. It was my birthday and while they did come out and sing to me and have a cute candle in the cheesecake, I would like to have ordered another drink or had a refill, but the waiter was never around. I realize it&#39;s a busy place, but they could have made so much more money if they had been attentive! We wanted more of that delicious bread and more cocktails, but the staff was always elsewhere.<br><br>So hunt down your server and ask for more bread! It is fantabulous! The food itself was great once we finally got it! I LOVE that they have an entire diet menu, even if it has a silly name &#34;Skinnylicious.&#34; The gripe I have with this is the entire menu says &#34;590 calories or less.&#34; If you are health conscious enough to order off the diet menu, why don&#39;t they give exact calorie counts??? Not all meals have exactly 590 calories. Budgeting what I eat--what if one salad has 300 and the burger has all 590???? I wish they were more specific. Every single slice of cheesecake will be orgasmically good, just don&#39;t even bother calorie counting there. The lowest calorie slice is the Splenda with strawberries cheesecake with a hefty 610. (On my 1000 cal/day diet, this is quite a doozy.) Some of them have over 2,000 calories IN A SINGLE SLICE. Heart stoppingly good.<br><br>tl;dr version:<br>good food, bad service, high calories, good when you have birthdays or friends visiting Boston

Went here Saturday evening for dessert with a group of friends. Expected the usual great experience that we usually have at the Cheesecake Factory in other locations. Unfortunately, service was terrible. Waited 15 minutes at the table for a server. Had to go up to the maitre d to ask for someone to help. In stead of apologizing, she was rather rude and condescending. Eventually a server turned up. The red velvet cheesecake tasted funky, no quality control at this location. The restaurant is also infested with mosquitoes! <br>I&#39;ve always been a fan of the Cheesecake Factory, but my experience at this location will give me pause while deciding to dine at any of their restaurants.
Brunch here is also very good! Portions are super huge, and adequately priced!!

Came here 2 times on vacation to the Back Bay area. First time entire order of food came cold and poorly made. Second time, only eating here out of necessity, food also came cold. This time sent it back to be made incorrectly, and cold again. Water served without ice, slow service, and perhaps the worst dining experience I or my family has ever had. Do not recommend!!

Amazing!! Giant slices of the tastiest cheesecake you can dream of. And literally more than a dozen variations on the theme. From adding hot fudge, to adding Oreo cream, or coconuts, and on, and on... The place itself is quite exquisite too. A nice experience.
Terrible waitstaff with poor attitude...not a welcoming location at all!  I will never visit this location again.
Sat in the bar area, kind of a busy Sunday between Christmas and New year. All I can say is Vinny knows his stuff . Great experience from start to end. Thanks Vinny we will be back

Serving wasn&#39;t impressive since we had to wait until our server came. Other servers never cared us and told us wait. We two went there around 7pm and ordered one dish for each and could get out of there just before 9pm. One of worst experiences in CF.

The menu says draft Guinness, what you get is a bottle.
