If you don&#39;t know the difference, you deserve what you got.<br><br>Caveat emptor!<br><br>The food is reminiscent of airline cuisine in First Class when the airlines tried hard to serve a good meal.  Amazingly good for something prepared 8 hours earlier, packaged, hauled and reheated, but not something you&#39;d voluntarily elect to have over real food.<br><br>The strawberry shortcake, though, is quite large and quite good.
Disappointed. Pasta was clotted and the salt was uneven. The cheesecake was just ok. Ice cream came with a big chunk of cream on top.
Love this place! Great food and friendly staff. Beautiful to sit outside on a sunny day

My review is based on my experience during Sunday brunch hours at this Cheesecake Factory location. Waitress was pleasant and service was prompt. The complimentary bread before the meal was delicious as usual, but the wheat toast that came with my omelette was dry and did not have a lick of butter on it. My boyfriend&#39;s pancakes were dry and came with maple syrup that was the consistency of milk and the color of a man&#39;s ejaculation. We paid $40 for dry toast and a mediocre omelette dry pancakes and an egg, and 2 drinks. Never again will we come to Cheesecake Factory for brunch or pay such a ridiculous amount of money for shitty breakfast food.

We had Bistro Shrimp Pasta and Chicken Pasta at Cheesecake Factory last night. Both of them were pretty good. The waiters were nice and funny, even though they got lot of customers and were supper busy. I believe that I will come back to the restaurant to enjoy the food there again.
cheesecake has gotten half the size and almost double the price. wth?  not worth it anymore.  cost $17 for 2 slices of cheesecake.

It&#39;s your standard Cheesecake Factory--huge space, huge portions of expectantly good food, and extravagant generic pseudo-Middle Eastern decor. <br><br>What I like about this place is the location. The Back Bay is a fine-dining mecca, there&#39;s no doubt about it. However, a lot of the venues are small, easily crowded, and quite honestly, feel like a gamble if you&#39;ve never been there before.  Sometimes, you just don&#39;t want to deal with all that, and that&#39;s where good old Cheesecake Factory comes into play. The Cheesecake Factory is conveniently located on the Huntington side of The Shops at the Prudential Center. Around lunch, it&#39;s never busy so it&#39;s perfect for someone trying to escape their workplace breakroom to grab a quick lunch. The restaurant is HUGE, so when you spy a huge family with a crying baby settling in for dinner, you don&#39;t even sweat it--they might as well be miles away, you won&#39;t even be bothered by them. <br><br>My favorite thing to do here is to grab drinks with my co-workers after working late. The service is quick, drinks are strong, and the price is right!

lunch recently, we ate at the bar....everything was very good...drinks were good and less than what seems to be boston&#39;s going rate, the fried squash avocado small plate as an app was very good, salmon was excellent, even i liked it, and the burger was very good.....place is very busy and that must say a lot as it is pretty big and nicely decorated....

As far as chain restaurants go, The Cheesecake Factory is decent.  Their 10-page plus menu is a tad overwhelming though &amp; makes choosing an entree rather difficult.  Once you decide on what to order &amp; receive the food, you&#39;ll likely find that the food is okay -- not terrible but also not great.  <br><br>I recommend avoiding the pasta dishes, as they tend to be a letdown.  The tomato basil pasta, for instance, is usually too salty.  If you are looking for really good pasta dishes, head on over to the North End.<br><br>The two redeeming qualities of The Cheesecake Factory are its cheesecakes &amp; location.  Its cheesecakes (at least the ones I&#39;ve tried) are good, &amp; the restaurant is conveniently located inside the Pru, just steps from the entrance to the Prudential stop on the green line.  Its convenient location, however, can also be a bit of a drawback -- the place gets very crowded Friday &amp; Saturday nights.

So I showed up without a reservation with a party of ten for my birthday at dinner time during spring break (YIKES!). We were told they could only split us up in two five tops and they would try to seat us near each other. I ran into a manager named Kat. I mentioned to her we were there for my birthday and she said she would try to get us seated sooner and get us a table all together. She was so nice and reasonable, despite the restaurant being so hectic! Our wait was not very long, she personally saw us to the two tables 6/4 and after seeing 10 of us try squeeze into a six top booth, our waitress who&#39;s name I have regrettably forgotten asked us if we wanted to move to a much larger open table in a section of the restaurant that had previously been closed. We were so pleased! She was wonderful, and they were timely with the food. Cheesecake Factory is a good go to for me when I want to indulge and between the cheesecake and the strong long island iced tea and the special accommodation for our party size, we had a GREAT time!
We tried 5 different cheesecake and all was great. My favorite is Godiva.

Okay so I first experienced the Cheesecake Factory last week. I believe it was a Tuesday evening. About 50 degrees, unusually warm and dry for mid December in Boston. I just gotta get this off my chest-when I hear the words &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34; I imagine a giant warehouse with conveyor belts spitting out cheesecakes. But oh was I in for a surprise! The Cheesecake Factory is not a FACTORY per se, rather a nice dimly lit Arabic-esque restaurant. Let&#39;s start with the bread-the brown bread is fantastic. For my entree I got the buffalo blisters, four cheese pasta with shrimp, and a loaded factory burrito. Are all of it in 7.5 minutes. It was so good that I ordered round two of all the entrees. Went to the bathroom, pulled the trigger and threw up course number one to make room for course number two, three, and four. Then I was ready to roll into flavor town. Round 2 was even better than the first! I ended up sleeping there and getting breakfast and cheesecake in the morning. Would recommend the cheesecake not-factory to all!!!

I&#39;ve had several good experiences at this location in small groups, but had a one of the worst longest dining experiences I&#39;ve ever had while with a large group of 10.  I think the waiter was new and overwhelmed... it was an early Saturday night around 4:30 when we arrived.  After we got our drinks order placed, the waiter came back with only the water for half the party and said he&#39;d return to take our food order.  We asked for some bread.  Ten minutes later, half of us didn&#39;t still didn&#39;t even have water.  He took the order and ten minutes later we got the rest of the water.  We had to get up and ask another waitress for bread.  Then another waitress had to relieve him so we could get the rest of our other drinks and appetizers.  Much later a few people got their salad while others continued to wait longer and longer.  A third waitress came and helped get everyone else their food and finally was consistently very attentive.  Perhaps certain waitstaff should be evaluated for their capacity and limited on how many people and tables they can wait on.
My friends took me here, I loved here, just fantastic!!!! I like Hibachi steak from here!

Dear Cheesecake,<br><br>you are a mix of hit or misses. I always sit at the bar and am recognized as a regular. You are always my back up in case I walk out of some dirty Chinese restaurant. You are close, sometimes full but your food is never disappointing. <br>Now...service is a different thing. I have been to cheesecake more than 25 times and sat in a table 2 times (both disappointing) when I sit down to eat I would like to not be rushed and processed like a machine. The bar...once I walked up to the bar to overhear the bartenders gossiping about customers and my SO overheard them talking about us specifically (talk about being a regular!) don&#39;t complain if the tip we gave you wasn&#39;t good enough...maybe you should stop flirting with that guy and actually fill up my glass, bring the ketchup that I&#39;ve been waiting on for a half hour already and take my dessert order (it&#39;s very few times I am able to fit dessert into my stomach from the large plates I order!) and please check your soda fountain I hate getting flat soda and taking that disgusting first sip that lets me know that you&#39;re out<br>The lunch menus are great! $5 for sliders, avocado eggrolls (which totally rock btw)...so many options, but such a small stomach...(I guess that&#39;s why I keep coming)<br><br>Red Velvet cheesecake is where it is (the awesome taste that is!) The pumpernickel bread is so delicious, sometimes I get full on only that and have to pack 3/4 of my actual meal! <br><br>Final thoughts, I will keep coming here because it has hearty meals, cheap lunch menus and awesome cheesecake! This is not fine dining people, please visit top of the hub for that! This place is for gatherings, cheap lunches, to go orders or just unwinding from the day.
Poor service! Party of 5 all meals came out at different times. Waiter was never available and poor management. Not the service you get at other Cheesecake Facotry

There is always such a long wait here at the Copley Cheesecake Factory. The food was okay and the menu was overwhelming. The cheesecake...well...let&#39;s just say I am glad I don&#39;t live in walking distance. :)

Visited your location last night with my boyfriend, first time ever going to the cheesecake factory and I was beyond impressed. I&#39;m very familiar with the restaurant scene I&#39;ve been server for about 7 years now.  Your location and staff blew my mind.  The atmosphere was amazing and really unique.  Our server Meagan o was really great and knowledgeable about your menu.  Her hurband tim even helped with opening our champagne it was difficult lol but they made it fun. Lots of fun and we really had an awesome experience and the food was amazing. Leftover cheesecake was my breakfast today so to say the least it was amazing.  Thanks so much for everything and your hard work as a company.  Please let Meagan know how great she was thanks :)
I always find the atmosphere at cheesecake refreshing. I love the lighting and suttle theme of the restaurant. My favorite dish is the shrimp jambalaya. It&#39;s a must try!!!

Worst service ever!!!! I will give them no star if there is one. I took my nephew here for lunch. We got a table within minute but no waiter come and get our order. We waited for 45 minutes with a bunch of waiters walked pass our table. They just looked at us and walked away without asking us if we need anything? We then got up and walked out the door. Along the way out I talked to the girl at the front door who handle the seating and told her what happen. She just rolled her eyes and did not say anything. Worst place ever and so unprofessional!!! I will not go here ever again!!

Fat G. counting the hours till the end of this workweek.<br><br>And so, we come to a review of a place that most people have seen before, not necessarily been to. The Cheesecake Factory is located in the Copley Mall, near Barnes and Nobles.<br><br>Come inside, and there&#39;s a waiting area as well as a place to order desserts for take-out. There are a lot of tables, a small bar, and seating in the back, which has windows allowing you to see out into the street.<br><br>Ambiance is tough to describe - it&#39;s not candlelight, but it&#39;s dim.<br><br>A friend of mine said that when he hears Cheesecake Factory, he thinks pasta. Aside from cheesecake, I&#39;m not really sure what to get this time. Having remembered being here before for a party, I opted to order a pizza instead of getting one of their pasta dishes (it comes on one of those big plates, but only 1/2 of it is actually food.)<br><br>They have a wine menu, and a good variety on the menu, ranging from sandwiches, pastas, soups, salads, desserts, pizzas, seafood, etc. <br><br>The Everything Pizza had its fair share of cheese, pepperoni, mushrooms, sausage and onions. Though I was a bit disappointed, because the slices felt firm on the top half, but kinda wet and soft on the bottom half. Think a trapezoid of decent pizza, and a small triangle of sadness.<br><br>The pizza was about $13, which i guess is ok.<br><br>The waiter looked sad when everyone ordered water, and didn&#39;t want dessert...<br><br>It&#39;s an alright place, but not a place I&#39;d frequent regularly. You really come here for the  romantic atmosphere and the cheesecake, but that&#39;s really it.

The food was really good and tasty. Tex Mex rolls were great as starters. For main course, baja chicken tacos and Bang-bang chicken &amp; shrimp were tasty and in good portions. The only bad thing was the wrong billing (maybe it was the waiter&#39;s fault!) . They added an additional item on to our bill, we were just 2 of us, so they should not have ideally messed up our billing. We were in hurry and didnt notice, only realized the additional amount that was billed later after reaching home. My advice, the place is busy, so make sure u get billed for what you eat.
Sat and waited for 10 minutes for a someone to approach the table. No one ever came and so I left. Told the hostess. Could have cared less. Avoid this restaurant at all costs.

Service was on the slow side. But they were busy. Nice location. Decent food. Delicious cheesecake. I will definitely come back. And p.s. the SkinnyLicious Ceasar Salad was more than I could eat. Good to eat something calorically reasonable and have more than I could want.<br><br>Oh and bring a jacket. They have AC and they like to use it to the max.
The cheesecakes in here are great; Specially the fresh strawberry cheesecake. The place is classy and beautiful and the customer service is great.

Waited for 2 omelets for 1 hour. Really? Spoke with 3 people who were very apologetic but still waiting for our breakfast. Absolutely rediculous!! Didn&#39;t even want to give 1 star but Yelp made me:(

Chilling at the bar with my girl Maureen having the best Spicy Margarita ever! My girl Abbot behind the bar is the BEST!! Offering great service, menu selections! She rocks!! Cheesecake Factory in Boston upping its game on food and service - luv it!

I do not recommend this location. My friends and I went out to celebrate a birthday-a group of five. It was a Friday night, so we understood that it was busy, and were fine with waiting the quoted 40 minutes. Except, it took over an hour to get seated, and when we finally did it took a good 10 minutes for our waitress to check in with us! We stated that we were on a time crunch as we needed to catch a train later that night, so we ordered our drinks and meals at the same time. We requested bread for the table, and that took nearly 20 minutes as well. Finally, when our meals came out only 4/5 of us received our food. Our other friend had to wait 20 minutes for her dish, and at that point the rest of us were almost finished! The manager did come over to speak with us, but seemed disingenuous and offered no compensation. The service was so slow that we ran out of time to eat our dessert at the restaurant, and being a birthday that we were celebrating it was disappointing to have to get our cheesecake to go. The food was okay. I ordered a cheeseburger medium, but it was bright pink and definitely more rare than anything. I didn&#39;t have the patience to send it back as everything was taking such a long time. None of my friends were impressed with their meals, a few dishes were not even very warm. Overall, this was a poor experience. My friends and I made the most of it, but we are still very upset with the service and the way management handled the situation.

I love the Cheesecake Factory. I have a personal project to dine in one in every city I visit, if there is a Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>What I didn&#39;t know was that you can order brunch on Sundays! That was a nice surprise because I love breakfast food, plus it&#39;s much cheaper than the entree selections. I ordered the Belgian Waffle, which was HUGE. I was shocked by the portion, and it was so big that I was only ate half of it. <br><br>For dessert, I ordered Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Fudge Ripple. Man oh man, that was rich! Lots of peanut butter, caramel, and crushed candy to give it a nice crunch. <br><br>Service was great. My waiter was attentive, but also gave me some space to enjoy my dining experience.

The portion sizes in our to go order were quite small as compared to other locations in the area (my husband knew I went to this location as soon as he opened the first container). When I called to complain, I was told to either bring the food back or take a picture and bring it in. When I explained that we live 30 mins away and they closed in 10 mins, she apologized and said they either need the food back or a photo in order to reimburse the purchase. I have never been nickel and dimed by a restaurant, particularly a chain reataurant, in this way. They should be ashamed. I recommend going elsewhere for your food, unless you enjoy paying high prices for less food.

As much as I want to dislike CKF, I can&#39;t - they churn out all cuisines of good quality food in short time frames, the wine is solid, and the portions are always huge.<br><br>The service is generally quick but the servers are usually frantically running about, due to the past pace and turnover of tables.  My meal was the blackened shrimp, I recommend it - fried plantains, mango salsa, brown rice, spicy blackened skrimpsss :)<br><br>Don&#39;t expect fine dining, expect a solid meal and you will be happy... oh and the cheesecake is epic. duh.

Food is good. Probably their food worths 4-star. <br>I have eaten here several times over past couple of years, and dishes have been at least OK. <br>Orange Chicken was not really impressive. I&#39;m a huge fan of Orange Chicken (ordering it at Cheesecake Factory already proves it!) and it was below average orange chicken among the ones I&#39;d tasted, yet was also the most expensive one.<br>However, white cream pasta (forgot exact name), BBQ burger were good. <br>And Jamaican Shrimp and Chicken (with Curry sauce) was fantastic! I&#39;d recommend this dish to anyone. <br><br>However, their service and place maintenance is awful. Perhaps these non-food materials take 1-2 stars off of them. I see some Yelpers giving 1 stars due to their service, and I totally understand them. Floor is so slippery, I felt like somebody spilled oil on the floor or something. Hostesses always underestimate the waiting time. When they say it would be 10 minutes waiting, they call me like 25 minutes later. When they call 20 minutes, I get called after 30+ minutes. Some may have no problem with that business strategy, but I am always irritated by it. When they say 10 minutes, I expect to be seated at least within 15 minutes, not 25+. <br><br>I wouldn&#39;t say much about waiters. I remember when I visited here with 3 of my college friends, the waiter was really annoying. He was slow, didn&#39;t come to take order for like 20 minutes, and didn&#39;t refill water. Though, in my recent visit, waitress was so kind, asked for order frequently (yeah we asked for extra minutes to decide what to get like 3 times), and even after placing an order, she came back to us and told us that our dishes are being prepared and would come out in several minutes. <br>So I guess it just depends on who you get as your server.<br><br>Overall, my experiences here has been okay. I know I will get good food when I go there, it&#39;s all about other factors (price, waiting time, service, maintenance, etc) that changes the dining experience for the night.

I m in luck! It has been 2 years since my last time here. If my friend did not give me its gift card, I would never come back. So today I decided to give it 2nd chance by going to its store in difference location, and here is what happened again: a tiny wood stick was found in my artichoke dip. After a closer look, I found out it is the tip part of a toothpick! which reminds me what happened on 2013 Mother&#39;s day: <br>Huge disappointment, ruined my Mother&#39;s day: I am so regret to take my mom there for lunch on Mother&#39;s day!<br>First of all, it took us more than 30 minutes wait for our food served. There were not even many people at that time. Both sides of our neighbors&#39; food were ready and they came later than us , we still sat there waiting. All I ordered was burger and my mom had wasabi tuna. It should not take that long. But fine, it&#39;s Mother&#39;s day. It&#39;s not like me and my mom were in a hurry anyway. We wanted to take our time, enjoy the beautiful day. It was not easy to spend some quality time together, and to celebrate the day, when she lives in another continent across the ocean.<br>However, as our lunch towards end, here came the WORST part: I noticed there was a fruit TAG in my mom&#39;s plate, mingled with rice! The manager came to explain: they used orange peels for the dish. The tag may fall into the plate accidentally when peeling the orange skin.They could take away the rest of my mom&#39;s food, and gave us a piece of free cheese cake as apology.<br><br>Here I think is the funny part:<br>1. I don&#39;t want to know why/how the fruit tag get into the dish.<br>2. Sure, they could add orange peel but it doesn&#39;t mean it&#39;s OK to get into the plate.<br>3.  All they offered is just taking the plate away, and offering a piece of cake to fix the problem. We paid for the meal, and did not even finished it. My mom meant to box the rest before I found the tag.<br><br>So in the end, they gave us a newly cooked, equal portion of the left meal, and a piece of cake. My mom is ok with it. But I am totally upset by what happened. That my mom kept telling me she&#39;s fine, and still had good time with me made me fell even worse. Very unpleasant experience! I am still upset even by now.

I had a great experience, Scott I think is the manager, is by far the best manager I have ever encountered working for a restaurant. He was very informative about the city we visited in our trip. I highly recommend this place to eat. Very dedicated staff.

When my co-worker turned to me last week and said...<br><br>&#34;Before you leave I want to treat you to a meal of your choice in return for the wonderful change in my life you brought when you yelped Coast Cafe&#34;<br><br>What did I say? No... not Hungry Mother like he expected (and wanted).<br><br>&#34;Cheesecake Factory, please!&#34;    (coffee spits out of his mouth onto floor)<br><br>Wha wha wha wha? why? I wanted to try, that&#39;s why. As a curious yelper and known enthusiast for social anthropology I wanted to see what made this place tick. Why thousands of people line-up and hang around for hours everyday all over this country just to get a seat at these gigantic restaurants that form a chain of megabucks that even has a NASDAQ symbol: CAKE. Why do you strange Americans come here?<br><br>===== ====== ===== ===== ===== ===== ===== ===== =====<br><br>2 hours, 35 dollars and about 10,000 calories later and I need a man with a wheelbarrow to come take me home. 4 hours on from that and I can&#39;t sleep from fatness. I&#39;m worried to go to the bathroom in case I do an Elvis and die. In fact if The Cheescake Factory was around in the 1970s I&#39;m sure Elvis would&#39;ve died a lot quicker.<br><br>MY FINDINGS: Americans like going to places that are already popular, they like big portions for their money and they like choice. Lots of it.<br><br>MY VERDICT:  A sad long menu filled with the most mediocre, middle-of-the-road dishes from cuisines around the world. All committee-picked to be the least adventurous and inoffensive. Every dish is played safe, ridiculously big and possibly the cheapest and most efficient way to get calories aside from blending up lard and shotgunning it through a funnel.

Ugh, why do I feel the way I did when I wrote my Kohl&#39;s review ( <a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz/kohls-department-store-north-andover#hrid:Tf3ErT1_4qnqlcH9jgRXmw">yelp.com/biz/kohls-depar…</a> )? Ya know, shame, remorse, cultural conformity. *Pops collar, slips on crocs, reads bible*<br><br>But what can I say? The food here is delicious. I don&#39;t know what they&#39;re doing in the kitchen (I imagine some sort of leprechaun is mixing potions and sacrificing lambs) but it seems like every item on the menu just makes me drool.<br><br>The portions are gigantic so be prepared for that. My friend and I split a &#34;small&#34; salad from their appetizer menu and  neither of us could finish the plate. Together, we still only managed to eat about half (and by half I mean I shoveled the dressing, bacon, tomatoes, and bleu cheese crumbles into my pie hole and ignored the heads of lettuce that were cluttering up space for fatness).<br><br>For dinner I ordered the chicken salad sandwich. It came with a salad, but since I had just attempted to eat a salad to start, I chose to replace my side with french fries (twist my arm). The sandwich was behemoth and oh so delicious. The fries were a bit too salty for my liking, but it&#39;s not like there was much room left in my stomach to eat them anyway.<br><br>The helpful and attentive waiter wrapped up my unfinished sandwich and I was ready to pass out. Or vomit. Either or. But of course, the dessert menu came and we ordered a white chocolate and raspberry cheesecake to split (twists other arm). The cheesecake arrived with confetti sprinkles, mounds of whip cream, a birthday candle, and a herd of Cheesecake Factory waiters. SHIT. It&#39;s the night before my birthday. SHIT.<br><br>I hate the birthday song. It makes me cringe, turn red, and want to crawl under a table and die. My friends know this. Do they care? No. So here it is, me, a cheesecake, and the herd. The song begins. I want to cry. But I see the dessert in the hands of my waiter Scott and I think, &#34;It will all be over soon.&#34; *Singing ends, gathers up the rest of my dignity, spoons cheesecake into mouth....LIFE IS GOOD*<br><br>This was my 2nd time ever to Cheesecake, and once again, I was not disappointed. The food is great, drinks are tasty, service is fantastic, and the high prices reflect that. Be prepared to wait since it&#39;s a popular dining spot, or linger into the bar area and stare some innocent people down until they hurry up and finish so you can grab their table. My only reasoning for 4 stars rather than 5 is their menu. It&#39;s too long and as my friend referred to it, it&#39;s like a magazine. It&#39;s so long they number the pages and there are even advertisements inside. *Orders food and books a trip to Disney World for the wife and kids I don&#39;t have*<br><br>Point. Laugh. Criticize. I don&#39;t care. I went to The Cheesecake Factory and I loved it.<br><br>*sips cool-aid*

I have had this sub-par excuse for food before on a whistle-stop tour to the West Coast. I wasn&#39;t impressed to say the least.<br><br>I did though decide with some coercion to try it again whilst visiting friends in Boston.<br><br>Biggest food mistake i made whilst on the East Coast. What a sorry, miserable and frankly bland experience. From the moment i walked in the door greeted with the dour lighting that seems to be customary in every branch. To the instant i tried the first bite of my generic chicken dish. To the point of settling my tab, frozen in horror at the cost of such mediocrity. The Cheesecake factory is from beginning, middle and end a shoddy excuse for a &#34;restaurant&#34; <br><br>If the fact every dish is laden with more calories that your average fast-food joint wasn&#39;t bad enough. The flavour does not make up for it. It&#39;s called the cheesecake factory for a reason. Everything tastes sweet. <br><br>You will either love or loathe the cheesecake factory franchise.<br><br>If you&#39;re a fan of rich, coma inducing food with portions the size small children then this is the place for you. <br><br>However if you actually have taste-buds and appreciate good food. Whilst at the same time not wanting to burn a whole in your wallet for the sake of calorie smothered food that you could get at any sub-par dingy diner. Then stay clear. A million miles clear.

It&#39;s no wonder Americans are fat. <br><br>There is no reason for the Cheesecake Factory to have such huge portions. The last time I was there, I thought I would be safe ordering a grilled cheese with fries off the children&#39;s menu. Big mistake. Not only was it so greasy that it was borderline see-through, but it was HUGE. I wear instead of giving me just two normal sized slices of bread, they gave me the entire loaf and slapped some cheese on it. And butter. Massive amounts of butter. There is just no need for the portions to be so huge, and it&#39;s not like they are good left overs. The food isn&#39;t even that good when you&#39;re eating it there. <br><br>I&#39;m not a huge fan of any of the cheesecake options. It&#39;s all very rich and takes days to get through. They do have a chocolate cake that I don&#39;t mind spending a couple of days working on, but that&#39;s about it. Everything else is just way too rich, too much, and too expensive. I can understand this place being your favorite if it&#39;s the only place in town, but when you&#39;re in a city there is really no need to go there. At all.

I used to eat here maybe once a month, but haven&#39;t gone in almost a year and don&#39;t plan on going anymore.<br><br>It just isn&#39;t worth the wait.<br><br>I don&#39;t care how good the food is, a chain like this can only achieve a certain level. I can&#39;t believe people will hear &#34;Sure, a table of five will open up in about 1 hour and 45 minutes!&#34; and gladly pick up a pager and sit out in the lobby for nearly two hours just so they can browse an advertisement filled menu that offers food not substantially better than the Applebes down the block.<br><br>Smell ya later, The Cheesecake Factory. Smell ya later forever...

Been there several times. Liked Shrimp Scampi (creamy) and its whole wheat bread (not sure if it&#39;s called this). Also liked Shrimp with Angel Hair and Fried Calamari. The cheesecake was too much for one person, better sharing with a friend.

Reading the other reviews, you would think Cheesecake is really McDonald&#39;s in drag.  Companies like Starbucks and Cheesecake should never apologize for their size.  Their offering is better than the independents.  <br><br>Why would anyone consistently wait a hour  unless it was good<br><br>Truthfully, the place amazes me.  Yesterday I had an egg white omelet.  My girl had a chopped salad.  The people next to me had nachos and tacos.  Next to them was steak and chicken.  <br><br>Perhaps the Cheesecake is the most democratic of all restaurants, because everyone can eat anything...and its always consistent<br><br>Small tip:  Eat at the bar

Aw man, who can go wrong with the Cheescake factory? They have just about everything from American to Italian to Asian to Mexican and more... so chances are you&#39;ll find something you like. It is VERY easy to succumb to weakness here and order the comfort food choices. The mac and cheese balls? DELICIOUS but over a thousand calories. The cheesecake, of course, is also delicious but equally as unhealthy. This is a good place for special occasions for obvious reasons.

I could not forget the first visit to Cheesecake factory in Cambrideside Galleria, Disney like decors - hand-painted yellow resin columns and brassy details and dark wood veneer partitions, with ambiguous shaped mosaic patterns and molding works, a true American pop style that was.<br><br>  They do have some decent meals but when you go to Cheesecake factory, you tend to get ambitious and order funky ones and often get disappointed. The portion is always double the American diner serving size. ;) One appetizer could even fill the hungry sromach enough.<br><br> I would recommend anything from their dinner salads and from breakfast menu, and some en trees are quite healthy and well-prepared, but, whenever I try pastas/noodles, they taste shallow and sugar-sweet most of the time.<br><br>Compared to  Galleria Cambridge Side, Copley Mall branch is a better choice with better foods and  definitely well-trained waiters.<br><br>What I like in this branch is :<br>1. friendly waiting (Beware! Cambridge Branch waiting is totally opposite, very slow and untrained, they never show up to refill your drinks)<br>2. convenient location<br>3. some good menu like Thai Lettuce wraps(appetizer) en trees have good selection of ingredients some of which can pass as a top restaurant dishes.<br>4. Sunday Brunch (till 2pm) is a nice surprise too, yum<br><br>what I don&#39;t like is<br>1. accepting no reservations(waiting can be over 1 hour during some busy weekends)<br>2. not enough waiting/sitting space 60-90 min waiting for a dinner except the opening hours, 10 min waiting around noon time)<br>3. one annoying Asian hostess(I am Asian and I have never seen that cold attitude from any Asian folks-she works during the weekends-2006)<br>***update, she is still working there but she has improved her manners dealing with young and shy customers and I am just happy with their hosts nowadays-2007<br>4. big proportion means doggy bags always or more wasted breads and others, and often shallow flavors with the sauce. You will soon learn what to order to your pleasing taste.<br><br>Will I go there again? absolutely, but I have to be careful of what to choose not to eat too much sugar. <br><br>The people are not too loud and show good demography of different races and levels. The waiting service at Copley Mall has consistently been superb. Always smiling. This is a true family restaurant and I think it is good for big parties as well.  so, casual diners will be pleased with the atmosphere for sure.<br><br>Enjoy  ;)

I&#39;ve eaten here. I walk past it every morning on my way to work. But I refuse to believe that it is anything more than a cynical, cruel joke played on the world. <br><br>This place is not so much a restaurant, as it is a test of will. A test where The Cheesecake Factory promises to throw everything that&#39;s bad about chain restaurants at you, and dares you not to leave. <br><br>It looks like a casino: all gilded up, with giant columns everywhere, like some Mount Olympus of crapitude. But it&#39;s dark, insidious horror runs far deeper than the decor. <br><br>There is simply no way that any sentient human can endure, let alone enjoy eating at this place. <br><br>The menu is a sprawling, Dickensian monstrosity filled with twisted Epcot versions of the world&#39;s cuisine. There&#39;s Italian, Tex-mex, and, inexplicably, Goulash. There&#39;s even vaguely Asian things, which seem to have sprung  from some focus group where the question was: &#34;Name a foreign food you&#39;ve heard of.&#34; And it&#39;s all really, really, really bad.<br><br>Oh, and as if all this wasn&#39;t bland and soullesss  enough, there are ads in the menu. For other businesses. Right in between the meal options. It&#39;s jus&#39; like watchin&#39; the elec-tru-fied television! <br><br>Now, some will say &#34;The portions are HUGE! It&#39;s a great deal.&#34; But that&#39;s like saying &#34;This urine is cold, therefore it is refreshing.&#34; Hey, if heapin&#39; helpings is all you need, just eat 30 pounds of dirt for lunch, and save yourself the money. If you want decent food, eat somewhere else.
Had a great lunch experience.   Food was delicious and plentiful but the whole experience was made even better by Bryce, our waiter who was outstanding!!!!

Begone evil chain!<br><br>They can&#39;t tell you what&#39;s in the food because it&#39;s not made on-site. They can&#39;t modify your order because it comes pre-packaged (picking the &#39;things&#39; out doesn&#39;t count).<br><br>What kind of hooey is that? I&#39;m paying $17 for a fancy-pants microwave meal? <br><br>Call me a luddite who wants an iPhone, but I think I will pass on mass-produced preservative-laced cryogenically frozen dining. I suppose the cheesecake is pretty good for having been frozen like Wesley Snipes.

Two stars for interior design (which is to say having some and making an attempt. . . not that it&#39;s good).  After that this place blows me away with how blah it is.<br><br>The menu is *wayyyyy* too expansive, and yet, nothing is really above mediocre (but is accompanied by a more than mediocre price).  The service is about what you&#39;d expect at Applebee&#39;s, and honestly, I think the cheesecakes are kind of lackluster.  They all have the same boring pre-made-in-large-batches-and-pressed-into-shape consistency and &#34;perfection&#34;  <br><br>Ok, yeah.  I&#39;m a cheesecake snob.  My specialty in the kitchen is cheesecakes.  I know what it takes to make a great one.  I&#39;ve tasted cheesecakes from some of the greats,  So when I&#39;m presented with run-of-the-mill cheesecakes in 101 flavors, I yawn. . . 101 times.<br><br>Sorry CF. . you just don&#39;t do it for me.

I&#39;m quoting Jessica M on this, because if this information is correct, it needs to be disseminated:  &#34;Did you know that Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t prepare any of their own food? It&#39;s all prepared at a central location and sent off to be reheated or &#34;grilled&#34; at the restaurants. Now you know, too.&#34;<br><br>For someone like me, who suffers from food allergies, this could indeed prove to be fatal if the servers of &#34;chefs&#34; are not aware of every ingredient used in the pre prepared food. I&#39;m giving them two stars instead of one based on the benefit of the doubt.<br><br>I honestly felt like they lost the plot once they stopped serving the onion strings, those were the best.<br><br>As for the restaurant, it&#39;s an oversized (200 different entrees!)  TGI Fridays, or Bennigans, or whatever other Americana chain you want to point to, with the addition of a large cheesecake selection and a menu that actually has advertisements in it. Tacky decor, mediocre food, friendly servers (who apparently have to spend $120 on their own uniforms) and sickly sweet syrupy alcoholic drinks. I do however like the warm bread they give you at the beginning of a meal.<br><br>But really the only way I ever seemed to end up here in the past was because I went shopping at the mall and was hungry and wanted to avoid the food court.

Standard cheesecake factory attached to a mall. The servers are nice (and cute!) and the food is generally pretty decent. They are pretty generous with the bread here so try not to fill up before you even place your order. It happens to the best of us.<br><br>My grilled cheese this afternoon was bomb but I thought my friends were gonna have to roll me down Huntington Avenue after eating it all. Beware of gigantic portions.<br><br>Also, do not come here on a weekend night. Just don&#39;t. Nothing is worth waiting 3 hours for! Not even Reeses peanut butter chocolate cake cheesecake. <br><br>Well maybe...

Over-priced, over-hyped, over-salted and over-buttered. <br><br>Seriously, it&#39;s like they drench everything in butter. <br><br>I hope you like some fries with your salt.<br><br>Portions are huge but every time I walk out of this place I feel like I need to have my veins declogged.

We went there last night for dinner before catching a play at the Huntington Theatre. The wait wasn&#39;t too bad - our friend got there before us but they wouldn&#39;t seat her until we arrived. So we put our names in right away and I think the wait was only about 5-10 minutes. This place is huge and so popular even for a Wednesday night! <br><br>We ordered drinks - I got the pomegranate mojito, very very good! It&#39;s a little cheaper then a regular mojito too (maybe less alcohol since the pomegranate takes up room?) I def recommend that drink. Not many people can make a good mojito but they did a great job. <br><br>For such a huge menu The Cheesecake is unfortunately a big disappointment for any vegan. Luckily I had been there this summer with my dad in Virginia so I was already acquainted with the menu, Otherwise I would have been lost. Unfortunately most things contain eggs, butter, fish sauce, beef broth, cheese, etc. Supposedly all their pastas and breads contain egg so beware. <br><br>However I ordered the same thing I got this past summer and that was the Thai lettuce wrap. You can easily replace the chicken with portobello strips, asparagus, or avocado. They are very willing to do this and don&#39;t charge you that extra &#34;replacement&#34; tax that a lot of other places do. The wraps are delish - you get 3 different sauces and lots of good toppings to put in them. So the dish was great, exactly what I remembered. <br><br>I just wish they would have more vegan options - esp with some veg protein dishes (vegetarian beans, tofu, nuts, etc.)   My meal was great but I was definitely hungry a few hours later!<br><br>The service was pretty good, the waiter was a little slow at times and we had to flag him down, but otherwise very friendly and a great atmosphere. We had plenty of time to chat, eat, and still make it to our play early.

So Cheesecake Factory seems to be the kind of place that you love or you hate.  In complete and utter honesty, I hate the place.  Why 3 stars then? Read my profile, I&#39;m picky, but fair. ;)<br><br>Why I don&#39;t like it:<br>1) the WAIT!!!! I simply can&#39;t comprehend why people think it&#39;s worth waiting an hour to eat here.  That said, would it be that hard to get beepers that have a range that actually allows you to venture past the halfway mark of the Barnes and Noble upstairs?<br><br>2) The menu.  I&#39;m sorry, but I don&#39;t like feeling like I&#39;m reading a laminated magazine when I&#39;m trying to find something to eat for dinner.  Besides the silly ads, the way the menu is categorized makes it hard to find things.  Since they have so many things they have overlapping categories and that makes hard to keep track.<br><br>3) The food.  It&#39;s only marginally better than a TGI Friday&#39;s or an Applebee&#39;s, but the price point is signifigantly more than that.  Portion sizes are also inconsistent, meaning sometimes it&#39;s WAY more than you can eat and other times it&#39;s not enough.<br><br>What I do like:<br>1) The bread.  Fresh warm bread is always a plus when you&#39;ve been waiting for an HOUR and you&#39;re starving.<br><br>2) Girl appeal.  I don&#39;t know what it is, but girls seem to love this place.  Every girl I&#39;ve dated in the last 3 yrs seems to be in love with this place and was always exstatic when we&#39;d go there.  As a guy sometimes you just have to do what the ladies want, just not always...

Oh Cheesecake factory... to be plain and simple- I love you.<br><br>The food is delicious no matter what you&#39;re ordering.<br>It&#39;s my sister&#39;s favorite restaurant (according to her it&#39;s her favorite in the world, but she&#39;s 11 so she gets cut some slack) so we go every time the fam visits.  I also find myself going in between and as a result, have quite a few suggestions:<br><br>1. splitting an appetizer and an entree tends to be more friendly on those of us who want cheesecake<br>2. the drinks are ALWAYS delicious<br>3. unless you&#39;re some kind of super human, be careful when you order the burgers.  they&#39;re super delicious but you will be stomach-aching full after<br>4. their other desserts are amazingly delicious too!<br>5. wasabi encrusted tuna = best thing on the menu (okay... that one is an opinion)<br>6. GO TO BRUNCH. the lemon ricotta pancakes would be worth sacrificing a limb for while the breakfast burrito is big enough to attach to your body and replace previously mentioned lost limb.<br><br>...I&#39;m going back some Sunday soon just to get them and post pictures.

I don&#39;t care what all the haters say... I effing love this place.<br><br>I know that it&#39;s a huge tourist trap but I still have nothing but love. The wait can be a little long and there may occasionally be annoying children but it&#39;s well worth it. The food is always delicious and the wait staff is extremely nice. <br><br>The menu seems never ending so there&#39;s no way you won&#39;t find something you like. To some people it may seem like too many options... but I don&#39;t think that&#39;s possible. Your meal is always prepared quickly and the portions are huge. The wait staff, as I said before, is awesome!<br><br>and the cheesecake *DROOL*<br>Cheesecake is my favorite dessert EVER! There are about 30 different kinds but I myself am a plain cheesecake kind of girl! I&#39;ve tried my fair share but I always go back to the original. It is SO good. Literally cream-in-your-pants good :P<br><br>Seriously even if you don&#39;t want to wait to eat there get a piece to go! In fact get 2 because you&#39;ll be craving it the next day.... SO GOOD!

Great place to go for dessert not a meal. <br><br>I went there several times, orders entree and couldn&#39;t finish it. They&#39;re way too large. So I ended up couldn&#39;t order dessert!! <br><br>Poor me, anyway I then decided to go there just for some cakes and that was fabulous. Hmm yummy, creamy, cheesy cakes.<br><br>Prepare for a veeeery long line!

The food comes in very large, overpriced portions. Everything on the menu *feels* heavy too...be prepared to loosen the belt a notch on your way out if you finish your plate. They don&#39;t focus on any style of food and they mix alot of world styles too. I hear they rotate some of the less popular dishes out of the menu to try new ones. <br><br>Reminds me alot of the enviroments you find in Las Vegas casinos on the main strip or perhaps on a cruise ship, although both of those places do a better job with the food than Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>I&#39;ve never bothered with the actual cheesecake since it&#39;s not my thing but this is one of my last choices for a place to go out to eat. When I go to a restaurant, I go because I want a certain kind of food. They don&#39;t do any particular food well and every dish is plain mediocre.<br><br>On the upside, the waitstaff is very friendly and they get an extra star for trying.

Did you know that Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t prepare any of their own food? It&#39;s all prepared at a central location and sent off to be reheated or &#34;grilled&#34; at the restaurants. Now you know, too.<br><br>I learned this fact from a friend who has a severe egg allergy; they were unable to confirm if any of their food was safe for her to eat.<br><br>The artifice of the decor reminds me of Las Vegas, although I am more easily able to forgive Vegas for being Vegas than Cheesecake being an aspirational middle-class view of luxury.<br><br>I am conflicted because I have eaten here a couple of times and their goulash dish seriously reminds me of my grandmother&#39;s.

I always want to be happy with my meal. With its huge portions and fancy smancy names, sadly I never am. For me personally, they serve way too much of a not so good thing. They should deduct quantity and improve quality.<br><br>I can&#39;t say the same for the cheesecake, its a bit on the magical side.

I&#39;ve had good experiences and bad experiences at the Cheesecake Factory- but are we ever really going to Cheesecake Factory for an experience? No, not really. It&#39;s more about the huge menu and a place to take your non-foodie friends. However- I finally no longer look through the 100 page menu, and always order the ridiculously good Charbroiled Flat Iron steak and replace the french fries with green beans. <br><br>And some advice I wish I knew- ever order the classic cheesecake with fresh strawberries just because the strawberries are to die for? You can actually just order a bowl of them without the calorie-filled cheesecake.

Normally I am anti-chain, but I have a weakness for the Cheesecake Factory.    <br><br>The key is to get past the pseudo pretension of the hostess station (which usually involves giving stares of death to everyone who gets seated before you).  Then, there&#39;s the epic journey past garish decor that people like my grandmother appreciate and continuously comment on.  Finally, upon reaching your table, there&#39;s the quest for the perfect selection.  Once you&#39;ve decided, the real test begins: can you restrain from eating all the bread?  <br><br>Being seasoned veterans, everyone at my table wisely tore off one small piece and pushed the basket aside. On this Tuesday night, the restaurant wasn&#39;t crowded and our two appetizers arrived quickly- grilled artichoke (mmm...excellent with dipping sauce) and edamame (best sprinkled with salt).  It is essential to pace yourself- if you dive in like a ravenous beast, you&#39;ll get full to quickly and won&#39;t have room for your massive entree. <br> <br>For our main, my fellow vegetarian and I each got the Luau Salad, substituting chicken with portabello mushrooms.  We followed the cardinal rule: if there are two vegetarians in a party, you get to be as high maintenance as you want.  <br> <br>After dinner, the waitress came over and asked us if we wanted dessert.  OF COURSE we wanted dessert.  What tops off a 2,000 calorie dinner more than a gluttonous hot fudge sundae?  It&#39;s living the American dream.

This Cheesecake Factory appears to be in an alternate universe(or maybe just just Back Bay).<br>Anywhoo, I enjoy this one over its friends because of the labyrinthine floorplan(way confusing finding your way back to your table from the ladies&#39; room after a couple of cocktails), relatively low wait time, and the outdoor seating. Also, the bread seems to be freshest here, and the butter is always the right degree of softness.<br><br>For some reason, this one always has a couple menu items I&#39;ve never seen at another Cheesecake Factory, and the waitstaff is usually not retarded. Sooo....I always leave here pleased.

They&#39;re ALL Robots!!!<br><br>It should be a 3.5, because it&#39;s above average, nothing special.  i don&#39;t eat cheesecake so that might have a slight effect on me not liking this place as much because with a name like the cheesecake factory, i&#39;m pretty sure the cheesecake would be good (for people who eat that crap)<br>anyway, this location is better than the cambridgeside mall one, because (I think) it&#39;s newer, nicer, and bigger.  The food is real good, huge portions, but again, nothing special.  There isn&#39;t anything bad about the place except that the waiters (Robots) are only pretending to be friendly, expecting a great tip by saying &#34;awesome&#34; 100 times in a meal service, screwing up a simple salad order, and fake smiles, when they pop up on the opposite side of the table that they just left to refill your drink for 10 minutes...  if you can see them through the ridiculously packed restaurant...

It&#39;s huge in comparision to TCF in my area.  <br><br>Still we waited and waited.  Every time I go here, I am dragged here by someone else ( who just wants food that they &#34;know&#34;) and I have to go in, head down and anticipating disappointment.<br><br>Mahi tuna/mashed potato were surprisingly good, I have to say.<br><br>Wrapped up the evening with some pistachio cheesecake which became my hotel room companion over the next 2 nights.  Delicious stuff...again I was surprised here.<br><br>When alone and bored 3,000 miles away from home, I was sad to see my &#34;special friend&#34;  reduce in size exponentially, and then finally turn into a crumble of crust that was thrown away by the maid staff  w/o regard.<br><br>Ah well, I&#39;m sure I will be back.......it&#39;s like death and taxes it seems for me, anyways.
The food here is alright, but most of the time I&#39;ve went with my friends, there have been complaints about dirty surroundings, and microwaved food.  The decorations are nice, though!

CF is awesome. Everyone knows it. Portions are HUGE (good enough to make two meals out of one) and tons of things to choose from. I used to primarily stick to the pasta dishes, being a pasta connoisseur but I have to say that I&#39;ve discovered a new, probably often over-looked, dish that is definitely worth mentioning. The Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp (pg.11 of the menu). It&#39;s a perfect mix of american-ized thai and goodness. It&#39;s chicken and shrimp, in a mild-ish curry sauce with coconut milk and veggies, with tons of rice. A great summer meal!<br><br>Also if you&#39;re in the mood for something a little more italian...try the Chicken Belliagio. It&#39;s on the new special supplement menu... it&#39;s all sorts of goodness...lightly breaded chicken on top of spaghetti with basil/pesto sauce, drizzled with Parmesan sauce and thin slices of prosciutto to top it off. Enjoy!

I love Cheesecake Factory. Yeah, it&#39;s a chain. Yeah, I have to wait for hours for a table to open up. Yeah, sometimes it takes forever to flag down my server. BUT the place serves up consistently good food. Their desserts are even better! Yum...<br><br>A couple things that I love from here:<br>- Beef ribs (served with onion strings and fries)<br>- Fried calamari (just good)<br>- Chicken Costoletta (really crisp, served with mashed and asparagus)<br>- Tiramisu cheesecake (mind blowing)<br><br>If you don&#39;t mind the wait or the once-in-a-while crappy service, come here.

I am a Cheesecake Factory whore. It&#39;s not on purpose though! It just so happens that wherever I am, at any given point in time, there is ALWAYS a Cheesecake Factory around. So, it&#39;s become &#34;old reliable.&#34; I used to work at the CambridgeSide Galleria, and my co-workers and I would go there every Friday night after close to grab some drinks and food and bitch about how much we hated work. When I finally left that place, I was so happy I could finally end my Friday nights somewhere different.... but then I ended up getting a job at the Copley Mall and hence, another Cheesecake Factory! <br><br>The food is essentially the same at all of them. This one here almost always has a wait. I don&#39;t get what the big deal is, but whatever.<br><br>Their food portions are OVERWHELMING. Much too big for a single person to eat. My friends and I normally get some appetizers and share, or a pasta dish, or split a sandwich. There are a few things on the menu that I always seem to fall back on:<br><br>-- Sliders. With fries. Yummy.<br>-- Avocado Eggrolls. I don&#39;t know what it is with me and avocados, but I love them.<br>-- Thai Lettuce Wraps. A little sloppy to eat, and the sauce drips everywhere, but I like it.<br>-- Pasta DaVinci. One of my favorite pasta dishes of all time.<br>-- Steak Diane. Little nugglets of meaty goodness. And it comes with their yummy mashed potatoes. Can&#39;t go wrong there.<br>-- Pumpkin Cheesecake. yes, it&#39;s seasonal. I believe they have it now, and it sticks around till after the New Year. Definitely worth a try if you&#39;ve never had it. I don&#39;t even like the taste of pumpkin, but this cheesecake is to die for. I just wish they had it year-round.<br><br>Service is pretty fast. I love the large glasses they use for soda. Even the glasses they use for alcoholic drinks is good. Ladies, if you are looking for a good alcoholic drink that is delicious and won&#39;t knock you over, try the Strawberry Creamsicle. It is by far the most delicious drink I&#39;ve EVER had, and well.... I drink a lot :-)<br><br>Don&#39;t go here for brunch though. Their brunch food sucks. You&#39;re much better off going to Thornton&#39;s, which is across the street. <br><br>I would never choose CF to go to for a special night or date, but it&#39;s one of those low-pressure places where you can just go chill with your friends, knowing exactly what to expect.

I can&#39;t help but LOVE the cheesecake there. The entree&#39;s are delish, but expensive, raspberry martini&#39;s are perfection o90but...the wait staff....needs a lil work.<br><br>She took 10 minutes just to come to our table for the first time, 15 minutes to come back with water and no drinks. Another 10 to take our order. Food didn&#39;t come for 20 minutes. And when it did come, it took her 15 MORE minutes to see if we needed anything else. Like, oh I don&#39;t know...maybe my drink I ordered 45 minutes ago?<br><br>She was sweet, It looks like she was trying, so we left her 30% anyway. She gave us directions to go to newbury st. <br><br>If your cheesecake wasn&#39;t so damn crack-tifying...I&#39;d eat some where else. But, your food so goooood. Please try to keep in touch with your tables. I&#39;ll be back.

I&#39;m not really sure how I feel about this place. Every time I go it is kind of the same thing. It is right across the street from my office so it tends to be a lunch place for my coworkers and me. The portions are large, the food is decent although sometimes it is salted to death and I like salt. The service is hit or miss depending on who you get. Seems like there is a very high turn over with wait staff I rarely see the same people aside from the hostesses. The cheesecake is pretty good stuff though, and there are lots of different combinations. I haven&#39;t counted but I&#39;d guess around 20 something flavors. <br><br>I&#39;ve seen the lines on my way home for dinner at this place and I think you are probably better going somewhere else in the area. That or call ahead they take reservations.

I cannot stand this place, and i&#39;ve never understood what the hype around it is. The only times i&#39;ve ever gone is because friends for some strange reason want to have their birthday dinners there. but again, i don&#39;t get why people like it!<br><br>1- the wait to get in is freaking ridiculous, it&#39;s always long, i dont think i&#39;ve ever waited under 30 mins, blah!<br><br>2- the staff blows. they put on fake smiles for you, and at the same time look like their about to stab you in the eye with your own fork.<br><br>3- the food isn&#39;t even that good! most of my friends make better food than they do here. i always think i&#39;ve ordered something i&#39;ll like, but no they&#39;ve found a way for me to not like it.<br><br>this place blows. BLOWS BLOWS BLOWS!!!
Place is huge and there is always a wait. They dont do reservations either. Huge menu with just about everything you can think of. Id like to see the prices a little cheaper. All in all a good spot.

This was one of the best dining experiences I&#39;ve had in the past few months, and the best part was I didn&#39;t even have to walk into the restaurant. I placed my order on <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2FFoodler.com&amp;s=0023c688bb084dcec00f0539bc0b57c8429a53c1ca5e385e73793dcae003a235" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Foodler.com</a> roughly an hour before I normally eat dinner and by the time my meal showed up (about 45 minutes) I was ready for some delicious food. <br><br>Let me start by saying that the Roadside Sliders are incredible. Rarely will I order something as conventional as a cheeseburger when I order from a restaurant that has a ton more to offer, but after the first bite I was completely hooked. They&#39;re basically mini-burgers that you can finish in about 4 or 5 bites (1 or 2 if you&#39;re REALLY hungry). They were so flavorful I had to order another batch the following week. Top it off with a slice of Peanut Butter Cheesecake and you&#39;ll be one happy customer. An excellent choice for any occasion.

I had some sort of Oriental Orange Chicken.  It was great but overpriced like everything else here.  The waiter was alright.  Normally this place is packed at night with a wait of at least 30min and for whatever reason they do not take reservations.  I might have gone here more than once if they did.  On second thought, no, I wouldn&#39;t.<br><br>This place is overrated.

Cheesecake.  <br><br>Basically that is all we had there, and it had to be Take Out because it was stupid crowded.<br><br>Good Cheesecake, nothing more, nothing less.<br><br>There is one closer to my house that I would go to, so the chances of me returning to this particular location is very slim.

I used to be in love with the Cheesecake Factory, but this love has faded so much that I almost never want to eat here (at least at this location) when people suggest it. <br><br>My main reason is the waiting time. This is like a 9 step process. First, put your name in. Wait 30 min for a buzzer. Then wait another 45 min for the buzzer to go off. When it finally does, you are ushered into a line of people STILL waiting to be seated. <br><br>I realize that Copley is a popular destination for tourists, professionals, suburbanites, students, etc...but when it takes longer to sit down than it does to actually eat my food, I have an issue. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is also not THE best place to eat if you have food allergies.  I think it really depends on the location, time of day, and server, because often I feel like it is too much effort to really make sure that my waiter understands all of the complexities that go into cooking for someone with celiac disease. I&#39;d rather just order a salad, hold the bread and dressing, and say I have a wheat allergy.  <br><br>I have read on some celiac message boards that at some locations, a manager or chef will sit down with you and pick whatever you want to eat...but at other locations, you&#39;ll be told &#34;we can&#39;t guarantee that ANYTHING can be made gluten-free.&#34;  Thanks. <br><br>However, I am aware of a couple gluten-free desserts...the ice cream, goblet of strawberries (so simple, yet so delicious), and the Godiva cheesecake. Apparently there is no graham cracker crust...but I don&#39;t trust that it&#39;s not been contaminated by other cheesecakes in the bakery. <br><br>Despite the fact that I have my own hang-ups with Cheesecake, they do offer a huuuuge menu and decent service. Any waiter that says &#34;Sup, boo?&#34; or &#34;You done hittin&#39; that?&#34; is awesome.

I guess I never really understood the hyper about Cheesecake Factory.  The first time I went to it was in Miami and it was pretty good, not great though.  My pasta was so dry and stuck together, I hate when it&#39;s cooked like that.  I thought maybe it was just a fluke, cuz everyone else&#39;s food looked great!  The second and third time were the same and I was really let down considering how much their food is.  I love pasta and feel like if you can&#39;t do pasta right then what the hell is wrong with you?!<br><br>Either way the Cheesecake in Boston was no different.  Apparently whoever owns Cheesecake thinks that that&#39;s the right way to make spaghetti....I mean, how the hell do you mess up just a normal plate of angel hair pasta with marinara sauce??  On the other hand, their Louisiana Chicken Pasta is really good!<br><br>Other then that, I love their drinks! Esp. the frozen iced mango----SO FREAKIN GOOD, practically heaven :)  Their salads are huge and tower over everything else you order.  The Chicken Madeira is my default dish with a side of steamed broccoli--yum!!<br><br>If you want something a little spicier, the Spicy Cashew Chicken is my bf&#39;s fav.  And for appetizers?  While I&#39;m usually partial to fried calamari with marinara sauce, their Roadside Sliders is def. the way to go!!  You could even consider it your meal :)<br><br>While it seems I like Cheesecake more then I first claimed, the fact that they can&#39;t make a good, simple pasta with marinara really disappoints me....

The first thing I feel compelled to mention and feel everyone should know is that the Cheesecake Factory doesnt make their own cheesecake. It is from S&amp;S in NYC. True dat.<br><br>But beyond that, yes... they give you large portions. They should, for forcing you to wait an hour and be crammed in there. <br><br>The waitresses have to wear white pants. I feel badly for them.]<br><br>The food is not that good. It is not that bad, but it is not that good. <br><br>You can count on this place to be consistently okay.<br><br>J

As if the masses outside didn&#39;t give it away, this is mall food for people with mall taste.<br><br>(As an aside: I don&#39;t care about the tacky decor. I don&#39;t care that it&#39;s a chain. I care that the food lacks flavor and that they try to compensate for a shortcoming in quality with an increase in quantity.)

Ive always like eating here, although they don&#39;t specialize in any type of food so its incredibly hard to decide what you&#39;re in the mood for.   The portions are ridiculous, and strangely I rarely eat the cheesecake because I&#39;m usually too full, but it is delicious. <br><br>The only downfall is they don&#39;t accept reservations, so unless you go at 4pm on a Tuesday, expect to wait a decent amount of time to be seated.&#34;<br>05/01/2006

I just don&#39;t GET the hype...everything I&#39;ve gotten there has been the definition of mediocre (and the salads are just plain bad), the prices are high (for mediocre food), and the wait&#39;s always long, often longer than they even tell you.  So many people seem obsessed with it and I just don&#39;t understand....maybe the allure of being an &#34;expensive&#34; chain??  There&#39;s so much better food out there.<br><br>Cheesecake&#39;s good, though.

Standard Cheesecake Factory. I typically order the grilled coulotte steak and did so this time. It was slightly overcooked, but the meal was generally good. <br><br>The service was not great, however. We waited for nearly two hours and eventually were shown to our seats, only to see a table with lettuce and ketchup still on it. They called the busboy over and he quickly bussed the table... by sweeping the trash onto the floor.
Their menu on Yelp is not updated. The two things I wanted to order were not on their menu when I called. Then the receptionist gave me attitude like it was my fault.

I love Cheesecake Factory.  I&#39;ve been twice recently and am really happy with their calorie conscious menu.  They have a good variety of meals that are under 500 (or 600?) calories.  The margherita flatbread pizza is awesome.  The bread they bring out while you&#39;re waiting is also awesome.  The cheesecake though....WICKED AWESOME!  It&#39;s sooooo incredibly difficult for me to resist getting a slice when I go there.<br><br>Anyways, this particular location is ginormous.  I&#39;ve only gone for lunch there and we get seated right away.  The service is good.  Nothing particularly special there.  Relaxing atmosphere and easy to have a conversation (noise-level-wise).  <br><br>It&#39;s my first choice for a sit-down lunch at the Pru.

I was incredibly disappointed by the food.  I ordered the teriyaki chicken over brown rice &amp; it was HORRENDOUS.    The rice was clumpy &amp; SMOTHERED in teriyaki sauce (there was more sauce on the rice than there was on the chicken).  The chicken was also crappy - it was an odd cut of chicken (which I think was the breast, but not really sure) and the wings were still attached.<br>I&#39;ve had the pasta here in the past &amp; that was OK.  the cheesecake was good (it is the cheesecake factory, after all).  <br>Bottom line - it&#39;s a touristy restaurant &amp; located in a very touristy part of Boston (at the bottom of the Prudential building).  There other (and cheaper) places to go.

I hate to say it but the tourist trap has some pretty decent salads. Just make sure you order the small or you&#39;ll be digging through 2 heads of lettuce trying to find the ingredients the whole time.<br><br>Of course the cheesecake is good but isn&#39;t all cheecesake?<br><br>I will also say that they manage to get your order right consistently and find you a seat with a minimal wait even when it looks hopeless.

I always like Cheesecake Factory and visit the Chestnut Hill location very often but not a fan of this one. <br>I took my family here when they visited Boston on weekday afternoon, not a busy time. At first, the waiter seemed nice and friendly, although we waited for him to take our order for more than 20 mins and he didn&#39;t ask if we need a basket of bread. That was OK because he was helping a table of 8 or 9 split their bill and check out one by one. <br><br>We got our appetizer and my sliders on time, and we finished the appetizer soon. Then, it took like FOREVER to get the rest of us the entrees! Our waiter never came to ask and just walked by several times. About 30 mins later, I went to the restroom and thought the entrees might arrive. BUT, after I went back to the table, there were still no entrees!! What the hell was going on? Our waiter was just standing there and talking with another staff, I walked to him and asked: Sorry for interrupting you, but I think it takes a little too long for our entrees.....<br><br>He said we ordered too many dishes (what?? One appetizer, one small plate of sliders, and three entrees for a table of 4, that is TOO MANY?) so he split our order to the kitchen, that&#39;s why the three entrees were slower to come. He rushed to the kitchen, and our entrees finally came. The most interesting was when the waiter brought the salmon my family ordered, he said: because you asked your fish to be well-done, it took longer to cook.<br>What can I say??????? Why not tell us you just asked your fisherman to catch the salmon after we placed our order about 40 mins ago? Look! How fresh the salmon is!<br><br>I know many tourists visit this Cheesecake Factory and I guess that&#39;s why the waiter was not attentive and careless, because tourists may only come here once. I am not a tourist, but to waiters with bad attitude: if you get few tips and no customer comes back again, it&#39;s not because your customers are tourists, it&#39;s because you didn&#39;t do your job.

I&#39;ve definitely had my awkward share of waiters here...but their food is delicious, so it balances out.  Their portions are very fair, so go hungry if you plan to finish your whole meal.  I recently tried their lunch sized pasta, which I was afraid would be too small, but I actually really enjoyed it along with the appetizer.  I ordered the Buffalo Blasts by mistake thinking they were wings, but the Buffalo Blasts are definitely way better than I expected.  Good-sized appetizer to share with maybe three or four people.<br><br>The waiters usually bring our entrees out when we&#39;re still eating our appetizer...and it&#39;s extremely frustrating because our food just sits on our table and starts to get warm - not the out-of-the-oven HOT that you expect it to be.<br><br>Besides the service, no complaints.  Great food, AMAZING cheesecake (obviously), great location.<br><br>Also, note that they don&#39;t take reservations, so on busy nights, the wait can take FOREVER...but it&#39;s worth it!

Huge Fan! Great atmosphere, great food, great servers.  The only downside is the parking, but what do you expect in Downtown Boston?<br><br>Food is excellent, service is excellent, atmosphere is excellent (a bit noisy). I come here with dates, family, friends, grandparents, and anyone else looking for a great meal.

Not impressed.  For the size of the place (it took me forever to find the bathroom &amp; I asked 4 people), the wait is usually more than a decade on the weekends.  Luckily, this past Friday we were seated almost immediately.  Our waitress was friendly &amp; brought our drinks quickly, though when we were not ready to order (I was having a hard time finding something I wanted even with their magazine menu), she took off for about another 10-15 mins.  <br><br>I got the chicken medallions &amp; while they were pretty good, it didn&#39;t taste any better than something I could have made at home.  T, on the other hand, got the meatloaf.  Now, if you are trying to eat a 2,000 calorie meal, the meatloaf is the way to go -- it is HUGE... I asked him how it was &amp; he told me that my meatloaf was better.  So, I tried a piece -- crunchy.   Since when is meatloaf supposed to be crunchy?!  &amp; then it only tasted like stuffing... not so much meat.<br><br>In any event, I&#39;ve been here quite a few times &amp; still feel like something is lacking.  I guess it would be a good night out for drinks or cheesecake.

I saw a review below from Stephanie M. that said Cheesecake Factory &#34;tries to be everything and therefore specializes in nothing.&#34;<br><br>Forgive me, foodies, but the four stars are for exactly that: the Cheesecake Factory does in fact specialize in doing everything.  They&#39;re a big location in a busy area that corners hotels, the ballpark, Northeastern, and Berklee.  They are exactly what&#39;s demanded of them: a place where you can take just about anybody, anytime, and get them something that they&#39;ll enjoy.  Next time you&#39;re complaining about how your burrito isn&#39;t &#34;authentic,&#34; look across the table from you.  Is someone eating a cheeseburger?  Or a pizza?  If so, you&#39;re the fool for expecting any of them to be some sort of &#34;specialty&#34; item.  <br><br>This is a mega-raunt, and let&#39;s be honest, they do it well.  Everything tastes GOOD -- maybe it&#39;s not great, maybe it&#39;s not unique or exceptional, but it all tastes good.  If I can have good fettucini alfredo while you have good Cuban and your mom has a good shepherd&#39;s pie, you&#39;ve gotta appreciate that.  They also don&#39;t cheat anyone even a little bit on the portions: you&#39;re going to get a dinner that will fill you.<br><br>It&#39;s sort of &#34;cool&#34; to turn your nose up at the Cheesecake Factory, but they&#39;re laughing all the way to the bank.  They do what they do, and they do it well.  How could anyone be confused as to what this place is all about?  If they&#39;re not meeting your expectations... I give your brain two stars.

Okay, I have a history of being terrified of going to a Cheesecake Factory since an incident that happened about 9 or 10 years ago (at the Cheesecake Factory in Providence -- not this one). . . I actually had GLASS in my food. Yeah. That will make you not want to go back to a restaurant.<br><br>There have been only a couple of times in the years since then that people I&#39;m with have wanted to go to a Cheesecake Factory, and I very reluctantly went. I never thought it was anything really great - just OK.<br><br>However, I went last night to the one in the Prudential Center with a bunch of friends to celebrate a birthday. We went after work on a Friday, so of course the place was packed. However, we didn&#39;t have to wait long for a table, and we ordered a LOT of food. I have to say that Shea, our waitress was unbelievably sweet and right on top of things. We kept having people show up and we kept ordering more stuff, and she was just a trouper. <br>Even when we had already paid the bill, one of my friends asked for more coffee and water, and they were still nice to us.<br><br>It was a perfect place for our birthday gathering - the food was good, as was the service. I love their appetizers, especially the avocado eggrolls and Thai lettuce wraps. I think I won&#39;t be afraid to go to a Cheesecake Factory again.

I am giving it three stars. I don&#39;t give out too many three stars usually so I honestly don&#39;t know whether I like it or not. One thing is obvious - their cheesecakes are awesome. I probably go here for just that. But that&#39;s what they&#39;re meant to be good at anyway. <br><br>What I don&#39;t understand is this - why the wait? I mean, the food is not THAT great that people are lining their asses up here for 1-2 hr waits even on weekdays. Maybe its a tourist thing, I don&#39;t know. Having said that, I do like some of their dishes - pasta and grilled chicken medallions. Those are definitely worth trying if you do plan on going here. Alcohol selection is pretty much like any other restaurant of its type. Recommendation - try it if you&#39;ve never been here and decide for yourself.

I see a lot of mixed reviews for Cheesecake, and I can understand why. On the one hand, for the same price there are so many other more charming &amp; interesting restaurants to try, but on the other hand Cheesecake factory&#39;s food is a pretty sure bet.  Good selection and good (but not great) food.   <br><br>Ambiance is definitely lacking.  Something about the design of the restaurant always conjures up images of the Disney movie Aladin-weird.  And the place does make you feel like you are in a factory- huge capacity, insane waits, very noisy.   I can&#39;t help but feel everything in this restaurant is some how a product of some corporate boardroom somewhere- feels kinda sterile.  <br><br>As for the food: It is pretty good for a chain restaurant- surprisingly expensive for what it is.  If you are more adventurous you can definitely find far more flavor and ambiance everywhere in Boston.  <br><br>They make a pretty good chicken Madeira which is nice because its kind of a surprisingly uncommon dish.  <br><br>...Oh yeah,... and the cheesecake...I guess its good, but overrated.  I am more of a cupcake person : )!

My good friend works at the Cheesecake Factory in San Francisco so he had a $50 coupon for the restaurant. Usually when I travel I try to hit up locally known restaurants instead of chains but when gift certificates are involved - well, that&#39;s an exception.<br><br>Cheesecake is pretty standard - we had the miso glazed salmon with sticky rice, which I&#39;d never tried before. It was wonderful and large enough for us to share. My friend ordered our cocktails which were huge, fruity daiquiris. Mine was way to sweet and I couldn&#39;t even finish it; the libation was that huge. <br><br>Side note: EUROPEANS, especially Brits, LOVE the Cheesecake Factory. My friend from across the pond told me eating at the location in Union Square in San Francisco is on a list of top things to do when traveling the world!! Haha.  For that - I hope dining at Per Se in NY or French Laundry in Napa is on that list too.

This location is way bigger than I thought it was.  We were seated without a wait when we came, and we walked from the area by the entrance on Belvidere/Huntington under the steps up to the mall which was another section, over to another section along Huntington ave.  Much bigger in there than I realized until we walked through it like that.  I ordered the Spicy Cashew Chicken.  I&#39;ll paste in the description then talk about it: &#34;a very spicy mandarin-style dish with green onions and roasted cashews. served over rice&#34;.  The start of the description indicates &#34;very spicy&#34;, there wasn&#39;t any spice at all in that dish.  I&#39;ve had spicier ice cream.  Second, although all that&#39;s listed are chicken, green onions, cashews, and rice, I expected more for some reason, maybe some veggies or something, nope only what&#39;s listed.  Well, marinated chicken, rice, cashews, and a few green onions just don&#39;t do it for me I guess.  The only cashew flavor came from the actual cashews, whatever the chicken was marinated in was pretty bland.  Overall just not a good dish.<br><br>What saved the day was of course the cheesecake.  We got the &#39;Toasted Marshmallow S&#39;mores Galore&#39; cheesecake, and it was pretty tasty.  Ended up taking everything home I couldn&#39;t finish, between the main course and the cheesecake I probably have 2 full meals worth of food in my fridge right now from Cheesecake Factory, the portion sizes are pretty big.
