Cheesecake Factory in Cambridge, MA is beyond the most racist, impolite, and ridiculous restaurant I have ever gone too.<br>First, a kid that was with my cousin and a group of friends went to go make a reservation for the 10 of us. They told him 2 hours and he walked away (he&#39;s Cape Verdean). Not even 15 minutes later I came back to make a reservation myself because we decided we would wait and for 15 people because more people came than expected. When I went in their, I was told one hour for 15 people. I would just like to say that is white privileges, obviously. <br>After the one hour (and a half) wait we were finally seated. During the wait, someone who was in our group was asked by his mother to buy some milk to bring home for the house. He did this before because CVS was closing at 9 and it was around 8:45. CVS gave him a brown paper bag for his two half gallons of milk that said CVS on it. After being seated after the long wait, we received a dirty table, dirty clothes, and dirty plates/silverware. <br>When the kid asked if they had milk for him to have with his food, they said that they did not have any. He then asked if the waitress could give him a cup so he could pour his milk into the cup. He even said they could charge him for the cup and continued to show them the milk that was in the paper bag. The waitress said &#34;Okay, I will be right back with everything.&#34; After awhile of waiting, we saw not one, not two, not three, BUT FIVE police officers approaching us. When I asked what the situation or problem was they told us that a manager was told that we were pouring alcohol into our drinks. Mind you, we were there celebrating a friends birthday and my cousins confirmation! <br>The police officers then took the milk away and smelt it and declared that the milk was JUST MILK. They apologized then walked away. How embarrassing right? Due to the obvious fact that us and the waitress was uncomfortable I politely went up to a manager at the front desk and requested a new waiter/waitress because it was an embarrassing and awkward situation for not only us, but the waitress too. They said &#34;okay, yeah. No problem, I&#39;ll be right on that&#34;. After the waitress coming back a total of 5 times, I went to the bathroom and decided to call my cousins mom. As I was telling her the story and what the police officers said to me and everything that was going on, a Manager who wasn&#39;t even dealing with my table got in my face screaming at me saying we were being disruptive and that she was going to kick us out if I didn&#39;t stop telling my Aunt the situation that was occurring. I told her that I&#39;m on a personal phone call what I say is none of her business and that I said exactly what the officer told me he was called for. (The officer even asked us to see some of our drinks!). She then left the bathroom (didn&#39;t use the bathroom) while laughing and calling me a bitch. Due to this altercation, I was recorded by some girls in the bathroom behind me, so once again, an embarrassing situation. I could have been lying out of my ass (WHICH I WASN&#39;T!) and she still had no right to put her two sense into my personal conversation. After the bathroom, I went to go talk to another manager. While I was gone she continuously walked by my table laughing then asked &#34;where is that white girl at&#34; (mind you she&#39;s a fat white girl, not that her physical appearance matters). When talking to the head managed, Clint I believe was his name, I was told that I was lying and that he knows these employees well and that both the girls saw a bottle of alcohol. No alcohol was found when the police searched us, our table, the bags, and our milk/drinks. Notice how he said two girls, we had one boy and one girl! <br>My uncle came in and demanded an apology and they offered an order on the house. We denied and said that we just wanted an apology. He continued to say we can afford our own food, just that we also deserved to be respected. We then checked everyone&#39;s receipt and made sure everything was paid for (I DID THIS MYSELF, PERSONALLY). We even left an extra $20 to show that we didn&#39;t come here for a scene and that we came here to eat properly. As the group tried to leave they stopped and said we still owed them money and that we didn&#39;t pay. They then argued for awhile saying we should have kept our receipt (they collected it from us). They then discovered that they made ANOTHER mistake and that we did pay and left the extra $20. Not that it matter since they even offered to put the order on the house! <br>There was a total of 12 of us for our 15 people reservation. I was the ONLY white one. Along with that, this all occurred before we even received our food. I didn&#39;t even eat it I was so aggravated that I lost my appetite. They even accused of us saying we put alcohol in our drinks (why would we even tell our server that if we did?) <br>Moral of the story: don&#39;t bring milk to CheeseCake Factory. You&#39;ll be arrested for underage drinking.they don&#39;t even deserve half a star.

The Cheesecake Factory is an AWESOME CHAIN! Does this location live up to its name? It sure does! With a few things to fix but nothing that will turn me off! :)<br><br>We wanted some food after visiting Copley mall. So we thought why not Cheesecake Factory? You cant ever go wrong with them! (Most of the time anyways.)<br><br>So it was 9:00 and we went down. Only to find out it was a 45 minutes wait. Then again for being on a Saturday night that&#39;s fine! So we got our name on the list and we waited....and waited....and waited...For about an hour or so. Still not to bad. The only thing we saw that we did not like was they had sat some parties that came in after us before us...We only had 2 of us. Not sure why this happen. So that was kinda annoying. (Minus one)<br><br>After being sat our server came over right away! Let me tell you that we was thirsty! So this is a huge plus. We ordered a few sodas! The server was pretty nice and told us all of the specials at this time as well. He had our sodas out pretty quickly!<br><br>Upon his return we then ordered our app and 2 meals. <br><br>For our app we got a side salad to share! It was awesome! The lettuce was very good. Romaine lettuce and spinach leaves with tomatoes and cucumbers! The house dressing was JUST AMAZING! I love their salads for that alone! Plus it was huge! So its really good for 2 people easy! huge thumbs up! Even for a side this would have been amazing.<br><br>For a meal I got the four cheese pasta with chicken. All I can say is YUMMY! This is a MUST try for anyone who loves cheese! It blended SO well together. My taste buds want more just writing this review! Its that bad ass!<br><br>We also ordered the orange chicken meal. It came with 12 PEACES OF CHICKEN! Fried with batter to perfection! Its a basic meal but they do it so well! VERY yummy! If you like orange chicken than you will love it!<br><br>The only issue that we had here again was...SLOW! Took a good hour or so to get our meals. If you couldn&#39;t tell it was still well worth the wait!<br><br>During our meal our server made sure our drinks where full. He did however take a little bit to come back to check on how the food was. I think he must have been pretty busy.<br><br>So after dinner we ordered a tiramisu to go! Again it was slow getting it! We waited a good 20 minutes for them to get this ready for us. After paying for everything. So it was a hold up. By the time we got it home and walked off some of our food we had this for dessert! Yummy it was! Again it was worth the wait!<br><br>So for everything we got we ended up with a bill of $65.00. That included a good tip. We knew the server was busy. Everything came out perfect! If they had done a little better on time this is and EASY 5/5! So I&#39;m only taking one star away for the time and skipping over us while seating others.<br><br>VERY STRONG 4/5! Oh we will be going back! The time is such a minor thing when your hungry! Because their food is just that good! Its worth the wait!

This particular location is hit or miss. Of course, the food is exactly the same at every location of this chain (that is, good salads, good avocado eggrolls, cheesecake [duh]), but the service is fairly erratic. I recently went there for a friend&#39;s birthday, but the service was notably bad. The server shouted over us to get our attention, he didn&#39;t check on us during our meal (except to take our plates away in a hurry), and he served us our dessert in to-go boxes so that he &#34;didn&#39;t have to go back to the kitchen and pack up everything.&#34; <br><br>I didn&#39;t understand why he was rushing us out, considering the place was pretty hopping when we left at 11:30. Needless to say, I will not be having any birthday dinners there. Maybe Cambridgeside would be better?

Look, it&#39;s a cheesecake factory.  Whaddya want?!  It&#39;s like any other cheesecake factory.  I went with a bunch of friends, had altogether too much spinach dip, and had a super heavy pasta (that I really only ate a third of).  Sadly no cheesecake this time (I stuffed myself!)...but that&#39;s usually the best part.<br><br>Anyways, it&#39;s a safe bet, huge portions, heavy food, lots of options...and it&#39;s solid.  Not mind-blowing, but not a bad option.

I love, love, love Cheesecake Factory, and it is always my go-to place when I don&#39;t know where else to go.  The portions are huge, so I always end up taking some of my food home to eat for lunch or dinner the next day.<br><br>I know it sounds boring, but I love the Club sandwich.  Other dishes I recommend include the Chicken Samosas (small plate snack), Pasta Carbonera with Chicken and the Santa Fe Salad.<br><br>Because the portions are so big, I never have room for cheesecake after.  But sometimes I&#39;ll take a piece home to eat later.<br><br>My only complaint is that this place is absolutely packed with tourists.  On weekends you may have to wait upwards of one hour or more, and if I recall, they don&#39;t take reservations during peak times.<br><br>Otherwise, this place is good for everyone, whether you are a family with kids, couple looking to go on a date or a large group celebrating a birthday.

The portions are RIDICULOUS and the menu gives me vertigo. When I eat off the regular menu I feel like I need to spend the next 24 hours at the gym ... BUT their seasonal pumpkin pecan cheesecake is amazing and, in my heart, I believe it is zero calories.

Why do people like this place so much? I swear I can&#39;t go anywhere without hearing about someone pining to go hang out at the prudential center and then eat here. Why? <br><br>I&#39;m guessing people don&#39;t notice that this place is your run of the mill chain restaurant that is only pretending to be special. I find the whole decor overbearing and the menu bloated. There food is just loaded with fat to make everyone crave it. When I want something fried, I&#39;d rather go to some greasy spoon diner than wait for an hour to get seated here.

I&#39;m sure almost all points have been hit by the 137 previous reviews...but here goes a few of my top things:<br>1. This place is always packed, be prepared to wait at least 10 to 15 minutes and most likely 30+ minutes<br>2. If you love bread like I do, then this place is awesome...go to town on the bread, I&#39;ve asked for three or four bread baskets in one sitting, seriously.<br>3. They somehow have found a way to do a wide variety of foods in an acceptable way. Some items are better than others....appetizers are very good, and the bbq chicken salad is quite delicious, but huge, as are all their meals.<br>4. Don&#39;t spill water on your pants...it is quite embarrassing and then people will forever call you waterpants.

I had the Hamburger and really liked the baked, slightly crusty bun. The salad which came with it had too little dressing. Unfortunately the appetizer arrived after the entree (???), what made me sad because it was the second time I tried to try the avocado eggrolls and I failed. At least they took it back to the kitchen and off the bill. <br>The cheescake was dry on the top as if it wasn&#39;t from that day what also disappointed us, compared to what I experienced at my last visit to CF in the Burlington mall. <br>I think also the tables are set too close together (our winter coats and the ones of our neighbours nearly didn&#39;t have place at the small bench between us and we didn&#39;t see any hooks). Overall I still like Cheescake Factory, but other branches, I probably won&#39;t come back to this one.

Pro&#39;s: Waiter Jeff was awesome! Very Very fast and friendly. My Burger was awesome *farmhouse burger*, My Boyfriends burger was great too! <br><br>Con&#39;s: You have to wait to get a buzzer... than wait for the buzzer to go off... then wait to be seated... it was like a big waiting game! On a rainy night on Thursday.... there shouldn&#39;t be a 30 minute wait! Oh and the Miranda Hobbs look alike manager should have told the hostess to use ALL the tables and don&#39;t seat 2 of us at a 4 persons table! wouldn&#39;t that table be good for the party of 3 or party of 4 behind us?! <br><br>Only reason I&#39;m complaining on the wait was because there were empty tables we walked by...

Big portions of disgusting food! Hooray!<br><br>The place is ugly, the food is gross, the patrons are gross... All in all, a really gross place. I&#39;m feeling a bit nauseous just thinking about it.<br><br>I had the shrimp scampi. Pasta was a good bit beyond al dente, and definitely not cooked to order. Shrimp was a little overdone and somewhat bland, and the breading was just nasty. I took the breading off and just ate the shrimp.<br><br>Dessert was definitely the best part, but really nothing to write home about. I had some kind of layered chocolate cheesecake, chocolate cake and brownie thing.<br><br>The decor kind of put me off. I had trouble pinning down exactly what they were going for. My guess would be &#34;ugly.&#34;<br><br>Don&#39;t go.

Now don&#39;t get me wrong, CF&#39;s cheesecake is phenomenally good (especially the Snickers Cheesecake!), but everything else their overpriced menu is just okay. <br><br>I&#39;ve been here several times and have tried a number of different sandwiches and pastas, and although they were certainly good, there was nothing special about them, and I can recall even getting served a cold dish of Three Cheese Pasta before.  It&#39;s pretty unlikely that you&#39;ll have a bad meal at this establishment, as everything&#39;s decent at its worst, but there&#39;s nothing truly special behind the glitz and glam of the well-spoken Cheesecake Factory.

Eek! Methinks not, for sure.<br><br>I went with a friend. The entrance was overly crowded with people just standing around waiting for the buzzer thingies to buzz. After standing for five minutes in the crowd, I realized I should probably just push my way to the desk, which I did. The hosts and hostesses were scrambling around in and out of the desk and when I asked for a table for two, one of them handed me a buzzer, took my name, and told me the wait would be at most 30 minutes. Okay. My friend wanted to try Cheesecake Factory and it was lunch time, so I wasn&#39;t too bothered by the wait time.<br><br>So we waited. After 30 minutes the buzzer had not buzzed. We kept saying that it would probably beep any minute now and ended up waiting over an hour before we confronted them. Of course, we were a little dumb for waiting so long to do so. The hostess apologized and told us it would be another ten minutes. Thank goodness it ended up only being a short minute.<br><br>We were seated and ready to order. Unfortunately it took quite a while for our waiter to arrive. I asked for recommendations, which I usually do as I enjoy hearing their opinions. With his opinion I ordered the fish tacos with fried fish and a cup of the soup of the day, some sort of corn chowder. My friend ordered the miso salmon. The waiter came out with a  bowl, not a cup, of the soup. I really wasn&#39;t in the mood to point it out so I ended up paying for the bowl. The soup was pretty good. The fish tacos were not. The tacos were bland and I actually only ate one, gave one to my friend and left the plate half full. I didn&#39;t really want to take it back with me. My friend&#39;s miso salmon was really good at first. But then it started getting too heavy. I think they need to add more vegetables to the dish; it&#39;s basically salmon on top of rice with five snap peas.<br><br>it was my friend&#39;s birthday so on the way to the restroom, I let my waiter know. We got a complimentary cheesecake and that was the highlight of the meal. The cheesecake, of course, was delicious.<br><br>With the extremely long wait, bland food, and expensive bill, I was thoroughly disappointed in this Cheesecake Factory. The waitstaff were not particularly attentive and it seemed too disorganized. I don&#39;t think I will be returning.

Lousy service.  Waited on hold on the phone forever just to place a take-out order to take back to my hotel.  The hostess wasn&#39;t prepared when she finally did pick up the phone.  Then, the entree I wanted was &#34;not available&#34;.  Once I picked up the order, the hostess wasn&#39;t sure that our salads were prepared correctly; some confusion ensued.  The food turned out fine - of the quality expected at Cheesecake Factory - but this location really has some customer service work to do.  This should have easily been a 4-star review.

Decadence never tasted so good! This wasn&#39;t the first Cheesecake Factory that we have been to and I usually try to avoid chain restaurants unless I get out-voted,LOL. However, the Cheesecake Factory is now one of the places we actively seek out when we need to satisfy our sweet tooth. This particular CF is located in a really nice mall near the Prudential Center in Boston. We went on a weeknight around 7pm and it was as crowded as you would expect on a weekend. I had the Red Velvet Cheesecake and the wife had the Tiramisu Cheesecake, both were equally delicious. You get very generous portions for the price and I can tell by taste of their cheesecake that they use high-quality ingredients. <br><br>The only advice I would give about going here is don&#39;t order the cheesecake for desert if you have already eaten here or somewhere else because they give you so much that the cheesecake is a meal in itself,LOL. Also, if you are sensitive to sugar, they have a cheesecake here that is sweetened with Splenda, which I think I may try since eating their cheesecake more than once or twice a month might give me diabetes,LOL. The staff here was very friendly and the service was quick although I would watch your order to make sure they got it right since they are so busy, the person in front of us had some order problems and you could tell it was because the staff are so busy.

ive been here three times.  each time the food was mediocre.  the servings are big but not enough to offset the price and mediocrity.  ive had better spaghetti from supermarket can sauce.  don&#39;t even bother with the asian food (obviously -- i shouldve known), and the ribs were dry<br><br>the cheesecake is good though, but you dont have to get a table for that
Service is wonderful but food is just okay. They are kind to children and the menu is kid-friendly.

I wish i could write a review for the food separate from the cheesecake. <br><br>3 star food, 5 star cheesecake.<br><br>Long wait on a late Thursday night for a large group. Make a reservation, this place gets hoppin&#39;.<br><br>The food was nothing to write home about, you get a little less than what you pay for. The real draw to this place is the cheesecake. If you do choose to go here for dinner, save ample room for the cheesecake. Huge selection and very rich.

It&#39;s kind of amazing that Cheesecake Factory can cater to so many tastes, and do a decent job with each. <br><br>I ordered the Shrimp &amp; Bacon Club (without the bacon) and it was very good! I&#39;m not really one to care about chain places, but today I was impressed with my food.<br><br>We shared the caramel macadamia nut cheesecake which was also very good. It&#39;s hard to screw up a lot of sugar and tasty things put together though.<br><br>I can definitely say that the portions are huge. I think for every 2 people you can just order 1 dish.<br><br>Overall, I don&#39;t see any reason to come back to Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s good for groups, especially in terms of catering to different tastes, but beyond that, there is nothing that wows me to the point where I would be excited to go back.
Food is always awesome. Chicken and biscuits are delicious. Also love the sheppards pie-everything is good ! The manager was really cool last night-I had a slight problem that was solved really well.

This doesn&#39;t even deserve one star. Had the worst experience here. First the server took a very long time coming to greet the table. She never wrote down our order and a minute later she came back to ask my friend what he had ordered again. My food came and it was wrong so I told her and she seemed annoyed that I was complaining. For her screw up. Then she brings me the correct food and I take one bite and there is a hair in it! When I brought it to her attention she asked to see the hair. Then said she couldn&#39;t see it. I just asked her to bring me a cheesecake menu so I can order dessert and go home. She had an attitude the whole time. The manager came out at my request and assured me that she would talk to her. And I was very upset when my cheesecake wasn&#39;t comped. After such a bad experience, I felt like that was a very reasonable request. And luckily, the red Sandrea and the Tara Massoud cheesecake were both out of this world amazing! That was the only thing that saved my night.

Hit or miss. I went one week and ordered the chicken teriyaki and it was absolutely amazing. So I decided to go back with some family that was visiting and was very regretful that I did so. I ordered the chicken teriyaki again, but this time it came as one huge slab of chicken instead of cut into strips, and was very dry and lacking flavor, but the most disappointing thing was the rock hard rice, it was visually undercooked, I&#39;m not sure how something so obvious and simple slipped through multiple employee&#39;s hands. Server forgot our appetizer, and when I asked if there was a house drink he could suggest he looked very confused. We tried to ask recommendations for food and he had nothing to suggest, strange for an upscale restaurant.

I&#39;ve never come out of the Cheesecake Factory with a bad experience. I hate giving a chain 5 stars but gosh, it&#39;s just so good. You have so many options it&#39;s overwhelming. Whether you want pasta or fish or sushi or just &#34;small bites&#34; they have it all. Not to mention that their cheesecake is out of this world. Is there any place that has better cheesecake, seriously?<br><br>I&#39;ve recently rediscovered this place for it&#39;s Happy Hour &#34;Bar Menu&#34;. They have a TON of options to choose from and they are all 5 bucks!! Not only do you have a lot of options but the food is REALLY good and there is a LOT of it. Win win in my book! The cocktails are a little on the expensive side though. So if you are looking for a cheap night I would recommend just eating here and drinking elsewhere. But the drinks are good so I&#39;d have to recommend at least getting one.<br><br>Expect to wait for quite a while if you are going at night. That even goes for Monday. Everyone and their mom seems to want to go here. Friday/Saturday night? Forget it unless you get there early. But it makes sense because they are oh so delicioso!

For a chain, Cheesecake Factory is a no-brainer.  This location is great - it&#39;s huge, and sooo much better than the Cambridgeside one.  That said, for a name like &#34;cheesecake factory,&#34; you&#39;d think their simple strawberry cheesecake would be good...nope.  My dinner was great, my beer was great, my server was great, but the cheesecake was LAME.<br><br>Try the bistro shrimp pasta though, yum!
The food is definetly not worth the price.  <br><br>I will admit that the cheesecake is good (esp peanut butter one)  &amp; i love their drinks, but for dinner I&#39;d go somewhere else first.

Out of all the cheesecake factory locations I&#39;ve been to, this one is the best.  The service was great, perfect lighting, and I didn&#39;t even think the portions could get any bigger but the portions at this location is greater than the portions I get in California.  <br><br>My family usually splits an order of Baja Chicken Tacos and Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta. Their Baja Chicken Tacos are served absolutely divine. Three marinated grilled chicken in soft tacos to perfection placed with grilled onions and lettuce. Black beans, salsa, guacamole, and rice accompany the mouth-watering tacos. Usually 1 taco fills me up right away. <br><br>Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta is what I would recommend to vegetarians. It&#39;s a huge plate and it has artichokes and eggplant (I ask them to not put in eggplant).

I mean it&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory, the same in Boston, Los Angeles, and Tokyo likely Mars. <br><br>Location-wise this place was central and is HUGE. Almost as big as the one at The Grove in Hollywood.<br><br>Service-wise, this location was more than up to par. They were super-cordial, and upon looking at our IDs for drinks, realized it was one of our birthdays and brought a brownie sundae on the house.<br><br>Sadly, they no longer deliver via grubhub or the like....

I used to love the Cheescake Factory, but things have changed...the last time was especially bad. <br><br>The wait was annoying. We were told 30 minutes, and it was 50 minutes. After being called up, we had to wait against the wall for another 5-10 minutes. <br><br>We were starving but the bread, &#34;was still in the oven&#34;, and we didn&#39;t get it until after we had already gotten our meals. <br><br>The waiter brought out the wrong meal for one of my friends. He took it away but did not return for 20-25 minutes. When he did return, he attempted to place down the dish, which tipped over, resulting in sauce all over the table. <br><br>As I walked home, I had a horrible stomach ache.<br><br>I&#39;m really sad, because Cheesecake Factory used to be a favorite!
You&#39;ll have something to please everyone here.  Wide selection.  Their cheesecake is of course, a big draw, but I love their appetizers especially their avocado egg rolls.

I haven&#39;t gone to Cheesecake Factory in more than a year, and I would like to write about today&#39;s experience. I ordered the BROCCOLI AND CHEDDAR soup, and was greeted by tiny hard pieces of broccoli stalks inside the soup. It was annoying. Like chewing straws of ...hay.<br><br>The bread was as usual...delicious.<br>I had the herb crusted filet salmon. It was good...I didn&#39;t get to finish it because the soup ruined it for me.<br><br>But other than that...Cheesecake Factory is a nice place to go to if you haven&#39;t gone in awhile. I really want to grab brunch there though...unfortunately I never wake up early enough (it ends at 2:00pm). Sad huh?
Good Place,Awesome Staff,Delicious Food,Fantastic $$$$

Cheesecake Factory has to be one of my favorite &#34;Go-To&#34; Places of all time. I&#39;ve been to them in NJ, MA, VA, MD, and a few other states I&#39;m sure.<br><br>I have one simple rule when I go to Cheescake Factory (no, its not try to eat an entire cheesecake by myself) its that I will never try something on the menu twice. Just won&#39;t do it. There has to be over 200 menu items everyday, so I think its an injustice to limit myself to the same thing. I have never had a dish that I have not liked here<br><br>The last time I came was for dinner on a Saturday night in March maybe. We were seated within 10 minutes which was a surprise. Its inside the Prudential Center, so there&#39;s plenty to do while you wait anwyay, but definitely come early because this place gets PACKED!<br><br>We started out with chips and guacamole. Now, I am not a guacamole &#34;snob&#34; whatsoever (I probably couldn&#39;t even tell you the difference between really good and really average guacamole to be honest), but I thought this stuff was pretty good. They came to the table and mashed it up right in front of you and gave us plenty of chips. You can get mild, medium, or spicy, but we opted for mild and I thought it was great. Pretty sure that was less than $10 too which is great. <br><br>Today I ordered Stuffed chicken Tortillas and they did not disappoint. As usual the plate was HUGE! Tortillas were fresh and bursting at the seams with chicken, cheese, peppers, onion, and cilantro. It was served with black beans and a sweet corn cake that was awesome! I&#39;m not too familiar with Spanish/Mexican cooking but that corn cake was just so good- a perfect complement to the spiciness of the salsa.<br><br>Honestly, do not even remember what my friend got because I was so engulfed in my food. In the past I&#39;ve had Huevos Rancheros for brunch which was delicious (and huge..actually I&#39;m going to stop saying meals are huge because I am pretty sure its implied at this point. You do NOT go to this place on a diet).  I&#39;ve had Jambalaya Pasta with seafood where the sauce was perfectly made and you could really taste the layering of flavors. I&#39;ve had the little pizzettes with sausage and ricotta as a &#34;small plate&#34; that were awesome. Corn tamales are delicious. <br><br>One day after purging myself with fast food, I even ordered a salad at this place (Me...a salad?). To this day, the Factory Chopped Salad is one of my favorite salads ever. Its actually listed as an appaetizer but I couldn&#39;t even finish it. Lettuce, avocado, bacon, apples...everything you could want in a salad and more.<br><br>Do I even need to describe the cheesecake? Heavenly. My favorites so far have been Red Velvet, Oreo Crumble, and Dutch Apple. The truly unfair part is by the time I&#39;m always done eating my dinner, I barely have room to split a slice with somebody! And I&#39;m not talking &#34;I think I ate too much I better stop here&#34; full...I&#39;m talking &#34;I cannot physically open my mouth anymore because there is so much food inside me&#34; full. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory is just good. They serve meals from all kinds of backgrounds in huge portions. Is the most authentic food you&#39;ll ever eat? Definitely not. Is it absolutelt delicious food that will keep you coming back when you get the craving? Uh-huh. Oh yea no doubt about it.

I come to this location quiet often and I&#39;m always pleased with the food and service.  However, this past Sunday we had a terrible experience.  The waiter was very personable and checked in with us often but I just don&#39;t think he listened to anything we said. <br><br>I have a very serious food allergy and told him what I was allergic to and if he could check with the chef to make sure everything was okay.  (A few restaurants in Boston are really good with allergies and have a manager or even chef come over to go over what your having and ensure that everything is safe).  We placed our order, we got Buffalo Blasts for our appetizer and it was really good.  For our Main course, my gf got a Teriyaki entrée and I got a bacon cheeseburger and fries.  I&#39;m allergic to sesame seeds and when our food came my burger had a sesame seed bun..  People make mistakes, I get it.. the slip might not have said it or maybe they forgot, but you think the waiter would have noticed..  Anyway, I let him know how serious the allergy was an if I could get another one without the sesame roll.  He took it away and about 10 minutes later a manager came over and apologized.  The burger came back over, it was lettuce and a slab of meat and cheese on the plate.. Where are my fries, my bacon and my bun.  Are you telling me you don&#39;t have plain rolls?  He forgot and brought over a plain  roll and said &#39;oh the fries, yea they umm contain your allergy&#39;.. I&#39;ve ate here a million times, no they don&#39;t.. They need to take allergy&#39;s at the Cheesecake factory much more serious.<br><br>When we got the bill they didn&#39;t comp the burger, they did add it twice and then take one away, which I thought was kind of messed up.. <br><br>When we got home we noticed that our takeout back was covered in teriyaki sauce because they didn&#39;t fasten the lid.  Just an overall bad experience.  Basically we paid $60 bucks for an Amstel light and a tea.<br><br>I&#39;m not one to jump on to Yelp just to write a bad article, but it&#39;s been bothering me that I didn&#39;t complain and still left a decent tip.

I hate coming to the Cheesecake Factory because I never know what I want to eat and then I end up just getting a burger and it&#39;s just ok. I met my sister here for lunch and the host brought us to a booth that I could clearly not even get in lol. I&#39;m 9 months pregnant...there was no way in hell. So when I told him I can&#39;t sit there he&#39;s like &#34;Are you serious?!&#34; I just gave him a look like, are you an idiot?! Lol smh.  <br><br>Anyways he found us a table to sit at and our waiter was super nice. He had a great sense of humor and was very attentive. My sister ordered some fancy salad and a mango raspberry smoothie that looked so amazing.<br><br>I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and it was amazing. The best thing I&#39;ve had in a long time. I want to go back just to have that again. The chicken was very moist and the fried outer layer was perfect! <br><br>I really wanted to check out the red velvet cheesecake but I was too full :( maybe next time!

This was the first Cheesecake Factory I have been to and I have to say, this place is amazing!  The wait was long, but it was totally worth it!  We got the pasta dish and the recommended fish dishes.  The food was great!  When dessert came, we got 3 different flavours of cheesecake and it was so amazing.<br><br>Best place for cheesecake ever!  Highly recommended!

There&#39;s not a lot of special in this restourant. I don&#39;t understand why people crazy about it? I love seafood! and i decided to try salmon. That was a bad decition. First itr took them like 45 min to make it. I was exiting. and what i get? dry, very salted salmon. And that what i was waiting for so long?  But my friend order Jamaican Black Peper Shrimp and that was good! really! now if i&#39;m going there this is the only food i&#39;m ordering. it&#39;s really tasty! i try to do it by myself at home and i never got that taste. and i love their warm homemade bread! i can&#39;t stop myself from eating it. it&#39;s just sooo good. this restourant is not awesome but still have some pluses!

Holy expensive, Batman!<br><br>It&#39;s pre-fab food. What else do I have to say? It&#39;s not bad, some of it is even pretty good, but if I&#39;m going to lay down some cash for a night out, it&#39;s going to be at an independent place where they take time and love with their food.<br><br>The Cheesecake of its name sake can&#39;t really be messed with, I will admit. Good stuff. Stop by for dessert sometime, but go to some small five table place in the North End to spend your money.

Okay.. I go to Culinary School so maybe I&#39;m a bit of a food snob. But I can appreciate certain chains and this one just doesn&#39;t do it for me. Their salads are HUGE and not that bad - but you can never finish all of it and I for one hate to eat leftover salad.. blegh.<br><br>I&#39;ve had chicken from here once and it was really rubbery, kind of reminded me of &#34;fake chicken&#34;, it was just gross and chewy.<br><br>The only things I like are the appetizers, really. And the chicken tacos aren&#39;t that bad. But when I walk out of here I just feel gross.. the food is so heavy and my body isn&#39;t used to eating like that. But if you want huge portions and just an easy place to go, I guess this isn&#39;t a bad place. But it&#39;s really not worth the long wait at all.

Everything you dream about cheese cake can come to reality here. I mean, they even have two kinds of oreo cheesecakes. How amazing they are!<br><br>Brunch are especially good. But look out for large calories and fat that you will take from each dish. They are really huge...^_^

The Cheesecake Factory is one of the better chain restaurants in the nation.<br>I like this location because it&#39;s so close to everything and very convenient.<br>The wait isn&#39;t very long either.<br><br>Please refer to my review of the Pasadena location for a full review

First of all, you all know Im hard to please, but Im giving it four (4) stars. <br><br>So, I finally gave in and we went there for deserts. We just got them to go, you know to avoid the three hour wait.  The service was great, fast, efficient. We got our deserts in about 60 seconds. My friend  got the trusted godiva cheesecake and I decided to brunched out and ordered the Tiramisu, not the cheesecake, the dessert.  <br><br>The godiva was good, you know that and I dont have to repeat that.  But the tiramisu was finger licking good.  Yes, the tiramusi from Cheesecake Factory. Just chocolatye and creamy and yummy.  For about 5 minutes I actually considered going back and getting another one. <br><br>So, factory, you got two more stars.  Now, take reservations and  get rid of tweens, and all that yucky food, and maybe, just maybe you&#39;ll get another star.

Whenever I order lunch from here, I always have enough food for two days, but its costs a boatload.  Beware the sandwiches or anything served on bread, the bread will be coated in butter or oil.<br><br>Bright spot is the fried zucchini and the baked potato soup...yum<br><br>My office used to go here for luncheons occasionally, and the service and food quality is consistently good-enough.  If you want some unadventurous comfort food, this is the place to go.

The best part of the experience was the quick seating. The one in Braintree is notorious for 40 minute waits. We were seated after about 10 minutes. Our waiter seemed in a hurry, though and was rushing us to order. I didn&#39;t like this. I ordered from the lunch menu, a pasta dish. He basically trashed one of the pasta choices I was going to selected, and pushily suggested I not go for it. Generally just seemed unhappy and was projecting that onto us. We ate, enjoyed the bread, and were out. Good thing I had a CF gift card. I probably won&#39;t spend my own money on that kind of service.

I really do like the Cheesecake Factory, but this one is a little too big for it&#39;s britches.  <br><br>There is never less than a half-hour wait for a seat, and they have lost or delayed pick-up orders the last two times I ordered from them, with no offer of a gift certificate or anything to compensate: the manager just left me standing in the entryway.<br><br>The food&#39;s good, yeah, but why so much plastic?

Sickening food. One star for food. I can&#39;t believe what I ordered (pasta) was so terrible. Basically 1 veggie option. Terrible.<br><br>The reason it gets two stars is the desserts. That&#39;s all. Godiva cheesecake was great.
I just came here for dessert and ordered the pineapple upside down cheesecake and it was DELICIOUS!!! It is a little overpriced but well worth it!

My old roommate and I used to come here at least twice a month for dinner. She&#39;s picky and could always count on the Pasta da Vinci to satisfy her. The buffalo blasts are delicious, even if they&#39;re a heart attack on a plate. I&#39;ve also had their crab cakes and French country salad multiple times, both of which are good. The martinis here are good, if a little weak.<br><br>On the other hand, don&#39;t waste your time for brunch. The aforementioned roommate and I came here a couple of weekends ago and I will never go back. I ordered a bloody mary, and waited about 7 minutes (as a waitress, that&#39;s a VERY long time to wait for a drink) for her to come back, only to inform me that they don&#39;t serve booze until noon. That&#39;s not her fault, but wouldn&#39;t you think she&#39;d know that when I ordered it? It wasn&#39;t busy, so it&#39;s not like she was &#34;weeded&#34; and had other things to do. My eggs benedict were cold, the hollandaise sauce flavorless. However, I couldn&#39;t have sent it back even if I were that bitchy because we weren&#39;t checked on until our silverware was stacked neatly on our plates and ready for lift-off. Jackie had steak and eggs, which she swears is good, but tasted chewy and over-marinated to me. <br><br>I&#39;ll be back for dinner when I&#39;m in need of easy comfort food, but for brunch, I&#39;ll head across the street to cheaper, better Thornton&#39;s.

This chain deserves high marks.  Although most of their foods overpriced, they do accommodate for budget college students with their sandwich menu.  Also, the way I see it, I never actually finish the plate with the huge portions I get, so I take the price, divide it by 2 and see it that way.  Same with the cheesecake slices, I can never finish one on my own so I split it with someone.  When they go for a particular food type, they go completely outside the norm of authentic, but the food still tastes great.  You want authentic (insert food type here), don&#39;t go here.<br><br>My only bad experiences here were either fixable or inevitable.  Found out I was allergic to shrimp, obviously not their fault.  The second was missing the black beans for the factory burrito grande, but they were quick to give a side of that.  The third was ordering Jambalya, only to find out it has shrimp in it (I must&#39;ve been out of it that day, it was clearly written on the menu).  No fuss, they replaced it with a different item at no charge.<br><br>The only downside is the wait to get in when its busy, but the way I see it they are doing everything right, so it has nothing to do with slow service.

So after no luck with a long wait Thursday night, my friend and I decided to stop in on our lunch break today since we work in the Christian Science Center Tower next door. Mid-afternoon on a Monday you get seated right away, always a plus.<br><br>Usually I go for the fish tacos, but today I tried the grilled eggplant sandwich. YUM! First, I should mention, it&#39;s so big and wonderful and cheesy that you can&#39;t really eat it like a sandwich. I had to cut it up and do the knife and fork thing, but I&#39;m not complaining.<br><br>The eggplant was very well seasoned. There was maybe a bit too much red onion but it was very easy to pick off. The roasted peppers and cheese were delicious as well but the best part by far was the garlic aioli butter on the bun. Oh my gosh that was exceptional. <br><br>My friend got a plain burger which was cooked perfectly. He was very happy considering our last attempt to get burgers (see my review of Whiskey&#39;s on Boylston). <br><br>The thing I like about this place is the amazing service. Our waiter was friendly and prompt, not overbearing while still being attentive. He also knew we were on our lunch hour so he did his best to expedite the food, get the check quickly, and even skipped the cheesecake speech since we didn&#39;t have time for dessert.

My husband and I took our 7 month old daughter here today for the first time. We had been before she was born, and always enjoy the food. But now I have a baby there are other things that are important to me in a restaurant too! Our server was great and offered us a high chair and free bananas for my daughter, which was a nice touch. However, when I needed to change her diaper before we left the restaurant I asked another server where the changing facilities were and what type of facilities they had, he said &#34;I don&#39;t know, I&#39;ve never been in the ladies room before&#34;. Erm... Not exactly helpful! I wasn&#39;t expecting him to have been in there, I just assumed working there he might know something about the facilities?! When I got in the restroom there was just a marble surface in a dark area of the room to change your baby... This was obviously not designed by someone who has children! Needless to say, my daughter was wriggling about and bumping her head on the hard surface (even with the changing pad from the diaper bag) and crying because it was so uncomfortable and cold and dark. I had to abandon my plan to change her there and rush outside, calm her down and change her on the grass! Luckily we had already finished our meal and also that the weather was good today, otherwise it would have been really stressful.<br><br>Great food, good place to bring kids but they REALLY need to improve the changing facilities.

Have been to Cheesecake Factory in many other cities, brought a large group of 9. The service was lacking one meal was lost. The food was below the normal standards. The banana cheesecake was served with no bananas, as they were out.  Would not recommend this location for large groups.

Hey y&#39;all. <br>Tonight was the first time I went to the Cheesecake Factory-- and let me just say one thing: it was de-vine!<br><br>Here&#39;s why I loved it:<br>1. They gave me two delicious half-loaves of bread in the beginning of my meal. <br>2. My waiter was handsome.<br>3. They piled on the cheese (I got the California Omelet-- I think there were 4 DIFFERENT kinds of cheeses).<br>4. The ambiance in the room was so fancy, I felt like a duchess.<br>5. The cheesecake!<br><br>My only complaints:<br>1. They only gave me 3 pads of butter for a whole loaf of bread.<br>2. There was no butter on the toast that came with my omelet.<br>3. I could not understand my waiter. (But he was extremely handsome...)<br><br>I would like now to describe what I ate to y&#39;all. Here it goes:<br><br>California Omelet:<br>This was a cheese-y vegetarian de-light. It was certainly scrumptious. The omelet was fluffy and came with a bunch of fresh vegetables, sour cream, avocado, and 4 cheeses baked inside. I thought that the presentation was real nice, and the taste was de-vine. Then, I had the option of potatoes or tomatos on the side and I chose potatoes. They were a bit crispy; seemed a little over-cooked to me, but the seasonings were good. Over all, though, I&#39;ve had better potatoes. The toast that came with it was dry and not buttered, so I did not eat it.<br><br>Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake:<br>This cheesecake was the best I&#39;ve ever had. That&#39;s why I gave this restaurant 4 stars. I didn&#39;t think it deserved it until I ate some of the cake! It came with whipped cream and some chocolate sauce on the plate. Each bite was like fireworks in my mouth/throat. I tell you, I haven&#39;t felt as good as I did while eating that cheesecake in YEARS.<br><br>If you are ever in Boston, you should definitely stop in to this one-of-a-kind restaurant, if not just for the cheesecake!<br><br>God bless.

Wow, some long reviews for this place! <br><br>Overall, I like TCF. It&#39;s a good place to go for lunch, their menu is ridiculously long. But that works for me, as I&#39;m someone who likes options. Lots and lots of options. I just need to narrow it down a bit before I go, or else I&#39;ll wind up sitting there for a while. <br><br>Portions are ginormous, to fit in with their &#34;BIG&#34; theme. Huge restaurant, huge menu, might as well go with huge portions. I can easily make another meal, if not 2, out of my leftovers. <br><br>I usually favor the Symphony Salad for lunch, maybe an app of calamari or the lettuce wraps. And then there&#39;s the cheesecake. Yum. So many options, so little time. <br><br>While I don&#39;t necessarily crave TCF, I have no doubt I&#39;ll be back again.

From the moment we arrived it was crazy.  The hosts didn&#39;t know to give us a beeper or just ask us to stand aside.  We we asked how long it would be one host said 5 minutes the other said 20 minutes.  So after 10 minutes we were taken to our table.  <br>The server was friendly, but not outstanding.  He has to kneel down to take our order because the noise was so loud in the place.<br>Our meals were so so.  Nothing much to write home about. <br>I would only go back to this place if there was no other place to go.

The Cheesecake Factory, as a chain - can be hit or miss.  I have had a great meal at the Providence location, and had a terrible one at the North Shore Mall location.  Still the service and quality of the food, drinks and desert at the Prudential Mall Location (mentioned here), is consistenly solid - and has had me coming back often.<br><br>Most of the time, I avoid the restaurant and head straight to the bar.  They have some truly fantastic bartenders (Walt is the best) and you get your food faster, your drinks faster, lively conversation, and you get to watch the whole operation from a front row seat.<br><br>I will be back soon.

So anyone who knows me knows that I LOVE The Cheesecake Factory.  I used to live in the Greenhouse directly across the street. If I was yelping for those 3 years I would have averaged about 3-5 check-ins a week.<br><br>I digress... I could list a number of great entree&#39;s but the fact is there is something for everyone.  The same goes for their cheesecake (unless you don&#39;t like cheesecake).  I have had just about all of them over the years and have not had a bad one, while I do have some favorites.<br><br>The portions are huge.  You will probably take some home, or waddle out of there.  the mixed drinks are fun as well.  The only downside is there will be a late if you go at the classic dinner times or holidays.  Still it is worth the wait.

The portions were large and very flavorful.   The service was very attentive and went above and beyond.    The bathrooms are a bit dirty and were unstocked.  Being in the business for a number of years, I have always thought the cleanliness of the bathroom indicated the cleanliness of the kitchen.   However,  it was the height of the dinner rush.

Can&#39;t say enough about this place. If you take into consideration the quality of food, portion, selection, atmosphere, price..I would choose this place over any in the world. And I&#39;m dead serious. Bravo cheesecake.

Food experience is typical American, but their dessert is awesome! Their cheese cake are the best cheese cake ever!  Also, the interior decorations  and food display makes you feel this is a high-end restaurant, but the prices are  reasonable.  <br><br>Only bad thing is that there is a l-o-n-g wait before you have to go eat.  Depending on the occasion, the wait is worth the time.

Hey its Friday night, what do you want to do?<br><br>Lets go down to the Pru and wait 3 hours for Cheesecake  Factory!<br><br>Seriously, why do people go here? Every time I walk through the Prudential Center by the T its just a massive amount of people sitting on the stairs, waiting for their buzzers to go off, just to go inside and look through their massive menu.<br><br>I hate it how when people visit Boston its always &#34;ZOMG lets go to Cheesecake&#34;. With so many better options, why endure the wait?

&#34;Eigentlich&#34; mag ich ja individuelle, kleine, niedliche, Restaurants lieber. Auch das Konzept &#34;alles&#34; anzubieten von Burger, Asia, Pizza usw. überzeugt mich nicht wirklich.<br><br> Trotzdem fand ich es hier ganz gut, eine Wahnsinnsauswahl von A-Z, trotzdem gute Qualität, große Portionen, trotz Größe fand ich es nicht hektisch, Personal sehr zuvorkommend und professionell und das was mich zum 4.Sternchen überzeugt hat: die cheesecakes (kann man auch mitnehmen, wenn man sich nicht reinsetzen möchte).

Possibly the worst service ever. The girl took 20 minutes at least to check on us, the place was packed. This place needs to focus less on getting as many people in and out the door as possible, and focus more on quality. My friend&#39;s food was barely cooked, and had to be sent back. Which took an addition 25 min at least. Did i mention we waited 25 min before we were even given a table? Oh? have I got your attention now? Don&#39;t go here. Go to PF Chang&#39;s, legal or anywhere else in the malls. It&#39;s a shame too because the food is decent, as well as the desserts. With service this bad, you can&#39;t make an exception this was really unacceptable.
Great food, great atmosphere. Food is consistent and is always good here. Almost everything on the menu is good. I have been coming here for years, and have always enjoyed it!

Quick walk from our base, actually we stayed at Sheraton and never left the hotel as its connected to mall. Had a Mojito, with Samosas as appetizers, Chicken Marsala fr dinner, prices were reasonable, staff was friendly,love it

I have been here 5 times, and it wasn&#39;t exceptional the last 4 times. So, congratulations on your 1 star.  I guess when a place is too big the servers and cooks can&#39;t keep up. I don&#39;t know who is to be blamed for such a poor experience.  The food doesn&#39;t get to your table on time.  I am done with this place.  This place is a big JOKE. peace out.

As far as chains go, this place is solid. You can refer to Atul Gawande&#39;s New Yorker piece for some of the specifics (and how the healthcare industry could take some pointers from it). Really like their bread (love that it&#39;s warm) and their pasta (had the spicy chipotle chicken pasta minus the chicken).  The BBQ salmon was tender and not overdone.  Tuna carpaccio was tasty and well-dressed.  Shrimp jambalaya was good if you like shrimp (I don&#39;t). The servers were prompt and industrious though a little awkward.  Particularly liked the Reese&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake. My only complaint is that a lot of the dishes were dressed with extraneous fried onions or what I can only describe as julienned tortilla chips.  Oh, and I&#39;ve had garlic breath since last night and I can&#39;t for the life of me figure out what I ate that had garlic in it.

Overpriced mediocre food.  I had a tough time finding anything good on the menu. The menu is like a phone book.  I decided to have the Tomato Basil pasta. It was really awful.  The chicken was drenched in Basil.  The sauce and Tomatoes were very bland. The pasta was overcooked.  I was not impressed. I did enjoy the lemonade I had with my terrible meal. The service was decent. I will not be back and I wouldn&#39;t recommend this  establishment.
one of the best places to eat. the menu offers a lot of options.  the kobe burger is simply amazing.

I had a new hire lunch here during my first week at my new company. All I wanted was just a large garden salad, without crutons/cheese- I knew my options were limited because I am vegan and have a gluten allergy. The first time i went there I asked if the balsamic dressing was vegan- I was told by wait staff that it was and trusted them as I thought they knew what they were talking about. The next time I went I asked about the dressing again, which were gluten free and vegan. They have no gluten free/vegan dressings- how could that even be with that large of a menu? Come to find out the waiter told me the balsamic dressing has honey in it- the waiter from the previous time told me it did not. It would be helpful for people with food allergies to have a seperate menu like other chain resturants do- bertuccis, not your average joes, burtons- these all have way smaller menus but offer way more information at the location for everyone&#39;s knowledge instead of having to rely on the staff. I can go to dinner at several different locations around the prudential center and not have any issues with ordering out. not good.

I like the CF for the free bread, the good Cheesecake, and the hefty portions. I come to the CF more often than I should. I celebrate almost every occassion here. I&#39;ve never had much to complain about other than the occassional bad waiter/waitress or the waitstaff forgetting to refill my drink. <br><br>I went earlier this week and had a bill of $21.24. I paid in cash and change. I was told by the waitress to take my change back as she did not want the 24 pennies to jingle in her pocket. IMO the waitress should have just taken the pennies and used it as change for other customers that paid in cash or just not made such a big deal about it. She had the audacity to ask &#34;You don&#39;t have a quarter?&#34; and to say &#34;Oh, no tip?&#34;. I always leave tip unless I&#39;ve had bad service - she provided decent service other than not refilling the drink until I was practically done with my meal. I was going to leave tip but she called me out on it just because I did not put $25 rather than exactly $21.24.<br><br>I try to be exact w/ the bill b/c I have had previous waitstaff pocket the change which has ranged from $4 - $10. I don&#39;t order expensive meals that would require such a large tip so that is why I pay in exact change so that the waitstaff does not &#34;run off&#34; with my change as tip. To make it short, this waitress completely embarassed me by hassling me for a quarter and telling me to keep my change and then immediately asking about her tip. All she served was an appetizer and a dessert it is not like she has to hassle me for a tip of a party of 10 or something. It&#39;s ridiculous.<br><br>I also went to the CF at this location for 5 de mayo. I had a waiter who was completely incompetent and rude. I was waiting for someone else to join me and he kept bugging me to order despite that I had only been waiting 10 minutes for my guest to join me. He did not bring out my guests Sam Adam&#39;s beer. When we reminded him about the beer he brought out the wrong one in the wrong glass. He took the bread away even though we were still eating it. He hurried us with the bill.<br><br>Point blank: I am definitely going to think twice before heading to this location.

If you have never been to Cheesecake Factory, make sure you pencil in some SERIOUS menu reading time, for it can take you over 20 minutes to get through the entire menu!<br><br>My ultimate favorite menu item is the Barbeque Ranch Chicken Salad (i get the dressing on the side...all of their dressings are made form scatch!)
Stupid restaurant, put us in line for 45 mins and Just skipped us for no reason. And kept us waiting for another 40 minutes!  Have to yell at them to get served! Never go gain!

I have been to this location a couple times for dinner.  The service has always been good and the food is consistently good.  It is pretty standard if you are familiar with the chain.  The menu is deep and there is plenty of variety to order from.  The portion&#39;s are huge!  I will likely be back there!
Got my order wrong, gave me an old cheesecake, and, above all, made me physically sick from their fish dish.

Let me first say that I&#39;ve been to many different locations of Cheesecake Factory, and I think this is the worst one I&#39;ve been to so far. We had a fairly large party, so we tried to make a reservation, but I guess they don&#39;t do that? Since we were there on a Saturday night, we ended up waiting a very long time and splitting our party into several different tables in different sections of the restaurant. Also, this is the most crowded I&#39;ve ever seen a Cheesecake Factory--ridiculous. <br><br>Anyway, our waiter was actually really awesome, patient, and quick, which is why I didn&#39;t give them 2 stars. I ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta, which I have had at several other locations and normally love. Tonight, however, it was super salty and there was a huge sprinkling (more like dumping) of cheese in the middle, which was odd because I&#39;ve never had cheese in this dish unless I specifically asked for it. Overall, it made it salty and greasy, and unappetizing. The cheesecakes were pretty standard for CF, though, so at least that was comforting.<br><br>Bottom line? There are so many other great places to eat nearby, so skip this Cheesecake Factory unless perhaps you come for lunch on a random weekday or something.
Food poisoning. Had the crusted salmon. Threw up three times. Thanks cheesecake factory.

There are some places that I just don&#39;t go on my own choosing. However, when I&#39;m with someone fun and they choose one of those locations, I often go along with the plan just because it makes them happy. The Cheesecake Factory may be one of the best examples of this. Let&#39;s face it...WOMEN LOVE THIS PLACE. I don&#39;t know why, but they do. So when I came into Boston for an evening and my female friend was &#34;really hungry,&#34; she chose to go here because it was also a short walk from her place. This may be the largest Cheesecake Factory I have ever visited and there are certainly enough employees running around to cover all the tables. My friend knew exactly what she wanted from past experiences and our drinks and food came out accurately and at a very good pace. She was very happy when we left...so that alone means it was a good experience and it was also a good place for us to catch up as the noise level overall was very average to low in the restaurant. For the record, those Fried Chicken Sliders sure taste a lot like Chick-Fil-A to me...and I&#39;m not complaining at all.
They have great food there.The only problem for me is that some times I would usually get a rude waiter but there are some that are excellent.

I am usually a huge fan of The Cheesecake Factory, but this location really disappointed me. I had a southwest chicken sandwich and ate half of it until realizing that it was raw. I showed it to my waitress, who reacted really insensitively to the situation.  The manager reacted appropriately, giving his card and not making me pay for the dinner, but I left very disappointed and a bit scarred.  I would eat at many other places ahead of this place in downtown area.

We split a couple of appetizers and I got a lunch-size pasta plate. We split a slice of red velvet cheesecake for dessert. The food was well prepared and plated, if pretty standardized. I was satisfied with portions and prices. The staff were very enthusiastic and friendly, but not necessarily the most helpful and attentive. I&#39;d eat here again.

We usually go to the Galleria and have a decent meal.  I have a problem eating in dark restaurants.  Make me wonder what I am not suppose to see.  Tonight we went to the Prudential and because it was so late I decided to have breakfast.  Big mistake.  One egg over easy with an english muffin on the grill took 40 minutes and 3 tries to get it right.  After all of that I still could not eat the egg that was not cooked and the whites just ran off the plate.  I did eat the muffin that came back the second time after 15 minutes burnt but I was hungry.  My guess the evening cooks don&#39;t know how to make breakfast.  Maybe Cheesecake management should take it off the night menu and leave it for the morning crew (of course I have never had breakfast there in the morning so who knows???)  or properly train their night cooks.  Sorry Cheesecake... have to say it like it is.
I have been there many times. My favorite food is their clam chowder only served on Friday! It&#39;s the best!

As the food at Cheesecake is pretty much always the same, which isn&#39;t a bad thing, this review is more focused on the service. We have been to this location many times and always had decent service. I understand their location makes it for a much busier location, however, I find their service poorer than other Cheesecake locations we&#39;ve been to. Even on a quiet weekday afternoon I find that the service is slow. They make up for it with friendliness, but that only goes so far. With all the fantastic restaurants in the vicinity, only go here if you are craving the huge portions and food you&#39;re used to, or if you&#39;ve never been to Cheesecake Factory. Otherwise, try one of the dozens of non chain restaurants on Boylston Street.

I took my daughter to this location on National Cheesecake Day and was surprised by how quickly the line moved. Our wait was about 30 minutes but Hillary the hostess made it seem like less. She kept checking on us and giving us updates on how much longer the wait was going to be. Our server, Tim, was very busy but what I liked most about him was that he introduced himself to us the moment we sat down and informed us he&#39;d be right with us. I resent going to restaurants where you&#39;re ignored for about 15 minutes, which seem like 30 by the time you&#39;re acknowledged. Tim was right over with our menus...even though we know this menu, the fact that we were having a great experience made his dinner suggestions seem deliciously new. Dinner was wonderful and of course the decadent delights (cheesecakes) were the icing on the cake. A big thank-you to Hillary and Tim for making our evening memorable. When my daughter comes back from her semester abroad, we are definitely coming in to see you :-) Cheers!

After reuniting with my closest friends who live across the country, we decided to spend the day in Boston and come here for dinner. Despite the fact it was a busy Saturday night, we only waited a few minutes and received a table outdoors in the back with our own little area. Our waitress greeted us immediately but unfortunately to our surprise the next half hour or so we never saw her again.She arrived to take our order but she did not even realize that she had not even took our drink orders down. After placing our meals we tried to make the best of the situation and did not want to hold her accountable since she seemed busy. When we finally did receive our food, one of the meals was not made correctly but due to our waitress commonly taking off, my friend was too afraid to send it back in hopes she would never receive her fixed meal. We couldn&#39;t leave without Cheesecake but we had our doubts on it taking forever. In the mean time, the waitress taking care of the table across the way, had dropped both of their meals and left it there for the remainder of the evening it thinking twice to clean it up. When we did receive our dessert, our waitress did not check in on us to even realize my friend did not receive a fork. With her not in plain sight for over 10 min she took it upon herself to run next door and get a spoon from cold stone creamery. Overall, it was an experience I&#39;ll certainly never forget....

I was very disappointed with the quality of the food. So greasy and fatty, no wonder they have a special &#34;low-cal&#34; menu. I went with a friend and both of us ordered burgers, the buns were soaked in butter and the burger was dry and overcooked. Terrible experience. If you go for the cheesecake, it is ok, just ok. For a place called &#34;cheesecake factory&#34; I expected more. Won&#39;t be back.

I want to start off by saying the food was wonderful as usual. I went with my family and unfortunately it was my mother&#39;s first time at The Cheesecake Factory. We went around 4:30 PM on Saturday and the staff was terrible. They messed up orders one after the other and the waiter was quite rude. I haven&#39;t had this experience at other  locations but I will not be recommending this poor excuse for a Cheesecake factory experience to others.

Samd ole same for a chain. Large servings for the price. Known for their cheesecake which is a really large variety. Some how it seems their food isnt as tasty as when I was in college, or maybe because I dine out more often, not sure..and it varies by location. Usually order same stuff, shrimp scampi, skirt steak, pepper shrimp, nacho cheese, teriyaki chicken, can&#39;t go wrong (or can depends on location)

Surprisingly good food for such a commercial chain. Their cheesecakes are decadant and delightful. Always worth the calories and fat. Try as many flavors as possible, you&#39;ll almost never go wrong. Their portions are massive and it&#39;s almost always better to share. I love their rye bread, YUMMYYYYY! Oh, and their drinks.... Pricey but excellent, and so STRONG. I think I was pretty buzzed after one of their over-sized margaritas. I recommend the cobb salad and the Godiva chocolate cheesecake and, of course, the margaritas.

For a very crowded and popular place, the service here is great. I have been to many large group parties here and the servers are very accommodating! Huge, affordable entrees and a menu that&#39;s so extensive, it&#39;s practically a book!

Usual corner stones of the CCF, overwhelmingly good service, huge portions, and slightly upscale atmosphere. I would say the food is slightly more than you would pay for in a typically sit down chain, but the huge portions, and the surprising quality of the food makes it more than worth the price. I would go there for a meal whenever there is one near me.

I love Cheesecake Factory because I think the interior is great, their service has been awesome on the two times that I have been there and best of all amazing food with gigantic proportions :)<br>I highly recommend if you haven&#39;t tried it yet! Its always busy so dont mind if you have to wait a bit because its worth it!

This is where I go for a girlie date. We each order an appetizer and split everything (1 drink and one app and tip = about $20 per person). And, surprisingly, they make some pretty fantastic drinks. Granted, I rarely ever order cheesecake as the portions are so huge, it&#39;d have to be a separate &#34;We&#39;re just here for the cheesecake, ma&#39;am.&#34; It does get a little crowded but I don&#39;t mind, we usually go at off times anyways :)

I seriously do not get the hype surrounding Cheesecake. What&#39;s the big deal?? Everyone goes here, for every occasion imaginable. Tourists who probably have Cheesecake back home come here. Whyyy?? You&#39;re in a new city, so explore the exciting dining options the city has to offer!<br><br>So why did I find myself waiting over an hour for a table here? Because I happened to have a gift card--a prize for a cooking competition I won that was sponsored by the school. Long story short, we were told that there was no balance left on the card and that it was bought at a grocery store rather than at a location. They called the number on the back, and apparently the card was never scanned, pretty much implying that it had been stolen. They couldn&#39;t do anything without a receipt, so I ended up having to foot the bill when I would never even had gone in the first place if it weren&#39;t for the gift card. Yes, of course I know that this is not the fault of Cheesecake Factory. I just thought it&#39;d be a good story to share. :} Although you can imagine how that just topped off our night of disappointment....<br><br>So the service wasn&#39;t bad, and they handled the above pretty well. But reviewers are on point when they mention the fake smiles and niceties of the people working there. When our waiter came by once, I said we were debating between these two appetizers, clearing expecting a recommendation, but he just waved us off with a &#39;I&#39;ll just give you more time.&#39; Other than that, it was aight.<br><br>On to the food/drinks...here is what we got in order of tastiness:<br><br>- Pomegranate Mojito: tasty goodness, although lacking in alcohol for such a large glass. Price wasn&#39;t bad for what you get, though.<br>- Beets with Goat Cheese (under their &#39;small plates&#39; menu): description says &#39;fresh beets, apples, baby arugula, and pecans.&#39; It was tasty, but maybe they&#39;re hinting at something by not putting goat cheese in the description...?<br>- Strawberry Creamsicle: tasty like a shake, but again lacking in alcohol for such a large glass.<br>- Bread: definitely better warm, as I&#39;ve had in the past.<br>- Fries: comparable to McDonald&#39;s fries. You can take that however you want to.<br>- Sliders: thin pieces of meat not even formed into patties; obvious they were just scrapped together from a larger patty.<br>- Chocolate Coconut Cream Cheesecake: I swear the size of their cheesecake slices have gotten smaller over the years. So chocolate coconut cream sounded really good to me, but maybe I should&#39;ve assumed there would be coconut flakes even if they weren&#39;t in the description. I love coconut and coconut flavor, but I hate those nasty little flakes.<br>- The Navajo sandwich: we were debating between this and the sliders or just the beef ribs...boy do I wish we had gone with the beef ribs. I&#39;m a sucker for variety though, and having two dishes instead of one somewhat appealed to me more at the time. The dry and tasteless chicken was the worst part, and the sandwich as a whole was really nothing special. <br><br>All in all, the food sucked. We should&#39;ve just stuck with drinks and maybe another small plate.<br><br>So we all know how long and inefficient their menu is, but I think the biggest annoyance was not having prices listed under the cocktail section. I had to pick out the ones I wanted so the waiter could ask the bar, and it&#39;s not like I&#39;m going to do the same with each one until I found one with a suitable price... Maybe they should stop taking ads for their menu to make room for listing the prices for everything. Including the cheesecakes, since all they have now is a range of what it might be. I felt like I was flipping through a program booklet rather than a restaurant menu.<br><br>------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br><br>I just had two leftover sliders that were much tastier broiled with cheddar cheese, toasted bun-tops, and ketchup/fancy mustard, washed down with a glass of wine. Can&#39;t say the same for the fries, but that&#39;s to be expected with leftover fries. I also just had a few bites of the cheesecake, and guess what I found? A nice, long strand of hair sticking out of it. Gross.
Food was overpriced, but still good. The wait is a bitch though (but isnt it always at TCF) The cheesecake is decadent.

the food here is whatever... alot of it anyway. they do have some true gems on this menu though. i would recommend:<br>avocado eggrolls<br>shrimp summer rolls<br>guacamole app.(made to order and very good)<br>french country salad<br>chopped salad<br>pear and endive salad<br>seared tuna tataki salad(maybe the best thing they have)<br>they have some good pizzas too<br>mesa chicken <br>beef ribs<br>some of the fish selections<br>garlic noodles<br>rigatoni putanesca<br>chicken salad sandwich<br>cuban sandwich(nothing like the real thing but still not bad)<br>and a few other things<br><br>if you crave desserts then this place will definitely take care of it for you...<br><br>chocolate tower truffle cake<br>godiva cheesecake<br>banana cheesecake<br>lemon raspberry cheesecake<br>traditional tiramisu<br><br>stay away from the carrot cake and the strawberry shortcake which seem to be so popular... unless you truly do not give a fuck about yourself. the carrot cake weights in at a wopping 1800 calories and the short cake not to far behind<br><br>it isnt very hard to have a full meal here and reach the 4000 calorie mark..so watch it.<br><br>and also...<br><br>first of all the meals are not prepared at some off site location and shipped in to be reheated. in fact the only things that come in frozen are the pea and carrot mix that goes into the mexican rice the french fries which are made from frozen mashed potatoes and the cheesecakes. everything else is made to order and fresh. if the food seems to be  what ever it is because of the volume of the store and rate at which they crank out these meals. <br><br>if you have severe food allergies then you run the risk of a reaction almost anywhere you go.chances are you will have to wait a bit before you get a table... this is a perfect time to talk to a manager or a kitchen manager about your allergy and what to avoid instead of asking a server  who only gets paid $2.63 and hour and doesnt know a damn thing about the food production.<br><br>if you have ever felt rushed out of someplace late at night maybe it is because you decided to go out to eat right before a restaurant closed. no one wants you there. the servers just want to clean up and get the fuck out or maybe try and catch the last train to avoid having to pay for a cab ride home instead of having to wait on some creepy same side sitters(people that sit next to eachother instead of across when eating) who thought it was a good idea to have a full service meal at 11:55pm on a tuesday.<br><br>there is a time and place for everything... even for the cheesecake factory. enjoy

Why reservations are not accepted at this place is beyond me.  The wait to be seated here is pretty intense for food that just isn&#39;t up to par and is overpriced.  Save your time - time is worth more than money.  So by eating here, not only do you waste money, you waste time.  And that&#39;s a lot of wasting.

Love it. I don&#39;t care if it&#39;s a chain- love it. It&#39;s practically worth going for the brown bread you get before your meal alone! My favorites include the bleu cheese, endive, and carmelized pecan salad (very tasty and filling!), the chicken marsala, the fish and chips, and the dulce de leche cheesecake. A schmeck expensive, but portions are typically huge. <br><br>Only downside for me is the seemingly endless and unavoidable wait if you want to have dinner at any location, especially on the weekends. I recommend that on the weekends, you head to the Pru about 30-45 minutes before you think you&#39;ll be hungry, put your name in, and then shop a little in the Barnes and Noble before returning to the restaurant. Or you could just go for lunch!

Was there with family on Mothers Day.  Crab Wontons were super fishy tasting, even though I&#39;ve had them several times before and they tasted normal.  Entree was disgusting.  The rice had the consistency of bad cream of wheat.  I never have a good experience with this chain except dessert.

This place is great..I&#39;ve only been there once but its still great. I had the teriyaki chicken and the portion was insane. The drinking glasses where huge. My mouth is watering now mmmm.....Well i think I should head out now. Enjoy and remember chew twice once for you and one for me !!!!

I don&#39;t expect to give such good reviews of a chain like Cheesecake Factory but I had one hell of a good meal and the service was excellent.  It was a slow night so we didn&#39;t have to wait for a table.   I got the Louisiana Chicken and Pasta and it was outrageously good!  She had another chicken dish that was good.  The drinks were well made.   Wow, good job!

What&#39;s not to love here? There is a big menu and of course for dessert you have so many cheesecakes to choose from. The food is a bit expensive but nothing horrible and the portions are large so it feels worth it. The drinks were also to my liking with some unique cocktails. Good place for a date or just going with friends after a long day shopping. Even better just for dessert. Expect a long wait on Friday and Saturday though unless you go early.
I had the best service ever! Jessica was amazing. I&#39;ve been to this location a bunch of times and never had such a good experience.

I think the food is terribly overpriced for what you get. I have definitely had better cheesecake and entrees elsewhere, but it is a nice place to go with friends. As many other reviewers mentioned, you should expect a wait if you go during a busy time. I think the waitstaff really do try to please the customers, and rushing people in and out of the restaurant is not one of their policies. I have never had a problem with a server trying to push us out the door.
